summary: Javadoc Taglet option missing [javadoc]
description:
Since JDK 1.4, javadoc supports the -tag:cm:description argument which 


provides a nice and simple way of specifying new javadoc tags. 




 http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#tag 




The use of this cmd line argument is not supported in Eclipse (while the


use of doclets seems to be) and could be easily integrated in the IDE,


e.g. as a project preference.




This request is fueled by a university course where we teach programming 


using the contract model - and while the @require and @ensure tags are 


still being kept as "future" tags, we would like to have a simple configuration


option that allows us to generate documentation for the contract model _now_.




 http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp?forum=41&thread=72830

summary: Working directory block should have 3 radio buttons
description:
The working directory block (on the arguments tab) is non-standard. The check 
box below the control enables the controls above it. Instead, there should be 3 
radio buttons: local dir, workspace dir, default. The description of "default" 
should update based on whether there is an associated project.

summary: Create Class QuickFix doesn't create import [quick fix]
description:
I2003-03-07

Using the "Create class" QuickFix, I created a class in a _different_ package. 
An import statement wasn't generated, resulting in an compile error.

Expected behavior:
Eclipse should import the newly created class in case it is created in a 
different package.

Misleading syntax error diagnosis

Build 20030625 + JDT/Core HEAD 0703

If creating a file Enclosing.java with contents from  bug 39506 , containing more 
than one file contents, the diagnose parser will signal a curious misplaced 
construct...

summary: can't debug into class if file/class name identifier has _$$_
[misc] Javadoc view: Should always update to latest element
description:
M2 testing

If the cursor is placed at an element that does not contain documentation, the
view does not update and the documentation of the previous element is kept.

I think this is very confusing: If you don't follow the updating of the view,
you don't realize that the doc does not correspond to the current element. You start
reading and find out that this makes no sense. See also  bug 40301 , that the
current element should be rendered prominently on the first line.

An Idea might to be a 'lock' button on the view tool bar: If it is pressed, the
view does then not follow the selection.

summary: Compare with -> Each other is not enabled
description:
Eclipse 3.0 M1 and Eclipse 3.0 I200306100800

Tried Suse 8.2 and Windows XP

1) Select two java files in the Packages View
2) From the context menu select Compare With.
Note that the option "Each Other" is not enabled.

I use this Compare With Each Other feature all the time to check the 
consistency between platform implementations and to check the consistency 
between simlar components (such as TextTransfer versus RTFTransfer).  Without 
it I can not use Eclipse 3.0 - going back to 2.1.

summary: Subclasses of TextEditor can no longer create custom SourceViewers
description:
In 2.1M5, org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextEditor initializes a private field
called fSourceViewerDecorationSupport inside of createSourceViewer.  We're
substituting a custom subclass of SourceViewer by overriding that method in our
subclass of TextEditor.  Unfortunately, this gives us a NPE when
createPartControl is called later since TextEditor references that field in
numerous places.

summary: Read Only files: 2 dialogs from 'override methods' [code manipulation]
description:
rc1

1. set a file to read-only
2. open the file in the editor, select an import statement
3. invoke 'override/implement methods' from the context menu
4. error dialog shows up, 'file is read only', press ok
5. second dialog comes up, invalid selection, select type...

summary: [Navigator] Close project doesn't remove plus icon
description:
RC2

1. Open Resources Perspective.
2. Select a Project and close it.  Notice that the plus icon remains.  Try to 
click on the + icon and it goes away.

Note, at one point I did get the icon to go away for the first project in the 
Navigator as a result of the Close action.  I'm not sure what I did to get that 
to work, but it only worked for the first project.

summary: Wrong build file generated when $os$ variables are specified
description:
The build file generated for a plugin or a fragment which uses $os$, $ws$, etc. 
in its library name is bogus.

Indeed the variables are not expanded and so instead results in the creation of 
folders called $os.

The solution consists in replacing carefully the appearance of those values 
into the build.xml.

Here is an example of a bogus target:

<target name="$os$/win32.jar" depends="init" unless="$os$/win32.jar" 
description="Create jar: $os$/win32.jar.">
  <property name="destdir" value="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/>
  <delete dir="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/>
  <mkdir dir="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/>
  ...
</target>

summary: Quick diff results vary after reloading
description:
Eclipse 3.0M2

Writing a quick diff provider that uses a remote file as reference, it looks 
like the quick diff view is providing different results after reopening the 
file. Example:

Reference:
01: /**
02:   * First Line
03:   * Second Line
04:   */

If you delete the "second line" (03) then insert a line in front of "first 
line" (02), you get the following result:

01: /**
02:   *
03:   * First Line
04:   */

02 and 03 will now be highlighted as "Changed lines". If you close the file and 
reopen it, line 02 will be displayed as "Added line" and at the bottom of 03 
will be a "Delete line" indicator showing 02 and 03 as deleted content.

summary: Opening a second instance of Eclipse will corrupt .metadata, causing many problems
description:
If you open a second instance of Eclipse, the next time you run Eclipse many
thing will be broken. Removing .metadata will eliminate the problems (although
you, of course, need to reimport your projects then).

Some problems seen:
- Attempting to Search gives the error "No Search Extensions plugged into
workbench or all search pages disabled."
- Attempting to go to the Update Manager results in "Unable to instantiate view:
org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdatesView"
- Attempting to go to a project's property pages gives "No property pages for
<project name>"
- On and on and on...

To Reproduce:
1. Open Eclipse
2. Open a second instance of Eclipse
3. Close the second instance of Eclipse
4. Close the first instance of Eclipse
5. Open Eclipse again and it will be erroneous

summary: "Content assist" action definition ID should be in the platform
description:
The "Content Assist" action is defined in JDT UI's plugin.xml. This action
is presented to the user as being generic - the name doesn't imply that it's
specific to Java and the scope is Global - but other editors can't make use
of this ID when JDT UI isn't around.

This action ID should either be moved into the Platform so that other editors
can tie into the key binding or the action should be renamed so that the user
knows it won't affect all editors.

summary: Status bar space for "read only" in german too short
description:
The statusbar of eclipse shows the "read only" in the lower right.
Translated in german it is "Schreibgeschützt", which consists of more letters 
than "read only", so you see only "Schrei...hützt".

summary: ajde apis are unnecessariy coupled to swing
description:
The AJDE APIs are coupled to javax.swing by org.aspectj.ajde.EditorManager.  
The EditorManager needs to be refactored, have swing specific parts moved to 
org.aspectj.ajde.ui.swing and org.aspectj.ajbrowser.

description:
refactor change method signature does not recognise modifiers like static, 
synchronised etc

summary: Provide build.xml target to export binary plugin.
description:
It's been noted that most Eclipse teams still maintain exportplugin.xml
build files for building their plugins locally instead of using PDE's generated
build.xml file.

The only real problem that the build.xml file has is that it dumps the output
into the input directory. The nice thing about the exportplugin.xml files is
that they build the plugins and output the binary plug-in in a plugin-export
directory that is at the same level as the workspace, not inside it.

I would gladly change to using PDEs build.xml files if there was a way to get
the same behavior. Either by default or by passing in a property to specify
where the binary plug-in should be output.

summary: keybindings not working in StyledText when in plugin (but working externally)
description:
I have an SWT view that uses a StyledText control and binds ctrl-c to copy,
ctrl-v to paste, etc.  It works find outside of eclipse, but when I run it in a
plugin, it gets the keypress for the control key, but no subsequent keypresses,
so control-c comes in as just a press of the control key.  I have tried binding
SWT.HardKeyDown, but that doesn't register either.

I tried running the external app using the libraries in the eclipse
distribution, and it worked fine.  I also tried running the plugin in my regular
eclipse (instead of as a run-time workbench) and that didn't fix the behavior.

might this be related to  bug #40798 ?

I'm using gentoo with gtk+2.2.2 and eclipse build 200307230800

If anyone wants to test with my plugin, email me and I'll send it (it's a meg
and bugzilla seems to have trouble with my web browser's file uploading -- using
MozillaFirebird, BTW).

summary: Open Declaration opens class declaration for local variables
description:
When the cursor is positioned on a local variable representing an object, 
and "Open Declaration" is selected, e.g. from the pop-up menu, Eclipse opens 
the file where the variable's class is declared. Instead, Eclipse should just 
jump to the position of the local variable's declaration.

When the local variable has a primitive type, nothing whatsoever happens.

summary: [EditorMgmt] Eclipse crashes when maximizing java editor when trying to load file
description:
Eclipse crashes when trying to maximize a Java editor.  At the time, the editor
was open on a file that had not yet loaded.  There was significant background
load on Eclipse.  I haven't been able to reproduce this with some quick tests,
but it's hard to generate the same level of load.

STEPS:
-----
1.) Open a Java file in a Java editor.
2.) Move that Java file from one project to another -- preferrably breaking as
many things as possible (e.g., 500+ compile-time errors).
3.) A stub opens in the editor view for the newly-moved file.
4.) Immediately double-click on the title bar for the moved file to cause it to
maximize.


OBSERVED RESULTS:
----------------
The window maximizes, but is empty.  It appears as though the contents are still
being loaded by Eclipse.  The virtual machine then crashes with a small dialog
box.  Unfortunately, I wasn't running from a terminal, so I have no additional
output.

summary: ResizeTracker needs a disabled cursor and default cursor for intial state
description:
When using the ResizeTracker, it doesn't have a disabled cursor set at ctor time
(whereas the DragEditPartsTracker does). When the current command is not 
executable, the cursor remains the same (the default cursor) thus not providing 
the correct feedback to the user.

Also... when you first select the resize handle, the tracker is in the initial
state (command = null) and at this point the default cursor should be returned 
instead of the disabled cursor which is the default behavior inherited from 
AbstractTool (see AbstractTool.calculateCursor().

summary: [Live Sync View] crash in Eclipse causes remote tree to be wrong.
description:
M2
Eclipse crashed and when it restarted there were several conflicts and incoming
changes that were invalid changes. In one cases, the remote was 1.14 and the
local 1.15 and the sync view showed as an incoming change. after
closing/re-opening the view the sync states shown were valid.

summary: Option to export and import break points at the Breakpoints view
description:
Please add an option to export and import break points from the break points 
view. So, it will be possible to share the same advanced breakpoint settings 
(i.e hit count, enable condition and probably other settings) between 
developers.

summary: Background color problem
description:
When changing the background color on the Java > Editor > Syntax page 
from "System Default" to "Custom", and then selecting a solid black, many of 
the Eclipse edit control backgrounds that display code, such as 
the "Externalize Strings" wizard's "Context" edit control and the Templates 
edit controls, don't make use of that black background. This makes the 
contents of those backgrounds difficult to read.

summary: [RFP44] 4.1.7 Transactions spanning multiple life cycle operations
description:
There are two main issues here; 1) OSGi currently only supports the 
install/uninstall/update of one bundle at a time.  There is no inherent ability 
to do "what if" queries to better understand the resolution effects of various 
changes and there is also no way of guaranteeing the atomicity of modifying a 
group of bundles as a unit (e.g., what happens when you fail halfway through 
installing a product consistening of 50 bundles?).

2) since all management operations are individual, there is no obvious way of 
batching BundleEvents.  Currently a BundleEvent is generated for each and every 
individual change to a bundle (install, start, ...).  This is fine if you only 
ever have a few bundles.  Eclipse products can have 1000s of plugins/bundles so 
you can imagine the flurry of events when installing a new function set (for 
example).  Further, to maintain the extension registry structure (an Eclipse 
thing) we catch these BundleEvents, update the extensions registry and 
broadcast more events to registry listeners.   These bundles in turn do 
potentially costly (high overhead) updates to their internal sturctures (e.g., 
in the UI they create and destroy views, menu entries, ...).  

When a whole product is (un)installed some 500 bundles may be at play.  Having 
the UI update its internal structures 500 times would be slow and cause visible 
flicker etc.  Instead, we are hoping for a commit() like action at the 
framework level that will commit a number of changes to the bundle structure.  
In turn, the framework would generate one composite BundleEvent (or some such).

In the current prototype there are two different though similar approaches 
described, the PlatformAdmin service and the Resolver service.  Both allow for 
the formation of alternative states of the runtime (i.e., set of installed 
bundles, resolution state, ...) and the committing of an alternative state to 
become the current/real state.  The main differences revolve around API style 
and the number of possible alternative states.  The PlatformAdmin service 
allows for one "future" state while the Resolver services allows for any number 
of alternatives (some of which may never be committed).

Under the covers there is some amount of packageadmin-like work to be done on 
commit.  It is unclear if commit() should be eager or lazy in terms of 
resolution.  [personal opinion: the Resolver (and perhaps PlatformAdmin) allow 
for detailed setup/investigation of an alternative state before committing.  As 
such, there does not appear to be any value in delaying the re-resolution past 
the commit point].

Note: the Resolver is a very preliminary specification of the idea and there is 
no implementation.

summary: Installing patch via New Updates search doesn't respect missing optionals
description:
Problem: Errors are reported when trying to apply a fix in a valid situation. 
Installing from a bookmark works, but installing via New Updates search does 
not.

Scenario:
FtrA includes optional FtrB.  If FtrA gets a fix applied then installing that 
fix may fail if optional FtrB is not installed.

Steps to reproduce:
Install only FtrA and not the optional FtrB.  Use Help > SoftwareUpdates > 
NewUpdates to search for fixes.  It reports that a patch for FtrA is 
available.  Attempt to install it.  You get an error message saying that the 
ftrB plugin is not found.

What's going on:
During an install from a bookmarked site the user is shown the "optional 
features" panel.  Since FtrB isn't installed, that choice is not selected by 
default.  However, when installing via "New Updates", this panel is bypassed, 
and it seems that the default selections in that case includes FtrB.

I have a working demo of this available if needed.

summary: [formatting] provide a basic text/sgml formatter
description:
Have a basic text formatter that converts leading 
n-spaces to tabs, and maybe leading tabs to n-space.

Current plugins like eclipsetidy may be ok for SGML like, but there is no plain
text n-space-to-tab formatters.

If it can do a quick parse of SGML like files and arrange the indentation too,
that would be great. Not a full XML editor. Just the formatter.
Thanks.

summary: Request for ProjectSelectionDialog to be made public API
description:
We're looking for a project selection dialog exactly like 
ProjectSelectionDialog used in the classpath launch configuration tab, but it's 
internal API. Is there any chance this could be made public API for 3.0 ?

summary: after failed move IFile left in a bogus state
description:
20030813
after a move operation failed ("copy successful but failed deleting resource")
i'm left with an IFile that returns 'false' to 'exists()' but 
its 'location.toFile().exists()' returns 'true'

this state results in a ResourceException when i try to create another file 
with the same name

because of that, CreateCompilationUnitOperation.executeOperation() assumes that 
the file does not exist and does not ask to 'force' when creating the file.

major - our test suites suffer from this

summary: Assert Keyword
description:
THe JDT willnot recognize 'assert' as a keyword, and will not compile it 
period. I would really apreciate it if you would add this keyword.

Thank you.

summary: eclipse hangs during startup refresh of workspace
description:
I noticed recently that eclipse seems to hang during startup. My CPU meter seems
to be running at hundred percent, but nothing is happening.

I noticed that this seems to be happening only when I create certain class files
in my project output path (using the jdk version as used by the eclipse
workbench), outside of eclipse and then try to refresh my workspace - by either
restarting eclipse, or right clicking on my project root directory and hitting
refresh.

The result is that I get the Progress Information dialog which is stuck, with
nothing happening.

This is really counter productive, it would be nice if there is a way to prevent
  this from happening.

summary: Cannot abort a build
description:
If I run any kind of build tool in the CDT (build/make or external build tool like
configure), it cannot be aborted. It must complete. This is especially painful
if one forgets to select the "stop on error" option of the build preferences for
a project.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create external build tool to run configure (for example)
2. run this tool.
3. before it finishes, click "cancel"... The button is disabled, but nothing
really happens until the tool finishes executing.

summary: PDE JUnit: Would like to be able to enable debug tracing
description:
The Run-time workbench launcher supports the enabling of debug tracing. Could 
the PDE Junit launcher support this as well. There have been several times in 
the past when I wanted to enable tracing to better understand a test failure.

summary: breakpoints no longer visible in overview ruler
description:
20030813+0818export
breakpoints are no longer visible in the overview ruler of the editor

major for me

summary: Runtime Arguments improperly passed
description:
When running a JAVA configuration, if you specify a "Program Argument" within 
quotations, the quotations can be dropped when the arguments are passed to the 
JRE.  For instance- if you specify an argument "*", the main() loop of the 
target class should receive the a String with the a single asterix as its only 
character.  Instead, the asterix is interpretted as a UNIX *, and the args[] 
array will contain every single filename within the home directory.  Conversly, 
this behavior probably should exist if you simply specified an asterix as a 
program argument (without the quotes).

summary: Inconsistent wizard plugin wizard choice possible
description:
When creating a new plug-in project with the default plug-in structure, it is 
possible to check the option "Add support for resource bundles" and uncheck the 
option "Add default instance access". This creates a plugin class with a 
compiler error because the resource access code relies on the default instance 
access method.

summary: NPE from breakpoint location verifier job
description:
No "current" display if not in UI thread.

Thread [Worker-3] (Suspended (exception NullPointerException))
	BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.run(IProgressMonitor) line: 98
	Worker.run() line: 61

summary: TaskLinkManager needs to be cleaned up earlier
description:
Currently the TaskLinkManager cleans up for a process when the launch is 
removed.

It should really clean up when the build finishes otherwise there can be a fair 
bit of "old" state left around taking up memory.

summary: Exporting a deployable plugin does not hounour 1.4 compilation directive in compiler preferences
description:
I have developed a plugin that contains 1.4 'assert' statements. I have set 
the compiler preferences to 1.4. If I export a JAR file containing this code, 
everything works fine. If I export the plugin using 'Deployable plug-ins and 
fragments' I get an un specified compiler error while it builds the ZIP file. 
The only way to find out what the error is, is to install the plugin and then 
try to run it. After that the workspace/.metadata/.log file contains an entry 
that indicates an unresolved compilation error at the line that 
contains 'assert' statement.

summary: [Preferences] Workbench/Fonts alignment
description:
The upper border of the "Preview" should be aligned with the upper border of the
"Fonts" list box.

summary: JDT package explorer doesn't trigger decoration for java files
description:
This is with build 200308261317 and earlier

I have a plugin which provides a custom lightweight decorator.

In plain old navigator view, if I expand a directory with a bunch of files, the
decorations appear as they are calculated if the resources don't already have
decoration.

However, in the package explorer, if I expand a package to display source files,
my decorator does not get triggered (breakpoint in decorate() never gets hit) to
update the resources that don't currently have decorations.  Actually - it is
only java files that don't get decorated, other things like gifs/html/etc do get
decorated.  Also, for directories that are not packages, the package explorer
does do the right thing and updates the decorators.

summary: [DCR ] Support for non-Java source mapping
description:
I'd like to see extensions to the JDT API in order to provide support for non-
Java source that is translated into Java source (notably JSPs).

What I'm looking for is the JDT equivalent of com.sun.jdi.Location.lineNumber
(String stratum) and sourceName(String stratum).

Alternatively, the concept of mapped source could be generalized and put in the 
org.eclipse.debug classes.

description:

The JDT/UI tests don't finish under Linux GTK. The main threads waits in 
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs$ThreadJob.joinRun.

summary: Error building feature; Cannot find plug-in versions
description:
I have a situation where I am utilizing a third-party plugin (specifically, a 
WSAD plugin) which I'll call plugin "A". I wrote a plugin called "B" which uses 
one of the extensions from "A". Plugin "A" requires ["org.eclipse.ui" 
version="2.1.0" match="equivalent"]. However, I have eclipse 2.1.1 installed in 
which "org.eclipse.ui" is at version "2.1.1" and version "2.1.0" does not 
exist. Plugin "A" works correctly in my eclipse environment and even my 
plugin "B" works using its extension when running the Runtime Environment. The 
problem is when I try to build the feature. It spits up a message 
saying "Cannot find plug-in: org.eclipse.ui_2.1.0". Shouldn't this be able to 
find "org.eclipse.ui_2.1.1" since match="equivalent" was defined?

summary: problems with projects having recursive links on linux
description:
Overview Description: Eclipse has various problems with projects having
recursive links on linux (e.g. "ln -s . core" created in the base directory of
the project); sometimes resulting in system crashes caused by
java.lang.OutOfMemoryErrors

Steps to Reproduce:
1) create a project with the following structure:
   projectdir/src/Test.java
   with projectdir as the base directory of the project and Test.java as a
simple java file without having a package delaration
2) in projectdir create a recursive link, e.g. using
   cd projectdir
   ln -s . core
3) import the project to eclipse with the following steps:
   - File --> New --> Project
   - Select "Java Project"
   - Choose projectdir as the Project contents, enter a project name and press
the "Finish" button

Actual Results:
* 41 errors (The declared package doesn't match the expected package ...)!
* try Search --> File Search with
  - Containing Text: Test
  - File name patterns: *
  which results in 41 search results
* trying the same things in bigger projects multiplies the problems: a project
having only about 100 source files tries to find search results in about 45.000
files; opening, closing, and deleting these projects sometimes results in system
crashes caused by java.lang.OutOfMemoryErrors

Expected Results:
* recursive links should be ignored or handled somehow

Build Date & Platform: SuSE Linux 8.1, Eclipse 3.0 M3 GTK (28 Aug 2003)
System configuration: Athlon 2GHz, 512MB RAM,

summary: [launching] Managing invalid launch configs
description:
When the launch config index is initialized, we toss invalid configs from the 
index (but leave them in the file system). Examples are:
(1) Configs with missing launch config types (due to missing plug-in)
(2) Shared Configs which are out of sync with the local file system (remain 
tossed until refreshed)

Exceptions are logged to note the problems. However, the user is never notified 
of the problems. Should we, and how do we notify the user of these problems? 
(the problems are noticed by the debug core (non-ui) plug-in).

summary: Eclipse 3.0 M3 - can't start Eclipse from the command line
description:
OS 10.2
Eclipse 2.1 could be started from a shell using something like
/<....>/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse

In Eclipse 3.0 M3, Eclipse started this way is not properly initialized and 
can't be used (no event etc.).

Is there any way to workaround this?

summary: Accessibility:Cannot move scroll bars with keyboard
description:
Testing HATS (WSSD plugin).. WSSD V5.1: 
Cant move the editors scrollbars with the keyboard.
We had to implement default scrolling increments, when clicking on the
scroll buttons, that should not default to 1px.

We had to implement behavior to make the composite scroll to show
controls therein as they were tabbed to

We think that this keyboard support for scrolling should be built into
the framework.

summary: [Editor Mgmt] Need extension to intercept editor opening
description:
An extension that allowed a plugin to intercept an IEditorInput before the 
editor opens would be nice.

something like:

public IEditorInput checkInput(IEditorInput)

The use I see would be valuable in the case of a MultiEditor. A plugin could 
intercept an input, and potenially return a MultiEditorInput to take its place.

So the interception would need to occur before the  editor is created.

this bug is releated:  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=42641 

Geoff

summary: Ctrl-Backspace performs wrong function
description:
I'm using 3.0 M3 with JDK 1.4.2 on Windows XP. 

The Ctrl-Backspace key sequence is bound to "Delete Previous Word" but when 
typed it actually performs "Delete Next Word" (which is correctly bound to Ctrl-
Delete). There appears to be no way to get the "Delete Previous Word" action to 
actually do the right thing. 

This is a regression from 3.0 M2, which worked fine.

summary: No autobuild when referenced (input) jar file changes
description:
I have two AspectJ projects. One that uses "Output Jar" and one that 
uses "Input Jars (aspects)" to reference the jar file of the first project. 
When making changes to the first project (which will also change the jar file), 
recompilation of the second project is not triggered.

expected behaviour: the second project wil be recompiled if any of the input 
jars changes.

summary: new sync view resources layout switch
description:
Now there's the possibility to have three different looks in the new sync view,
tree, compressed tree, table.
There's the need that the "Toggle layout..." switch becomes a drop down menu
that allows to choose between the three looks in a single step, instead of
having to go into view preferences to change between tree/compressed tree mode.
Or perhaps you could also add the three looks switch to the view context menu.

summary: Errors in plugin.xml cause compilation errors
description:
Hi there,

I don't know exactly if this is a bug or more a RFE. If you write a plugin and 
edit the plugin.xml so that it doesn't correspont to the XML schema, you'll 
get hundreds of compilation errors in your java files. There's a single error 
message that your schema isn't valid, but normally because of the huge amount 
of errors, you can't see it.
It would be nice if the schema check occurs first and if the schema is 
invalid, you get an error message and the following compilation step doesn't 
find place, so that you see that there's a schema error and have to fix it.

summary: CLASSPATH of Project wrong (NoSuchAlgorithmException)
description:
I had a hard time getting an application running under Eclipse that works okay 
when running out of Eclipse with a batch file. With the help of somebody in the 
JDC Forum (that had a similar problem with Eclipse and solved it) I also was 
able to workaround it. Here's the problem:

using JCA by creating a secret key via a Algorithm didn't work 
(NoSuchAlgorithmException) when the application runs in Eclipse. The post of 
venkateshmj in  http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp ?
forum=9&thread=430078&start=0&range=30#2024814 described the problem and its 
solution:

"The basic thing is, eclipse will not find the provider jar file which is in '%
java_home%\jre\lib\ext'. So if you are using jboss-ide, open the jboss debug 
and configure the classpath. Disable 'use default class path'. Add 
sunjce_provider.jar and jce.jar to the 'User classes'. Remove 
sunjce_provider.jar from the 'Bootstrap Classes', retain jce.jar in 'BootStrap 
Classes'. "

As I don't use JBoss but a simple Java application, i had the same problem and 
the same workaround worked for me:

In "Bootstrap classes" of the application un configuration, I removed the 
default "JRE_LIB" entry and added (in replacement) rt.jar, jsse.jar, jce.jar to 
the "Bootstrap classes". with this change, the NoSuchAlgorithmException 
vanished and it worked.

summary: [RFP44] 4.2.5 Filter packages form base classloader
description:
Otherwise known as "handling the endorsed libs"

Currently class load requests are first delegated to the parent class loader of 
the bundle (typically  the Application ClassLoader or Bootstrap ClassLoader; we 
will call it the base classloader here). This is standard classloader practice. 
However, sometimes it may be desireable to “hide” packages provided by the base 
classloader so that a bundle may instead provide them.

For example, you are running the OSGi environment on J2SE. The J2SE 
installation provides a version of Xerces and the org.w3c.dom and org.xml.sax 
packages. However, these packages are an older version that the one needed by 
bundles running in the framework, e.g. the latest version of Xerces. So we want 
to install a bundle which exports a newer version of these packages. The 
framework must be configured to “hide” the old version of these packages from 
all bundles, so that the new versions of the packages can be instead used.

summary: Table answers its Header as a child
Multiple aspects difficult to manage
description:
As soon as the Aspect Visualizer gets enough aspects so that most of them are 
colored gray it gets very difficult to see which aspect is which. Here are two 
features that I would like to see:

 * If you right-click on a file in the graphical (not textual) view you should
   have an option to "Show only aspects present in this file." For example,
   when I wanted to see which aspects were affecting my file Foo.java I had to
   hide/show every aspect on the list to see if there was a change.

 * There should be a feature to "recolor" the currently shown aspects. For
   example, if five of the aspects are gray, but they are the only ones shown
   it would be better to see a smart recoloring instead of having to do so
   manually myself.

These limiting factors affect the scalability of the Aspect Visualizer tool: 
it's less useful the more aspects you have.

summary: No refresh when deleting edited unit
description:
Build 20030930 in working copy owner mode

If the file being edited is deleted from the package explorer, then the view 
doesn't update. If the file isn't updated, then it correctly disappears.

The difference is that an edited file is in primary working mode for which no 
delta is broadcasted (virtual file system notion). However, the editor closes 
itself and discard the working copy which should then notify a removal delta.

summary: [formatting] Format comment option bug
description:
This bug is for build 200309250800.
The option Code Formatter -> Comments -> Empty line before Javadoc tags, will
insert multiple line at each formatting (unless used the Clear all blank lines
is also checked).
Example:
Create test class and insert his method
    /**
      * Test line before javadoc
      * @param args
      */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
    }

Press the format command and for each format another empty line will be added
before the @param tag.

The new formatting are much better then the one from 2.x but we need some
description of how to use it, like what kind of comments will be acceptable for
the formatter.

Build 20030925

Closing the Progress view makes the UI more responsive.

summary: [PropertiesView] Property Sheet "Misc" category not always expanded correctly
description:
When the property sheet view is set to show categories the "Misc" category is 
not always expanded correctly.

1.  Select an object that only has properties in the "Misc." category (so that 
the viewer will not show the "Misc" category explicitly).
2.  Change selection to an object with properties in the "Misc" category and 
some other category (so that the viewer will show "Misc" and other categories 
explicitly).

Note that the "Misc" category is not expanded.

NOTE:  You may have to do these steps twice to reproduce the problem.  The 
problem does not appear to occur on the first selection change.

summary: Group widget doesn't pass focus when pressing mnemonic
description:
Javadoc for org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Group#setText(String) says:
"When the user presses a key sequence that matches the mnemonic, focus is
assgned to the first child of the group.".

Unfortunately, that doesn't work.

Group.checkStyle (int style) begins with
    { style |= SWT.NO_FOCUS; ...,
which prevents
    boolean mnemonicHit (char key) {
        return setFocus ();
    }
from setting focus to the first child of the group.

description:

Not repro on Windows OS.

1. Create Logic example
2. Add a label to your logic example and change text (Zoom level is 100% see 
attached GEFZoomTo100.jpg)
3. Now change the zoom level to 50% 
Actual (not as expected): notice hat the text is not displayed (see attached  
GEFZoomTo50_NoText.jpg)
Workaround: Zoom back to 100%

summary: Disabling of "definition" not making sense in Search dialog
description:
In the search dialog, in the "limit to" group box, the "definitions" check box 
is only enabled when the "Function" or the "Method" check boxes in the "Search 
For" are checked.  But if the "Any Element" is checked, the "definitions" group 
box is disable.  The UI is confusing for the user.

Steps:
1) Go to the C/C++ Search dialog
2) Uncheck everything in the "Search For" group box
   The "definitions" check box is disabled in the "Limit To" group box.
3) Put a check in the "Function" check box.
   The "definitions" check box is enabled
4) Put a check in the "Any Element" check box.
   The "definitions" check box is enabled since the disabled "Function" check 
box still has a check in it.
5) Uncheck "Any Element" and then uncheck "Function" 
   definitions become disabled.
6) Check "Any Element".
   definitions is still disabled.

The UI is ambiguous to the user.

summary: [Editors] Switch to Editor dialog is missing accelerators
description:
I20031008 + Tods patch

The buttons "Select All" and "Activate Selected Editor" are missing accelerators.

summary: NPE in StyledText
description:
build i1008b + workbench.jar patch
sun jdk 1.4.2

I got the following exception in my log file when shutting down.
Will attach log.

summary: Logic example has convoluted code in LogicSubPart
description:
First, I hope this is the right place for logic example improvement submissions.

It seems that someone was having fun in LogicSubPart.  its cute, but it could be
confusing to people that do not understand the simplicity of what is happening.

LogicSubPart uses an extremely complicated way of returning a new Vector for
getTargetConnections().  Its adding the elements 1 by 1 to a new Vector then
returning that.  While getSourceConnections simply uses vector.clone(),
obviously much faster, cleaner, simpler, etc..

However the larger issue is that lots of lists are tossed around in the GEF
architecture, but never are they cloned before hand.  Only time they are cloned
is by the receiver of the methods data, when that receiver knows it might modify
the contents.

so perhaps GEF should specify that returned lists are not to be modified, then
nobody has to wonder if they should return clones such as this one example does.
 OR they all should return clones.(or unmodifiable collections)

summary: Formatting
description:
Can a new Formatting option be added to allow for statements to occur on the
same line as a control statement if not enclosed in braces?  for instance:

if (Constants.DEBUG) logger.debug("returning success");

It seems like a previous version of Eclipse allowed for this, but
it now splits.

summary: CVS Annotation could use diff-colours and tooltips
description:
I think the current CVS annotation functionality is a bit cumbersome since it is
from the list of lines to the code, and not from the code to the author.

I therefore suggest that the current approach for quick diffs (namely to use
different colours in the left sidebar) could be extended to show a colour for
each "cvs annotation block" (two which alternates would be fine), with a tool
tip saying the name of the changer, and - if clicked - synchronized with the
current list of changes in the CVS Annotation view.

summary: Breakpoint not shown in ruler
description:
2.1.1

Reported by Helen Shi (@ CASCON)

- it initially shows up
- shutdown and restart
- breakpoint is not shown in ruler
- run program
- breakpoint is still hit, and still shows in Breakpoints view

summary: Sync up feature and site editors with Update spec
description:
This is a blanket defect to ensure that both feature and site editors support 
the full 2.1 Update spec.

2. Dialog says 'Method cannot be moved.'
3. Note that gotoPackagesView could be static, it needs not instance accesses
4. It would be very good if the dialog also gives a reason why the move failed.

summary: Wrong JDK source lookup if Compile-JDK <> Debug-JDK
description:
Dear experts, 

I work in a server developement environment where compilation of sources is done
with JDK 1.3.1 (my company policy), but the resulting JAR's are currently
executed on a server running JDK 1.4.2 and need to be debugged there. 

My Eclipse setup is: Window --> Preferences --> installed JREs --> JDK 1.3.1 (to
compile with 1.3.1).

I have a debug configuration that has the following setup: In "Source" tab: "Use
defualt source look up path" deselected (otherwise, JRE System library for 1.3.1
would be in) and manually added JRE System library JDK 1.4.2 using "Advanced -->
Add container" and moved this item to the top of the source list.

But when debugging and stepping through SUN code (e.g. class java.lang.Thread),
I see the 1.3.1 source and the code pointer moves through non-code parts of the
source, e.g. comments, space lines, ...

If I switch the preferences to using 1.4.2 as default JDK, I get the correct
code when debugging, but as said I shall compile using 1.3.1 in order to avoid
using language elements not present in 1.4.2.


Juergen Kremp

summary: Hierarchy view should show package names of types
description:
build I20030917

- open hierarchy view on org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryReader
- it has several subclasses called PluginRegistryReader
- there's no way to determine which package and source folder these come from 
without opening them

I would expect this info to appear in the status line, or a tooltip.

It's possible that info in the status line is getting wiped out by the 
background progress monitor.

summary: Duplicate Entry in CVS Compare
description:
While using WSDD 5.5, which is built on Eclipse 2.0.2, I saw the following 
strange behavior: I was comparing the contents of selected packages with those 
in the CVS repository.  You can see from the attached screen shot that a 
difference appeared twice when it should have appeared once. 

Note that I am using CVS on Windows, which might have something to do with 
this, but I have no way of telling.

summary: osgi.bundles bundles are being installed twice
description:
The bundles whch have version numbers appended to the directories are being 
installed twice.  Once as a result of being on osgi.bundles and again because 
they are in the platform configuration.  This is either because the name is 
wrong or because the locations are different (one has the version number and 
the other does not) and the lookup is identifying them as different.  This is 
likely since the location is the unique value  in traditional OSGi.  The name 
is just a string.

summary: Support for Breakpoint groups
description:
I saw few enh. requests concerning the breakpoints view,
and I thing that the best would be to have an arborescent view,
permitting to group them logically and enable only some groups.

Groups would have to be 3-state for the view to be really efficient,
internal selection should be kept when the parent group is
enabled/disabled.

The view could provide a global toggle action to enable/enable
all the breakpoints, without needing to put them under a top level root
node.

By the way, when a breakpoint is disabled (maybe because its parent group is),
its font should be grayed (more user friendly).

Tell me if you need nore info on that, but it is something I would
really be happy with !

--Steve

summary: [Preferences] Field editors in Preference Page not shown
description:
Field editor preference pages that are very similar (same number and type of 
field editors) are not displayed correctly. From two similar pages only the 
first page created is displayed correctly, in the second page the field editors 
are not displayed. I traced through the construction of these pages and through 
PreferenceDialog.showPage(). Both were executed correctly. Both pages were set 
to visible when selected but on the second page setVisible(true) seems not to 
work properly.
I could bypass this error by adding another widget (Label) to one of the pages.
Bug in Windows?

summary: Workbench Help set on wrong Composite
description:
In BuildPathsPropertyPage and SourceAttachmentPropertyPage the Workbench Help 
is set on the parent Composite passed to createContents(Composite parent) 
rather than on the control that is returned from getControl(). As a result the 
Help for the preference page cannot be used in when performHelp() is called.

In JavadocConfigurationPropertyPage and JavaElementInfoPage the Workbench Help 
is set on a different composite, but still not the control that is returned 
from getControl().

2. Try to open the java file (using double click or Open type)

summary: JDT compiler more restrictive than javac
description:
Here is the scenario that is causing problems to PDE when self-hosting against 
OSGi runtime:

1) Take M4 build
2) Download OSGi runtime from Equinox home page (build 1010) and unzip on top 
of the build
3) Start another Eclipse driver (not this one) with a clean workspace. 
Configure it so that PDE->Target Platform points at the M4 OSGi build created 
in 2).
4) Import all the external plug-ins and fragments as binary projects into the 
workspace.
5) Create 'Hello, World' plug-in using PDE 'New Plug-in project' wizard. Keep 
all the defaults.

Notice that the build fails with the following error in XyzPlugin.java:

The type org.osgi.framework.Bundle cannot be resolved. It is indirectly 
referenced from required .class files.	XyzPlugin.java

XyzPlugin does not reference Bundle type directly anywhere. However, it does 
extend AbstractUIPlugin, which in turn extends Plugin (provided by 
org.eclipse.runtime.compatibility) and this class has 'Bundle getBundle()' 
method, as well as Bundle private field.

As suggested, I went into the workspace from the OS shell and tried to compile 
XYZPlugin using javac.exe. I managed to get it to compile without having to 
put org.eclipse.osgi.framework.core plug-in on the classpath (this is where 
Bundle type is declared).

It seems to me that JDT compiler is too eager when resolving Plugin class. It 
should not need to resolve Bundle reference since it was never used explicitly 
in XyzPlugin class itself.

summary: pocketpc - Pop-Up menus do not work on Tables

There should only remain 2 of these. One for the compiler, one for the rest of 
JDTCore. This would also require to group all message catalogs.

summary: Opening binary type gives file changed prompt
description:

- it gives the "file change" prompt
- press Yes to load the changes
- editor comes up
- close it
- open file again
- you get the same prompt again

summary: Regression - Incorrect Shell highlighted in Windows Taskbar
description:
When a breakpoint is hit, the correct WorkbenchWindow containing the Debug 
perspective used to flash/blink in the windows taskbar.  Also, the windows 
taskbar would slide out if set to "auto-hide".

In 3.0 M4, the incorrect workbenchWindow is flashed instead.  For me, it is 
the "first" shell, which happens to contain the Java perspective.  If I ALT+TAB 
to the WorkbenchWindow containing the Debug perspective, windows is not happy, 
and refuses to hide the Taskbar until I make the other workbenchwindow be the 
active shell.  Of course I must do this, because the taskbar (Left side of 
Desktop) is covering most of the Variables View.

summary: Code Complete finds local variables
description:
Searches for the declarations of local variables return the function name they 
are defined in as the search result.

Code Complete should not include local variables for 2 reasons: 1) search will 
find locals not visible at the point the user hits ctrl-space and 2) the 
function name will appear in the code complete list and it will not usually 
start with the same prefix.

Search needs to provide support for excluding local variables from the search 
and Code complete needs to use that support.

summary: Variable selection UI
description:
We should make a pass over all launch config fields that support variables and 
make sure they have some UI for adding variables using the variable selection 
dialog. For fields where a button isn't good, we should add an item to the 
context menu "Insert Variable..."

summary: Update Classpath only works with runtime JARs
description:
We have a particular plugin which only contains ANT specific code (i.e., 
tasks).  So the JAR that we have in the plugin gets added to the ANT classpath 
but the JAR is not a runtime JAR for the plugin.  When we use the Update 
Classpath option, the dialog opens and it says one is selected but our plugin 
does not appear in the list.  If I click finish, the classpath is not 
updated.  The only workaround is to put a bogus runtime JAR in the plugin.xml 
and then select the option.  Then we have to remove this JAR once we are 
finished.

summary: C/C++ editor - should generate C comments for C files
description:
In the C/C++ editor, if I open a C file, select a section of the file, right
click, and select comment, it will insert C++ style comments (//) instead of C
style comments (/**/.  This is not usually a problem, but when trying to compile
with the -ansi flag to gcc (2.95.2 or 3.22) it will not recognize // as a comment

summary: cannot traverse to ToolBar items
Ant outline not shown if editor is unable to load DTD
description:
When using Ant editor for editing XML files with external DTD specified (i.e.
web.xml) outline does not appears if editor failed to load DTD (usually happens
behind corporate firewall).

summary: IncompatibleClassChangeError at runtime when compiling with -1.4 option
description:
So we finally figured what changed between 3.0M3 and 3.0M4: the Java Compiler 
options changed to having 1.4 compliance as the default for generated class 
files. (We found this out through the circuitous route of inspecting the class 
file attributes of an M4 compile vs a working command-line one.

The optimisation to swizzle JoinPoint for JoinPointStaticPart fails when ajc is 
passed the -1.4 option, resulting in an IncompatibleClassChangeError at runtime.

Test case about to be checked into ajcTestsFailing.... and then we'll see if we 
can fix it!

summary: [browser] add api to read html from memory on Photon Browser
description:
1. Implement the following api: public boolean setText(String html); where html contains plain html as in: String html = "HTML example

HTML example

This is a really cool page

"; browser.setText(html); // render this page 2. Investigate if the following api could be implemented on Photon: public boolean setText(String html, String urlSource); where html is an html document that may refer to links relative to the location url (for examples, images). public boolean setText(InputStream data, String mime, String url); where data is a binary stream containing a document to be interpreted by a reader for the given mime type (html, text, etc). If this is relevant to the given mime type, relative links are relative to the given url argument.

summary: [find/replace] Labels for Regex ContentAssist in Find/Replace should include example
description:
Labels for Regex ContentAssist in Find/Replace should include the regular
expression (before or after the describing string).

My use case is e.g. this:
I remember there was a pattern for word-characters (\s, \w, \W, \S, or something
like that). I press Ctrl+Space and resize the list to see half of the proposals
at once.
Now, the label "alphanumeric" doesn't match my mental pattern, and I have to
look at every single label. The info hover takes a second to appear, and I get
tired of waiting for it, because I know that I would have spotted \w right away
if it was part of the proposal label (e.g. "Alphanumeric - \w").

summary: Compare editors not updated when file changes
description:
The compare editors opened from the sync view never update when the IFile in 
the workspace changes. This is not standard behavior in the platform, and 
users expect it to be up-to-date.

summary: Autobuild kicks in and stops
description:
Build: I-20031029
Fresh workspace. No classpath containers, no nothing.
Import org.eclipse.ui and all its pre-reqs as source.
The projects are all imported successfully.  All the classpaths are set 
correctly.  Then autobuild starts, and abruptly ends.  You will see 1-2 
warnings and that is it.
Invoke a full build manually, and you will see all warnings, etc. and 
everything will be fine.

summary: Contribute variables should indicate the plugin that contributed them
description:
The variables currently state that they are contributed but not who contributed 
them.

See the Ant preference pages for examples (tasks, types, properties...)

summary: Editor tab has "User File Editor" instead of "plugin.xml"
description:
I20031029
- create a new environment
- check out some projects from CVS
- import external plugins
- open a plugin.xml file with a double click from the Search window
- PDE's multi-page editor opens fine (with pages for Overview, Dependencies, 
Extension Points, Source, etc.)
- by default, the Source page had the focus
- the editor's tab in the titlebar of the Editor window had "User File Editor" 
when I was expecting the filename "plugin.xml"

summary: What JVM is Hyades using to run java processes?
description:
(Hyades 1.1.0, Eclipse Workbench 2.1.1)

When using "Launch Java Process", what JVM is Hyades using to run the process?

Is it supposed to use the same JVM as the Eclipse workbench specified with 
eclipse -vm startup option? Or maybe the JVM specified in the system path?

My application does not behave correctly with JDK 1.4. I started eclipse with 
a -vm option to use JDK 1.3, but I have JDK 1.4 in my system path. I'm not too 
sure which JDK Hyades is using when launching my application using Lauch Java 
Process, but the runtime behavior of my application suggests that Hyades is 
using JDK 1.4 (i.e. the JDK in my system path).

Please explain how Hyades selects the JDK used to run applications, and how to 
control this.

summary: Build Properties Editors removes comments
description:
Eclipse SDK 20031104
Touching build.properties with Build Properties Editors causes copyrights and 
other comments to go away.

summary: Unable to launch more than 25 programs
description:
I'm using 3.0m4. I have launched 25 actively running java programs (using the 
Run menu) but can't launch the 26th. External programs can't be launched 
either. I thought perhaps I was running out of memory but I don't get any 
error dialog and the .log file is clean - no messages output anywhere I can 
tell. All the programs I launched earlier are still running fine, and the 
console window is popping all over the place with new output from the 
different processes.

One of the 25 is a Workbench, and the other are instances of one smallish Java 
program I built in the workspace. I still have virtual memory available on the 
machine (dual Xeon running XP).

Is there a limit of 25 launches, or is some undiagnosed error occuring?

summary: notes on making PDE work on OSGi/Equinox
description:
This PR is a place where any problems found while making PDE work on Equinox are
stored.

1) At least in M2, PDE UI declares that it requires org.eclipse.pde (the feature
plugin), but not org.eclipse.pde.core. Since we use the requires list to
manually define the Dependant-Bundles manifest entry, PDE was not being properly
activated when PDE UI was.

2) PDE Core requires org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.parsePlugins, which is
not currently available. Adding to core.internal.plugins.InternalPlatform.

3) PDE Core requires the model classes and registry resolution. Re-adding.

4) Some classes usually available from org.eclipse.ui now must be imported from
other UI plugins (such as views or workbench).

5) Added helper methods to PDECore to provide access to platform configurations
(using the IPlatformConfigurationFactory service).

summary: [CVS Core] parse 'waiting' and 'obtained' messages from server
description:
build N20031031

- working in the RCP stream, I selected all the UI projects after releasing the 
results of the merge to the RCP stream
- chose Tag with Version: RCP_MERGED_WITH_v20031028
- it completed, but the Progress view showed an error:
Problems tagging the resources: 10 project(s) successfully tagged and 1 project
(s) with errors.

At first I was puzzled as to how to determine which project had errors, and 
what they were, but I eventually tried Show Error in the context menu, and then 
clicking Details on the dialog.  It shows:

Problems tagging the resources. 10 project(s) successfully tagged and 1 project
(s) with errors.
  The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs tag" command.
  org.eclipse.ui.win32: cvs server: [12:37:41] waiting for rkulp's lock 
in /home/eclipse/CVSROOT/Emptydir
  org.eclipse.ui.win32: cvs server: [12:38:11] obtained lock 
in /home/eclipse/CVSROOT/Emptydir

These are just warnings though.  Is it possible there was some other error?
The tag shows up on org.eclipse.ui.win32 in the repos view.

summary: thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart cannot be resolved
description:
The ajc v1.1.1 doesn't seem to regognize the thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart
keyword.
With J2SE's (build 1.3.1_04-b02) and (build 1.4.1-b21) I get compilation errors
from Ant and from Eclipse. Ant (v1.5) says:
"
aj:comp:
     [iajc] C:\projects\aspectJTest\src\aspects\mypkg\DebugLog.aj:146
thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart cannot be resolved
     [iajc] stream.println("Entering from " +
thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart.getSignature());
     [iajc]                                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
"

summary: Move Member Type to New File refactoring gone from context menu
description:
Select the name of a "member type" and right-click. The context menu is missing
this refactoing. Go to the main Refactor menu from the frame window, and the
refactoring is available.

Worked fine in 3.0M2, broken in M3.

summary: [DCR ] Create field with comment
overspecified directory path by "eclipse" when exporting a feature
description:
Hi Eclipse Team

Eclipse : Version: 2.1.1 Build id: 200306271545
Java    : version "1.4.1_02"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_02-b06)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_02-b06, mixed mode)


When exporting a feature to a zip file, the generated path includes 
the "eclipse" prefix. While it is ok for a feature added to the Eclipse IDE, it 
precludes to unzip the zipped feature in the "right" features & plugins 
directories when used with an IDE based on Eclipse but whose name and master 
directory is not "eclipse" but "foobar" with sub directories:

foobar/features
foobar/plugins

Thus, in my opinion, one should remove the "eclipse" prefix for  an easier way 
of use and an a greater generality of the export process.

Regards

summary: Find/Replace copy/paste doesn't work.
description:
If i select some text in the editor and Copy it to the clibboard and then i 
open the Find/Replace dialog if i then try to paste te text in the find/replace 
dialog in te find or replace with fields. The text isn't paste in the thos 
fields but in the textarea below it!

copy text (CTRL-C) in the find/replace dialog doesn't seem to work either.

summary: Display of a selected variable is not working frequently
description:
Using 1105, the display of the selected variable is not working very frequently.
I am using JDK1.4.1 vms and I get numerous examples where I cannot see the
string representation of the selected variable in the variable view.
This is very frustrating and it is wasting a lot of times. I don't remember such
issues with M4 or previous integration builds.
Sometimes after a while I get an error message instead of the expected display
saying that the evaluation failed.
Debugging takes lot of time and patience.

summary: SWT: must set text of menu item before adding sub items (windows only)
Historic isDeleted() method still lingering in some content providers
description:
The removed boolean isDeleted(Object) method of the IContentProvider interface
still has some lingering (and no longer used) implementations.  They should be
removed.

description:

events because the key bindings dialog doesn't distinguish between keypad 
events and others. In the above mentioned bug I was told to open another 
request against UI.

summary: Need proper shutdown hook for cleaning up platform on termination.
Inefficient use of setClasspathContainer(...)
description:
Build 20031105

PluginManager.updateAffectedEntries(IPluginBase[]) loops over the model entries 
and for each entry, updateClasspathContainer(boolean) calls 
setClasspathContainer(IPath, IJavaProject[], IClasspathContainer[], ...) with 
one Java project and one classpath container.

updateAffectedEntries should better call setClaspathContainer(...) with all 
projects and the corresponding containers once.

e.g. 
		String twoLines = 
			"System Contains Many Defects,Systemet innehåller många 
fel\n"+"Stories Are Too Complicated,Stories är för komplicerade";

Move the cursor after + and press enter.
It somehow moves the new line to column 0, while I'd expect it to align with 
the first line. If you try this with a single string, the bug will still be 
seen.
 
Interestingly, when I am within a method's parantheses, the behavior is 
different.

e.g. 
   assertEquals(
       "converted data",
       "Systemet+innehåller+många+fel|Stories+är+för+komplicerade",convertedData
.toString()
   );

Note, the two lines within have a single tab each. Now position the cursor on 
convertedData and press enter - while I'd expect it to line up with the 
previous line (two tabs), the IDE adds three tabs.

Now here's the one which really annoys me:

   assertEquals(

There is one tab before assertEquals.
Press enter after the paranthesis. Three tabs are inexplicably put in. I would 
expect only two.

I am assuming these are bugs as previous releases had the right behavior.
 
Regards,
Somik

summary: Outline flickers when opening/editing files
description:
When I'm editing a larger files with a lot of items to display in the 
outline window (a header file for instance with lot of defines),
the outline windows begins to flicker and begins to consume all processor 
time.
The effect is so strong that the UI is nearly unusable.
The only way is have the outline window closed.

I'm using eclipse 2.1.2 and CDT 1.2 GA.

Thanks

summary: Classes in certain directories not compiled/found
description:
I am running the latest integration build (dated 08/13/03) - and souce files in
certain directories dont show up when I use Ctrl+Shift+T - they dont even get
compiled.
The source files reside in the following location (from the .classpath file):
<classpathentry excluding="**/org/**" kind="src"
path="Development/plugins/dixons-branch-tools/src/java"/>

These were compiled and I was able to browse to classes in this directory when I
used the 08/06/03 integration build. (Maybe this is not working due to the
hyphen symbol in the directory?

summary: Extract interface from org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout
description:
Is there a reason, why org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout became a class instead of 
an interface? 
If one has to create an own layout imlpementation, having such an interface 
would often make that job easier. 

My refactoring request:
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout implements org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ILayout
{
  // everything else is the same
}

Thus you still could add methods and fields to them in the future.
The name of that new interface is up to you ;)


br
Saibel

summary: [ErrorHandling] [RCP] SafeRunnable in JFace opens an error dialog
description:
The class org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable opens an error dialog if the 
runnable it contains throws an exception. There are cases (e.g  bug 46960 ) 
where an exception in this runnable can happen frequently. I got 137 error 
dialogs when I was reproducing this problem. Would logging the error be 
sufficient in this case? Otherwise, some mechanism to avoid poping up multiple 
dialogs at the same time should be employed.

summary: Increase timeout from 30 seconds to 5 minutes in RemoteLogParserLoader.
description:
Increase timeout from 30 seconds to 5 minutes in RemoteLogParserLoader.  This 
timeout increase is required for network latency issues when the client 
attaches and starts monitoring the server's logging agent.

summary: setHightlightRange() does not work
description:
Build: I-20031118

1. Open the manifest editor on a plugin.xml file
2. Go to the source page.
3. In the outline view, select an element.
You will see that the correct segment of text is selected in the editor; yet, 
the highlight range was not set correctly.
In the same piece of code that does the correct selection, we also have the 
line:  setHighlightRange(...) with the correct arguments, yet it is doing 
nothing.

The range indicator for the source editor is an instance of 
DefaultRangeIndicator, which, as I understand, is also the default.

summary: add to javadoc for List.remove(int start, int end)
description:
The method remove(int start, int end) in class List, removes any items that it 
can before throwing the exception ERROR_INVALID_RANGE. This should be added to 
the javadoc as this behavior is specifically tested in the junit test 
Test_org_eclipse_swt_widgets_List.test test_removeII()

summary: Eclipse allows setting a source folder's parent as output folder, which wipes out source code
description:
It's possible to select a source folder's parent as the output folder, as
described below. This has the majorly annoying side-effect of wiping out your
source code. Viz:

Suppose you have a project named MyProject.

- Create a source folder MyDir/src as a source folder. This will set the new
default output directory to MyProject/bin. 
- Create a class, package com.abs.stc, name Hello, in this directory.

Now change the source folder to /MyDir/src and the output folder to /MyDir as
follows: 

- Right click on the project and select Properties->Java Build Path->Source.
- click on Allow output folders for source folders. Click on Output folder,
(expand the source folder MyProject/MyDir/src if necessary), press Edit, click
on "Specific Output Folder" and change it to MyDir. Click OK. 
- You'll get a message about not being able to nest MyProject/MyDir/src inside
MyProject/MyDir. Make this message go away by changing the Default output folder
at the bottom of the dialog box from MyProject/bin to MyProject. (This is
probably where this bug should get fixed; it shouldn't let you do this.) 
- Click OK. You'll get a message box asking if it's OK to remove the old
generated sources from the old output folder; click Yes. BOOM! If you're using
Eclipse 3.0 or 2.1.1, this will immediately wipe out your source directory.

(If you're using 2.1, you get a reprieve; your source directory won't get wiped
until try to run Hello.java when you get an error about the main class not being
found.)

summary: Eclipse locking when creating a new dir or executing an ant script
description:
I'm using suse 8.2, with eclipse 2.1.2, with tomcat plugin (not used when the
error occured)

Sometimes eclipse locks when executing ant scripts, but it unlocks after canceling.

The locking when creating a directory is even more critic, since it locks (with
clock cursor), and cancel button does not work (it becomes disabled after
pressing it), and when I try to close the windows it gives the msg :
"wizard can not be closed due to an active operation. you must cancel the
operation before you can close the wizard"

summary: [Plan Item] Improve UI scalability
description:
Improve UI scalability. Despite efforts to ensure UI scalability with a large 
base of available tools, the Eclipse workbench still intimidates many users 
with long menus, wide toolbars, and lengthy flat lists of preferences. This 
problem is acute in large Eclipse-based products. The Platform should provide 
additional ways for controlling workbench clutter, such as further menu and 
toolbar customizability, distinguishing between novice and advanced functions, 
supporting different developer roles, and more specific object contributions 
for particular file types. [Platform UI, Platform Debug, JDT UI] [Theme: User 
experience]

summary: Background checkout blocks removing bookmark
description:
I2003-11-19

1) Create a test project with a test class
2) open the test class in an editor
3) add a bookmark
4) from the eclipse repository, check out "org.eclipse.jdt.ui" (in the
background, as per default settings).
5) in the editor, remove the bookmark from the ruler context menu
6) observe: The UI is non-responsive until the checkout finishes.

summary: [KeyBindings] CapsLock == R ???
description:
M5 test candidate, observed on both motif and gtk

- go to the Keys preference page
- click in the Key Sequence - Name field
- press CapsLock and R appears
- others: ScrollLock = T, PrintScreen = W, Pause = U

Is this expected?  I ran a small swt snippet that prints Key events, and I don't
see much resemblance between those of CapsLock and R.  Interestingly, pressing
Ctrl+CapsLock has the same affect in the java debugger as pressing Ctrl+R, so at
least the preference page isn't lying <g>.

summary: Manifest builder taking a very long time to perform
description:
Build 20031119

Restarting an existing workspace with this build, autobuild off, I forced an 
incremental workspace build, and got surprised by the amount of time spent in 
the manifest builder. It took about 20-30 seconds on one project, and pretty 
much traversed all the Java projects in less time than that afterwards.
Setup is full source Eclipse workspace.

summary: First bug towards CVS component!
new ParserMode required for a better CModel
description:
A mode for the parser that follows includes but does not go into function 
bodies need to be implemented. This will help us build a better CModel that 
has cross reference information. 
Building such a CModel could be made available for potential clients other 
than the outline view. Building such a model could be made optional (through a 
user preference) for the outline view because of the expected degradation in 
performance.

summary: Unexpected warning when launching Eclipse in Eclipse
description:
Build 20031120

After importing all Eclipse plug-ins in self-hosted workspace, the target 
platform got set to point at my SDK install (which I imported).

Attempting to launch plugin Junit tests, I get notified that my workspace 
contains now twice as many plugins, is it ok to continue ?

I have the impression that it automatically append the plugins from the target 
platform, which I don't need as I have them all in my workspace now. I don't 
recall this occurring before. 

It should realize that on the target platform, there is nothing more than what 
I have already in my workspace and should take precendece over it.

summary: [Preferences] Help button needed on preference panes
description: A help button on preferences panes to take the user to the associated help page would be useful.

summary: [misc] NPE in default position updater
description:
Build 200311201600

This is not reproducable, but these are steps that I remember:

1) surround a method call with a try catch using quick fix
2) replace e2.printStacktrace() with the comment //fall through using copy 
paste
		try {
			test= (Test)setup.invoke(null, new Object[] 
{reloadedTest});
		} catch (IllegalArgumentException e2) {
			e2.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IllegalAccessException e2) {
			e2.printStackTrace();
		} catch (InvocationTargetException e2) {
			e2.printStackTrace();
		}
 

3) -> NPE attached below
4) Once I'm in this state every key stroke I enter triggers the same exception 
and save also failed with an NPE (also attached below)

Here is the NPE after paste

summary: Subclassing does not remove the original graphical edit part
description:
Subclass JFrame, e.g. MyFrame extends JFrame.
Now change so it subclasses Object, fix up errors in initialize() method
The GUI updates OK with the content pane orphaned, however the JFrame edit 
part remains, including when a pause/reload occurs.  Close and re-open 
the .java file and it's all OK, but while the editor remains open the original 
graphic edit part never goes away on resubclassing

summary: Use of deprecated API from IActivityManager
description:
IActivityManager.match(String, Set) has been deprecated to be replaced with 
isMatch(String, Set)

summary: [OLE] OleAutomation for non-embedded objects
description:
I would like to be able to use OleAutomation and the event handling functions 
of Active-X on non-embedded COM Objects too.

Unfortunately the general COM services and the services specific to embedded 
components are mixed in OleClientSite and OleControlSite, so this feature might 
need some refactoring.

summary: [plan item] Rename Refactoring
description:
This feature represents our first foray into the world of refactoring. This 
includes bringing in a refactoring framework that is very similar to the JDT's 
refactoring framework. The focus is then on rename refactoring which will 
leverage off and make improvements to the C/C++ Search feature to correctly 
refactor the references.
