summary: Hotkey to popup right click menu
description:
A hotkey to popup the right click menu, would prevent repositioning the mouse
(even on datahands with integrated mouse it's a pain).  ie ctrl-r->S->V to bring
up override methods box... mas vite.

Andy

summary: [plan item] Improve file encoding support
description:
Improve file encoding support. Eclipse 2.1 uses a single global file encoding 
setting for reading and writing files in the workspace. This is problematic; 
for example, when Java source files in the workspace use OS default file 
encoding while XML files in the workspace use UTF-8 file encoding. The 
Platform should support non-uniform file encodings. [Platform Core, Platform 
UI, Text, Search, Compare, JDT UI, JDT Core] [Theme: User experience]

summary: Switching to use JRE Library container
description:
We need to switch to use the JRE Library container instead of the JRE Library
variable.
org.eclipse.debug.core from HEAD is not compiling by default, because the XML
parser is not include in rt.jar.

summary: Show some XML attributes in Ant editor outline view
description:
Ant's editor allows to edit XML files and have a good capability to show outline
of xml document. 

It will be very convenient to see values of some attributes in the outline view
of Ant editor in the same node as XML element, i.e. "name" and "id". It will
aloow to easily navigate through the groups of the repeatable elements. List of
such attributes could be configurable in the editor properties.

summary: Variable value should be displayed as hover tip when debugging
description:
To reproduce:
1. Start a C program in the debugger.
2. Verify that you have a local variable with an assigned value in the variable
view.
3. Put the mouse pointer over that variable in the displayed source code.

Expected result:
The value of the variable should have been displayed in a hover tip.

Current result.
Nothing happens.

summary: AspectJ does not honour libraries defined via Project Properties
Package view should offer properties for JRE classpath container [build path]
description:
Build 3.0M5

Currently, in order to select a different flavor of a JRE container, one has to 
select the project, find the build path tab, then library tab, then select 
container and edit it.

It would be far simpler if it offered properties directly on the JRE container 
element in package view.

summary: working set filter for Breakpoints view
description:
Please add different sorting options (including per-project sort).

Please add an option to enable and disable break point, enable and disable hit 
count and enable or disable condition without opening breakpoint properties 
dialog (i.e. by making this view as a table and showing those properties as a 
checkboxes).

It will make it much convenient to control break points. Especially if this 
will be implemented  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=41058

summary: [tools] Tools broken with new runtime
description:
We released the new Equinox runtime to HEAD yesterday.
There was a lot of refactoring and the Core tools use internal classes which
have been moved.

summary: New JUnit Plugin test is not working when class doesn't extends junit.framework.TestCase
description:
Using 0820, I was not able to set a new launching configuration for the class
AllAllTests in the jdt/ui refactoring tests. Even if the class name was ok, I
got an error message saying that the class was an invalid test suite.
Changing the superclass to junit.framework.TestCase fixed the error.
According to Adam, this is a bug in the JUnit Plugin Test runner.

summary: Eclipse deadlocks when switching from Java to CVS perspective
description:
Linux/Motif 3.0M4 on RedHat 9

I started running a long job in Eclipse over night, which ran to completion.
This morning when I tried switching from Java to CVS perspective, Eclipse
appears to have deadlocked. The hourglass cursor is spinning, but only the
backgrounds of the  widgets in the window are redrawing. (From the size and
positioning of the view outlines, it looks like I'm actually in the CVS
perspective.) CPU activity in Eclipse's JVM process is 0.0, and there is nothing
in the log. I could kill the process, no problem, but wanted to log a bug here
first and ask for advice if I can somehow coax Eclipse to at least throw me a
stack dump so I can include a report here on where it got deadlocked. This has
happened once or twice in the past, although I still haven't figured out how to
reliably reproduce it.

summary: consider listening to start level events to start the application
description:
Currently, we have the application runner as a separate bundle with the highest
start level so when it starts we know that all user bundles are startable before
we run the application.

Another approach would be to use the framework event for start level changes as
an indication that it is time to start the application. The benefit of this
approach is that we could get rid of another bundle/project.

summary: CVS commit should run in background
description:
I'm using 3.0 M5, and when I commit files, I have to wait for the commit to
complete before I can start using Eclipse.

I see no reason why I have to wait for the completion, and it should run in the
background.

summary: [content assist] Incorrect cursor position after code assist
description:
The cursor is left in an incorrect position after choosing an option (using
Enter key) from the code assist pop-up.

Create a class, Test, with a main method. When using code assist inside the main
method for class/method completion (not template expansion), the cursor keeps
being positioned to one of:
- after the closing brace of the main method,
- after the closing brace of the class,
- last character of the file.
The cursor should end up after the text chosen from the pop-up. Template
expansion works OK.

Tried with code assist preferences both on "completion inserts" and "completion
overwrites".

Cursor positioning has worked correctly on longer classes.

Eclipse 2.1.2 Build 200311030802, Windows XP, Sun J2SDK 1.4.1_01.

summary: [Wizards] WizardNewFileCreationPage should support a default file extension

In the WizardNewFileCreationPage, there should be a method to set what the 
default file extension should be. So when the page is asked to create the new 
file, it can check the entered file name if it ends with the default file 
extension provided, and if not, append it to the end of the file name.

summary: Adding first source folder to project looks too complex [code manipulation] [general issue]
description:
I20031119

- create new project with New Project wizard
- after specifying the name go to next page (don't use Finish button)
- select project and press "Add Folder"
Observe: a new modal dialog appears showing the same information as the original dialog.
You can repeat the selection you've already made and you have to press another "Create New 
Folder" button.
This feels clumsy (for the 95% case).

I suggest either to:
- rename the "Add Folder" button to "Add Source Folder" (because that's what it is).
- skip the second dialog if the select project doesn't contain any folders. In this case
  there is no need for letting the user select an existing project.

or
- rename the button "Add Folder" to "Add Source Folder"
- and create a new button "Create Source Folder"

summary: NPE occurs sometimes bringing up alignment dialog
description:
Create a class subclassing JPanel. Drop at two components onto the JPanel.
Change the layout of the JPanel to null. Bring up the Alignment dialog. Select 
the two components so that the alignment actions are enabled. Close the dialog.

Now select the JPanel while holding down the ctrl key so that the two 
components and the JPanel are selected. Bring up the alignment dialog again and 
it will be blank (no actions) and a NullpointerException is thrown in the log.
If this doesn't happen, try closing the dialog, deselecting one of the 
components and reopening the dialog. You may have to do this with deselecting 
and selecting the components and the JPanel... each time closing and reopening 
the alignment dialog. At some point, the NPE is thrown when you open the dialog 
and the dialog comes up blank.

When I double clicked on "ecos.ecc", I got an internal error.  No exceptions in 
log. Eclipse 3.0M5

I'll attach a picture.

summary: Quick Diff hovers don't use text editor font
description:
Quick Diff difference hovers use the java editor's text font for hovers to
provide an easy "visual diff" by hovering/unhovering.

This doesn't work in *text* editors (e.g. on a *.properties file), since the
hover uses a default font and doesn't take over the text editor's.

summary: Ant view icons for default target confused with Java protected decorator.
description:
The little blue triangle which overlaps the target is confusing since in the
Java view the blue triangle means protected. Just a thought: You could use the
same running-man decorator to mean default target that is used also used to say
"this class has a main() method". The current icon means "protected" target, to
me, at least ;-)
Version 3.0.m5

summary: Synchrinization is not working properly - resynchs from the root
description:
I am working with
Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200307120010

I traverse 4 or 5 levels deep into a project which is stored in a CVS repos. At
this level, when I right click on any file/folder, and select Team > Synchrinize
with remote, in the status bar at the bottom, I see that:
1) There are multiple messages which say "Authenticating using extssh". Shouldnt
this be done only once per synch run?
2) The synchnonization happens from the root - at least the messages indicate as
such.

summary: [Examples] Readme Example no longer contributes marker resolutions
description:
I20031203 (likely in previous 3.0 releases as well)
- self-hosting
- build a simple project with a *.readme file in it as described in the 
documentation for the readme example
- in the readme file editor, right click -> Add -> Readme Marker Example <n> 
(where n is 1 - 7)
- this will add a marker which shows up in the Tasks view (you may have to 
explicitly open the Tasks view to see it)

According to the documentation in Platform Plug-in Developer Guide-
 >Programmer's Guide->Advanced workbench concepts->Marker help and resolution-
>Contributing marker resolution  you should be able to right click on this  
task and then select Quick Fix to run a resolution.  But QuickFix is no longer 
offered on the Tasks view (see  bug 40637 ) 

Perhaps we should change the readme example so it creates 'problems' instead 
of 'tasks' so this example is still valid.

summary: [plan item] Standard Make Variable support
description:
Support (through Eclispe 3.0 framework) the use of variables in standard make
builder and targets definitions. Allowing the use to specify user defined and
platform defined variables that are resulted at time of build as agruments to
the make command.

summary: iterator in clone() may provide a copy of arrayList in different order
description:
in org.eclipse.hyades.logging.events:
some of the clone() methods uses Iterator to retrieve all the elements. This 
was OK before since it iterates through a hashMap, which order does not matter. 
However in CBE 101, it uses ArrayList instead of hashMap. By using a iterator, 
we have clone a copy of the ArrayList which has elements in different order 
than the original.

This is what stated in the sun javadoc:
public Iterator iterator()Returns an iterator over the elements in this 
collection. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the elements 
are returned (unless this collection is an instance of some class that provides 
a guarantee).

Classes affected by this bug:
CommonBaseEventImpl.java
ExtendedDataElementImpl.java

summary: The Software Update has a problem when it is configurated with HTTP proxy.

When I want to update the following message appear:

returned HTTP response code: 407 for URL:  http://update.eclipse.org/updates ]

[Server returned HTTP response code: 407 for URL: 
 http://update.eclipse.org/updates/site.xml ]

summary: [Compiler] x && false evaluates to "true"
Expose dialogs for creating classpath entries
description:
This is a request to provide non-internal access to the dialogs used to create 
classpath entries within the JDT UI. These would be simple dialogs or perhaps 
even just helper methods (e.g. IClasspathEntry[] showExternalJARDialog(Shell 
shell)) that could be used to present the user with the same dialogs and 
return a classpath entry. Specifically, the dialogs that appear by clicking on 
the following buttons on the Java Build Path properties, Libraries tab:
  Add JARs...
  Add External JARs...
  Add Variable..
  Add Library...
  Add Class Folder...

Exposing these dialogs would allow downstream JDT users to create and edit 
classpath entries outside of the regular JDT dialogs. For instance, providing 
a UI to set a server's classpath in an editor.

Currently, this is done by duplicating the dialogs. Maintenance of duplicate 
dialogs is an issue, as well as a usability problem since the dialogs are 
inevitably different.

summary: Review InternalPlatform.handleException
description: This method catches and discards Throwable.  It needs to be cleaned up.

summary: [RCP] New and Import wizards lose selection
description:
I2031119

1. In the Package Explorer: select a Java project or folder inside a Java project
2. Import...
3. Select any import (e.g. from ZIP)
==> the container (Into folder:) is not set

This works using the Navigator or a non-Java project.

Other scenario:
Select a project and add a simple folder
==> you have to select the project again.

Maybe it is not a major bug but it is very annoying and it look like a (RCP?)
regression.

summary: Source code not always found in debugger
description:
This report includes a description of my setup, a description of the problem, 
a description of the source of the problem, and a description of two possible 
solutions.

SETUP: My setup is a little complex.  I think that most of this is irrelevent, 
but I'm including it all just in case.

I'm running Eclipse 2.1.2 with CDT 1.2 on Windows XP.  I have a current cygwin 
installation (as of 2003-12-4) and prc-tools 2.3 installed (< http://prc -
tools.sf.net>).  I'm running from a drive (K:) that's mapped to my Documents 
directory (C:\Documents and Settings\Keith Rollin.PALMSOURCE\My Documents).  
My workspace (K:\Projects\Eclipse\plugins) is outside of my Eclipse directory 
(K:\Downloads\eclipse\2.1.2\eclipse).  I launch Eclipse with a shortcut that 
specifies the following command line: K:\Downloads\eclipse\2.1.2
\eclipse\eclipse.exe -data k:\Projects\Eclipse\plugins.  My runtime workspace 
is in the normal location relative to the main workspace 
(K:\Projects\Eclipse\runtime-workspace).  I am using the Eclipse for Palm OS 
plugin (< http://www.redfelineninja.dsl.pipex.com/software.html >) to debug Palm 
applications.  Because I'm developing extensions, most of my debugging is in a 
runtime IDE.  The problem I describe occurs both in the runtime IDE as well as 
the host IDE.

PROBLEM: The problem is that source files are not always found in the 
debugger.  Assume that I've developed a Palm application, have launched under 
the control of the Palm OS Emulator and the m68k-palmos-gdb debugger that 
comes with prc-tools, and that my Palm application has crashed and that I'm 
looking at a stack crawl in the debugger.  Clicking on a stack frame that 
corresponds to a function in my application results in a page saying that the 
source file cannot be found.

SOURCE: I think I've traced the problem to a couple of methods in 
CSourceLocator.  findFileByAbsolutePath() is given the path of a file to look 
for.  As part of its operation, it creates a File on that path, calls 
File.getCanonicalPath, and then passes the result to CSourceLocator.findFile
().  findFile iterates over all project members, looking for an IFile that has 
the same path.

The problem is that findFileByAbsolutePath is given a path where the drive 
letter is lower-case.  findFile also generates project item paths where the 
drive letter is lower-case.  However, the call to getCanonicalPath converts 
the lower-case drive letter to an upper-case drive letter, cause the strict 
string match between the target path and the project item paths to fail.

Eventually, it occurred to me that the paths being generated had a lower-case 
drive letter because I'd specified a lower-case drive letter in the command 
line in the shortcut I use to launch Eclipse.  Changing that, and changing the 
path to the runtime-workspace in my launch configuration (which appears to 
have been generated from the path I'd specified in the shortcut) fixed the 
problem.

As an interesting workaround, I also noticed that the source files could be 
found if my project was not in the workspace directory (that is, when I'd 
imported an existing project into my workspace from another location on my 
hard drive without actually copying the files into my workspace).  I never 
bothered to track down why this was so.

SOLUTION: One obvious fix to this problem would be to make more use of 
getCanonicalPath, thus generating consistant paths that could be compared 
against each other.  However, I have another suggestion.  While tracking down 
this bug, I noticed that the source-locator routines were given a simple file 
name (no path information), and were asked to find a file with that name in 
the project.  The algorithm used to perform this search involved iterating 
over the project, prefixing the file name with every possible path in the 
project, and then iterating over the project again looking for a file with 
that full path.  It seems to me that a much simpler approach would be to 
iterate over the project, and for each IFile, to see if the file name (without 
the path) matched the simple file name that was passed to the source locator.

summary: [Navigator] file icons are not updated when file associations are modified.
description:
I20031203

1. launch Eclipse on a new workspace
2. create a project
3. create a file named 'test1.xml'
The new file is displayed with the default (text) file icon.
4. associate '*.xml' files to the ant editor in
window>preferences>workbench>file associations
5. create a file named 'test2.xml'
The new file is displayed with the ant file icon, test1.xml is still displayed
with the default file icon.

Closing/re-opening the view solves the problem.

summary: Zoom Out action is enabled although it doesn't do anything
description:
1) Make your diagram big enough so that zooming to "Page" would require a zoom 
level that is less than the minimum.  
2) Set the zoom level to be the smallest possible from the drop-down combo 
box.  
3) At this point, the zoom out actions will be enabled.
4) However, clicking it won't do anything.

This is because canZoomOut() -- which invokes getMinZoom() -- takes the "Page" 
zoom setting into account.  However, when getPreviousZoomLevel() is invoked, it 
just returns the previous setting from the array of zoom levels, and ignores 
the "Page" zoom setting.

summary: ZoomManager's "Page" settings cause erratic behavior
description:
Keep entering 1% in the zoom combo box and you will see that the diagram keeps 
shrinking a little by little.  This is because the ZoomManager is interpreting 
that 1% as "Page," and shrinking the diagram accordingly.  And since it's using 
the Figure's preferred size to calculate the zoom level, and because changing 
the zoom level changes its preferred size, when you enter 1% the next time, the 
new minimum zoom is slightly less than earlier.

summary: CVS metafiles always have unix EOL
description:
(Third time -- at least I copied the Description pane text this time! Thank you 
bugzilla.)

Ok, second time typing this in because I got an error submitting it the first 
time and Bugzilla told me to hit the Back button and fix it and lost all the 
data on the form when I did (nice). This will be shorter due to my RSI.

Our CVS server is running on an OS X Machine (10.2.6)

When checking out a project from CVS on Windows, it is checked out as a Unix 
project. If you try to perform any CVS actions on the checked out project using 
Tortoise CVS, you are shown an error message that tells you did. I had typed in 
the whole message last time but cannot this time (you cannot copy/paste the 
error message in the dialog -- nice -- they really think of us folk with RSI 
when designing apps). 

Problems due to this: Cannot diff (compare) files in Eclipse. Cannot use 
checked out project with TortoiseCVS.

Seen on WinXP and Windows 2000.

summary: Plugin import - wizard does not consider target platform refresh
description:
Build 20031202

I am developping for Eclipse 2.1 using a self-hosting 2.1 workspace on top of 
Eclipse SDK 3.0. I wanted to launch Eclipse 2.1 as a runtime workbench so as to 
run some test suites (due to  bug 48125 ); and thus remembered I needed to import 
an extra plug-in: org.eclipse.pde.junit.

In order to do so, I did the following:
- open the file import plug-in wizard
- configured the target platform there to point at a 2.1.2 SDK install
- select import as binary
- press NEXT
- in the list of available plug-ins, org.eclipse.pde.junit isn't available
(ok as it is not part of the 2.1 delivery)
- hit BACK, keep import wizard up,
- outside Eclipse, expand the missing plug-in into the 2.1.2 install
- back inside Eclipse, import wizard is still up, click on target platform 
button
- in target platform wizard, press RELOAD
- observe that org.eclipse.pde.junit is listed, press OK
- back into import wizard, press NEXT
- observe that org.eclipse.pde.junit is NOT listed 
(you have to close and reopen the wizard so as to see it)

summary: Synchronizing RTF files always reports same
description:
I have some MS Word RTF documents in my project. I have added the documents 
successfully to the projects CVS module. However, now that I have changed the 
documents with Word (started from Eclipse), Synchronize believes no commit is 
necessary. It consistently reports no changes and I am not able to commit the 
changed version to the repository. Even when I just "commit" without 
synchrinizing first, nothing happens.

Things I checked:

- The Eclipse properties for the local file shows the correct, new date.
- In CVS there is only the initial version, with correct (old) date.
- The local document is really different from what's in the repository.
- The document is checked in as binary.

advanced  , add folders, you will be presented with a list of projects in your
workspace including _closed_ project which in this dialog you can't open.  You
should only be shown projects were are open and have folders you could possibly
select.

summary: Difficulty creating "swt-like" fragment
description:
eclipse-SDK-I20031202-win32

I created a fragment in M5 that replaces some functionality in an existing 
plugin.  I did this by:
1. modifying the plugin's plugin.xml to include an additional runtime 
jar "replace.jar" (first in the list of jars)
2. creating a fragment that contained:
a. replace.jar (this is not window system specific so is just in the root 
directory of the fragment)
b. a fragment.xml that imported the necessary plug-ins to make replace.jar run 
correctly.  There is no runtime declaration for replace.jar

In M5 (pre-osgi) the previous steps worked successfully.  The plugin is 
augmented with both replace.jar and the additional imports.

In the first osgi build, I appear to be failing.  I say "appear" because my pre-
osgi debugging steps are not available so I could be making a trivial pilot 
error.  First failure: check to see if the fragment is installed (not shown in 
current configuration details - e.g., cannot see swt fragment).  

 bug 46494  makes me believe that this should work.
 bug 43658  discusses how swt works, however, I see manifest files in the swt 
plug-in and fragment so there may be additional steps I need to do (but did not 
see any requirement for additional steps in the porting guide).

Please advise.  We need to be able to do something like this (target: M6).  
Given that swt works, I hypothesize that I am either missing some required step 
or just pilot error.

summary: Autoformat inserts unwanted tabs when formatting javadoc
description:
Hi,

This has been occuring for a while in the 3.0 stream.  Using 'ctrl-shift-f'
style autoformat will insert tabs ahead of javadoc comments even if the
preference dialog is set to use spaces instead of tabs.

To demonstrate:

Set up your prefs:  Uncheck Java -> Code Formatter -> Style -> Insert tabs for
indentation & Check Java -> Editor -> Typing -> Insert spaces for tabs

It doesn't matter if you're using the old style formatter or have checked the
new autoformatter in the Work In Progress sheet.

Then select all in a java file with poorly formatted javadoc.  Tabs will be
inserted.

-tim

summary: Support for multiple JDK levels of BeanInfos
description:
The current level of BeanInfo in the VE is JDK 1.3 and the VE allows other JDK 
levels in the remote VM (e.g. JDK 1.4) but the property values, events, and 
layout managers in the IDE are reflective of the JDK 1.3 BeanInfo level only.

An example of this is the 'rollover' property on a javax.swing.JToolBar. It's 
not available in JDK 1.3 but is new for JDK 1.4.

We need the capability for the user to specific a different JDK BeanInfo level 
in order to make use of additional functionality in JDK enhancements.

summary: fragments not searched for classpath entries
description:
In DefaultClassLoader.getClasspath() we are looking for a file to match a given 
classpath entry.  Currently we only look in the bundle itself, we never 
consider fragments of the bundle.  This makes the following interesting usecase 
impossible

Bundle A manifest.mf
Bundle-Classpath: foo.jar

Bundle B manifest.mf
Bundle-Host: BundleA

where bundle A does NOT contain foo.jar and bundle B DOES contain foo.jar

summary: ExtensionPointSchemaBuilder process unneccesary schemas
description:
I have a project, with a "test" folder, that contains several schemas, dtds, 
etc., used for testing. When I do a "rebuild all", I get the the following build 
error. The error itself seems to be another bug on schema processing (which I'll 
open after this one), but this bug I'm reporting is that is seems that the 
schema builder should not be processing all schema files in a project. I'm not 
sure how its decided which might go with extension points, but in large projects 
with lots of schemas, would result in lots of unnecessary processing. Plus, 
there could be truely invalid schemas (perhaps under development), which should 
not interfere with build. I've seen this on M4 and M5 builds. 

= = = =  =
Build problems
  Errors during build.
    java.lang.NullPointerException encountered while running org.eclipse.pde.
internal.builders.ExtensionPointSchemaBuilder.

summary: [RCP] Move icons from IDE to workbench
description:
GEF would like to require only RCP.  The UP and DOWN Icons are available, 
internally only, in the IDEInternalWorkbenchImages class.

Can you consider:
a) making icons public so as to avoid duplication or internal API
b) moving appropriate icons from IDE to non-IDE.

summary: Property sheet does not repaint
description:
Build I20031210

1) Select something in the Navigator to make the vertical scroll bar appear in 
the property sheet
2) Scroll the property sheet vertically using 'v' button

Observe: the horizontal grid lines are not cleaned up, so they start to appear 
inside the rows. Looks like some refreshes are not happening.

summary: All bookmarks and tasks lost after Eclipse crashes.
description:
////////// My configuration: /////////////////////
1. Eclipse platform Version: 2.1.0 Build id: 200303272130
2. Besides the standard plugins came with Eclispse platform, I've installed the
following plugin: 
  - PHPEclipse Tools Core (1.0.9) 
  - PHPEclipse SQL Utility (1.0.1)

///////// How did the problem rise: ///////////////
1. I'm doing a PHP project on another machine (mounted the remote directory with
NFS to my local disk). 

2. The remote computer reboot without closing Eclipse properly. And then Eclipse
goes dead ("ps afx" command reveals that the status of Eclipse's main thread is
"D" (uninterrupted IO process? not sure...) ) 

3. I "kill" all its child-threads by force, but I was not able to kill its main
thread.

4. The remote computer done its reboot, and Eclipse threads got killed
automatically.

5. I re-open Eclipse and the project,  and I found all my bookmarks and tasks
disappeared...  (All other settings, like short-cut keys, are working fine)


this is TOO bad because there were more than 50 of them over there... I'm
reading the source code written by another guy, and those bookmarks are really
important to me. Is it possible to restore them?

Can anyone help? Big thanks in advance!

summary: Add plugin reference to javadoc
description:
Since some packages (org.eclipse.ui for example) have classes distributed within 
several plugins (workbench, ide, etc) it would be very useful to have a 
reference in the javadoc of the classes indicating which plugins provide those 
classes.

description:

OS: Windows

While Debugging, and the execution performs a "cin >>"", the application is

summary: [SWT] layout problems on mac
description:
Doug, this might be an SWT issue in general (I notice that there are some minor layout problems on 
a few other dialogs, i.e. find/replace on the mac has its combo boxes a little too close together), 
but the Keys preference page is the biggest offender.

As i've done nothing with the layout in some time, and you've recently changed the page by adding 
a tab folder, etc. I'll let you have a crack to see if you can find the problem, otherwise SWT might 
know something about this already..

summary: [KeyBindings] ctrl-1 on non-text editor panes brings up r-click menu
description:
Ctrl-1 on non-text-editor panes could bring up the right-click menu.  This would
allow for kbd navigation of r-click features, and fit in with the 'what would
you like to do with this' mentality found when ctrl-1'ing within java source.

Comments?

Andy

summary: [GlobalActions] "Forward" & "Back" global actions dont seem to be global
[ActivityMgmt] Pattern bindings need to support paths
description:
20031209

There is a requirement from the help team that they can bind to paths as well 
as ids so that they can set up mappings for documentation entries and 
filtering.

summary: @throws reference incorrectly warned as not declared
Need to open-up the plugin converter
description:
As of today the plugin converter generates manifest one by one ignoring all 
other bundles. 
This has a limitation for bundles that do not have their own jars like SWT.

The idea in opening the converter is to give capabilities to PDE (who has the 
global view of the system) to say what to generates for those cases.

summary: Ant classpath problems
description:
I20031202

I'm no longer able to run my Ant scripts in I20031202.
I'm getting the error dialog of  attachment #1   [details] .
For Ant's classpath pref page see  attachment #2   [details] .
Ant's home seems to be updated, but the Ant Home Entries refer to a stale folder.
Is this my fault or should Ant work automatically from build to build?

summary: Field name should be set when dropping from palette
description:
When dropping a component onto the freeform, there should be some ability to set
the field name easily, instead of renaming the field later - which causes a RLFS.
Something like a dialog should pop-up when a bean is dropped on the freeform
asking for the field name.

summary: add an external class path to project
description:
My runtime system requires some configuration files in the class path.
Those paths are not in the project/source-scope/directory.
Neither the configuration files nor the project can be moved.
I would like to add an extternal class path to my project (not to eclipse),
but this is not possible!?

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen

summary: Support AWT MenuBar (not a Component)
JVE Palette should persist its open/closed state
description:
This apparently was fixed and now it doesn't work. From cmvc defect 239921:

    <Note by myersdj (MYERS, JEFFREY D.), 2003/02/24 14:26:14, seq: 1 rel: 0  
action: open>
This is a regression on defect 215557. It appears this regressed and
no one noticed it.  The behavior doesn't work in v5.0 GA either. 
See defect 215557 for description of the problem and the solution.

Here's defect 215557:
   <Note by sri (Gunturi, Srimanth), 2002/07/16 12:07:03, seq: 1 rel: 0  
action: open>
JVE Palette should persist its open/closed state.

The palette is not persisting its opened/closed state
across sessions of editing. Perhaps it should remember
per input file, its persistance state.

    <Note by gmendel (Mendel, Gili (Dr.)), 2002/07/18 11:33:52, seq: 2 rel: 0  
action: assign>
Old Owner: gmendel
New Owner: winchest



    <Note by winchest (Winchester, J), 2002/07/23 12:05:23, seq: 3 rel: 0  
action: verify>
When you open/close the palette is now updates the flag that is
shown on the preferences page that comes from the VCEPlugin.  This then
affects the next opened editors.  I didn't want to make the open/close state on 
a per
file basis - it seemed to be more like resizing a viewer to me so it is just 
global
for the editor configuration of either split pane or notebook

    <Note by rkalim (Kalim, Rolf), 2002/08/12 12:29:16, seq: 4 rel: 0  action: 
note>
Nice feature,
Works in 20020812_0100-WB20-V50W

    <Note by sri (Gunturi, Srimanth), 2002/08/20 11:58:24, seq: 5 rel: 0  
action: verifynote>
Persists state across sessions.

summary: [KeyBindings] Provide availableInDialog property on key bindings
description:
Provide a read-only property -- availableInDialog -- on key bindings.  This
property should be available to developers, but not visible to the user.  It
indicates when a key binding is appropriate for use in the dialog.

(this enhancement is just so i don't forget)

summary: The proper terminate sequence is not follow when target terminate fails
description:
If, for example, the target can not be terminated
it becomes impossible to terminate the session.
Since the button becomes disable.

- It would be nice to catch the exception and continue
the termination sequence on the session.

- Even if the termination fails on the target, the button
  should not be disable when the exception is thrown since
  later on it could be done successfully

summary: The status line elements for reloading/synchronization etc... are not available in JavaBeans viewer or PropertySheet
description:
In the editor part the status line shows the status of the file being edited, 
together the synchronization pause button, the sync arrows.  These are not 
available when the JavaBeans viewer or Property viewer is selected, and it'be 
useful if they were

summary: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in DeadlockDetector.lockAcquired
description:
build I20031121

OK, so my build is somewhat out of date.
However, maybe this is still relevant.

- did a sync 
- selected two projects and did an Override and Update
- it started smoking the cigarette
- selected some more projects and chose Update
- still smoking
- the progress view didn't indicate anything was happening

summary: $ws$ etc not processed for classpath entries
description:
It appears that the current code does not handle $ws$ entries on the classpath 
of bundles.  I thought that we did this work.  It works for native libs etc.  
This is needed for SWT scenarios.

In the SWT case it is possible to have several SWTs installed at the same 
time.  Of course, when you run, only one should be selected.  The SWT plugin in 
Eclipse classic has $ws$/swt.jar on the classpath.  The plugin itself never 
contains that jar, it always comes from fragments by processing the $ws$ 
directive while searching for the jar.

Without this capability the swt.jars from Motif and GTK will both get added to 
SWT's classpath (or just the first one found).  Both situations are less than 
optimal.

summary: Deferred creation of Table items
description:
Creating large Tables (10,000 or more items) in SWT is currently very slow and
memory-intensive.

It would be possible to improve the runtime if the SWT Table could request
TableItems via a callback when they first become visible rather than requiring
all TableItems to be created in advance. This would also allow Table to reclaim
the resources for TableItems that are no longer visible.

Alternatively, the SWT Table widget could provide a Listener interface that
sends notifications when rows gain and lose visibility, allowing some
higher-level object to implement a deferred creation strategy.

summary: Add "Paste refactoring"
description:
Examples of how text paste is inferior to "paste refactoring"

- automatically add missing imports
- automatically add local variables with names and types as in the source site.

I'm sure someone who has a more profound understanding of Eclipse and 
Refactoring could expand upon this.

Øyvind

summary: Need to maintain settings order
description:
Testcase: Marathon Beans - MBTJTextField Weight: 5

There are two problems, currently we can't maintain settings
order. The order stored in the java file is not maintained.

The second problem is that certain properties cannot be set
before other properties. Because of this we must be able to modify
the order of the properties, plus we need a registry of what the 
proper order is for a particular class.

For example, JTextField, can't set selectionStart until after Text has been
set. The problem is in this example is that the order of properties returned
is independent of the order set, and due to hashing, the selectionStart may
be applied before text has been set, even though in the code it is the other way
around.

Waiting on EMF to support this concept.

summary: // comment at the end of the file
description:
In the case of // comment at the end of the file,
adding a button for example, will duplicate the comment.
This is because JDOM (local doc) consider the // comment as part of 
the method

summary: Import filter type will not reduce to xml selection
description:
When you try to import files into a java project you can not select xml files to
automatically be included when trying to reduce the filter selection when
selecting the filter types. Trying to add xml to other extensions does not work
as xml disappears from the list.  Other extensions added to the other extensions
seems to work fine.

summary: Support of implicit properties
JTabbedPane - tabText should appear on JavaBeans viewer + feedback on drop should be more explicit
description:
JTabbedPane.  The JavaBeans viewer should show the tabText for the page on the 
JavaBeans viewer so the user knows which entry corresponds to which page
Also - on graph viewer drop the feedback for new pages is not that clear.  
There is no visual feedback such as a rectangle or otherwise cue that a new 
page is being created.  One thing I like is the use of hover help in other 
feedbacks, so maybe we need to think about things like "Create a new tab page" 
appearing.  We could use this in other places as well in the JVE and just have 
more feedback to the user about what is going to occur after a drop rather 
than just drawing lines or highlighting GUI areas - sort of similar to what we 
already do for GridBagLayout and works well with row/column feedback but we 
could extend this to other areas

summary: Split editors to view two parts of same file
description:
It would be very useful to be able to view two parts of the same file at the
same time.
An alternative would be to allow two editors to look at the same file, maybe
limiting one to a read-only view.

summary: Breakpoint can be set in an empty method
Move to use the Platform UI color support
description:
From the platform ui mailing list, there is now Color support much like the 
Font support. Ant should move to using the new extension points and the color 
support.

summary: [RCP] New file in a java package does not default to package dir
description:
Creating a new file in a java package, such as 'package.html', does not defaultl
positions the new file within the package directory.   ie: selecting package
'org.my.package', r-click, choose new->file, opens 'New File' dialog whose
parent folder is the root of the workspace, rather than the
/myproject/src/org/my/package/ directory, which must be browsed to manually.

Thanks,

Andrew

summary: LD error parser always assumes error conditions
description:
The current ld error parser always assumes that information
being reported is an error rather than a warning.  This makes
statements such as:

ld: warning: libcpp.so.2, needed by C:/temp//libdisplay.so, may conflict with 
libcpp.so.3

Cause red errors instead of yellow warnings =;-)

summary: 3.0M5 - java editing performance killed by unnecessary "Java AST creation" threads
description:
Monitoring the "Progress" tab, I'm noticing 3.0M5 takes a ton of CPU, and it 
looks like the "Java AST creation" threads that happen aren't just when the 
java source changes, but even when the cursor just moves.  Just clicking around 
to select things can have up to 3 or 4 of those threads going (all but one goes 
to "cancelled" state fine).  It's making the editing basically unusable on a 
decent (p3/700, 512MB) system, especially when a number of cut-and-paste 
operations are needed.  It "feels" like 3.0M4 was much more responsive on the 
same machine.

What things can I do or provide to help debug this if necessary?

summary: Replace With... should not attempt replace with non existing version
description:
Build 200312162000

1. Check out version v20031215 of org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests and 
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring
2. Select both project
3. Replace With...->Another Branch or Version...
4. Select version v200312161200
Observe: After the replacing has complete, org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring 
is empty. This is because there is no version v200312161200 for this project.

summary: Process will not show as terminated after reattach
description:
Driver: 20031211_1537

This can be reproduced using the "DetachAttachTest1" test case below.
Upon reattach, the program is run to completion but the agent is not turning 
to "Terminated".

Instructions:
1. Launch (locally/remotely) InOut.  Ensure "Boundary class included" box is 
NOT checked. 
2. Open the Method Statistics view after the entry prompt is displayed in the 
Profiling Console.  Refresh until no additional data is shown.
3. Detach the agent
4. Press enter in the Profiling Console.  Refresh the views and verify that no 
additional data is displayed.
5. Attach and start monitoring the agent
6. Press enter in the Profiling Console to terminate the program.  
7. Open the Execution Flow view and verify that there is no call to 
InOut.methodA().

summary: Coolbars not colapsing rows after a resize.
description:
Open the workbench and switch to the java perspective
make the workbench window really small, forcing there to be a four (4) row toolbar
then resize the window large again

Note that there still are 4 rows in the toolbar when they could have been
collapsed back to one.  This is painful because moving all the little toolitem
groups back takes time

Note2, this also happens on GTK as well as MOTIF

summary: [Workbench] Two debug views
description:
I20031218 0955

I got into a state where there were two debug views tiled together (see attached
image).

When I closed one debug view, the other tab remained, but the view content area
was blank.  I then moved another view into the group (console view).  When I
closed the console view, the remaining debug view was back to normal (showing
usual contents in content area).

summary: Scrapbook launch config name is not user friendly
description:
The names used for scrapbook launch configs are not user friendly, and not 
meant for display in the current format. Since LC names are now displayed in 
the console title bar, we should change this. For example "Console - 
snip.jpage-Scrapbook-1071679716544".

summary: [SSH2] JSchException: channel is not open
description:
Thanks for a great plug-in it works just fine under Windows,
but on Linux I experience a problem:
It works when Eclipse is started, but when I have not used the cvs 
connection for a while (10-20 minutes maybe?). I get the following error:
Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: channel is not opened
Seems I have to restart Eclipse to make it work again.
 
 > I have not been able to reproduce this problem by myself yet,
> but I found a defect in the code.  I guess this problem will happen
> in the session down by IP routers, NAT, etc., and not by the remote sshd.
> Now, I have rewritten the code and he has written me that his problem has 
> disappeared.

summary: Cannot create log correlation in other perspective and cannot cancel wizard
description:
Test cases: (log_Navigator_4)
Driver: hyades.runtime_1.2.0_20031217_1814.zip

To repoduce:
 >Import one or more log file
>switch to perspective other than profiling perspective, eg resouce perspective.
>File->New->Other->Profiling and Logging->Log Correlation
> NO available Logs is shown
>click CANCEL and cannot cancel wizard.

description:
Test Case: Log_Navigator_5
Driver: hyades.runtime_1.2.0_20031217_1814.zip

summary: Tracing options not honored.
description:
20031217
Create launching configuration.
Enable tracing, change some tracing option values.

After launching tracing options that were changed in the launching 
configuration have the wrong values (the defaults), not ones specified in the 
launching configurations.
Going to launching configuration, to double check the options reveals that the 
choices were also not saved.  All the tracting options show default values 
(from file).

summary: Refresh from Local is not consistant as in PD Expolorer
description:
Import some logs, save the logs, import a symtom db and create a log 
correlation. and then run a refresh from local, the view is not update.

summary: number of calls is incorrect for serverImpl()
description:
machine:peanut
driver: 20031218_1210

Problems:
the number of calls of serverImpl() I get is 1, while the testcase description 
state that it should be 6. (i also looked into the source code it should be 6)

Steps to recreate problem:
1. Launch (locally/remotely) StatisticsTest
8>Press enter in the profiling console until it terminates
9>Open Instance Statistics window and verify that there is the following class 
information.

	Class Name	Live Instances
	StatisticsTest		0
	Reporter		1
	ServerImpl		1

10>Open Method Statistics window and verify the following:

	Method Name	          Calls
	Reporter()	           1
	getQuote()	           2
	loadNewVersionOfServer()   6
	main()	                   1
	ServerImpl()               6  (on HP,Solaris method name is -clinit-())
	test1()	                   2

summary: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError when running LoggingUtilSample
description:
machine: peanuts
when running the the LoggingUtilSample with profiling turn on (e.g. java -
XrunpiAgent:server=standalone -
classpath "$CLASSPATH:hlcore.jar:hexr.jar:logutil.jar" LoggingUtilSample)

the following exception got thrown:
In Main before creating the logging object

In constructor: before creating all objects

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested -512444872 
bytes

I try increase the heapsize by -Xms 500M -Xmx1000M but get the same result

NOTE: it works with profiling turned off.

this is the jvm:
java version "1.3.1_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1_01)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1_01, mixed mode)

summary: Current Update Manager unacceptable for new users
description:
Currently the new user using the update manager for installing has to install 3 
components separately.

This is unacceptable for the following reasons:

-no guidelines on the order of installing the components (ambiguous to the user)
-there 15 ways to install the CDT components for testing even though 12 of them 
does not make any sense.
-you cannot create a C/C++ project if you are installing only the CDT (managed 
and standard projects are only available by installing the build components)
-there is a Component ID error when installing only the CDT and Managed Build 
components


Suggestion: -for users, one package to install is the best way.

This has to be done soon so that we can have time to test the customer scenario 
before release.

summary: M5 New File from context Menu of a package does not work
description:
This is on 3.0M5. When I want to create a new file directly in a package, the 
wizard window won't select the associated directory. In fact, all the fields of 
the window are blank.

On previous version, when doing the explained action, the directory of the 
selected package would automatically be selected in the "New File" window.

summary: SWT shell cannot gain focus
description:
SWT shell displays but cannot gain focus.  This occurs with numerous applications using the 
SWT toolkit, including the examples from org.eclipse.swt.examples.  (for example, the Hello 
example).  After trying to select the SWT shell using the mouse to gain focus, I get a "bus error" 
with no other details provided.

I'm running Max OS-X 10.3.2, but have also seen the problem on 10.3.1 and 10.3.0, in all cases 
using libswt-carbon-2135.jnilib.  Running Java 1.4.1_01.

summary: [plan item] IBM-Rational Managed Build Enhancements
description:
This is a partial SRS for the managed build system for the CDT 2.0 release. A 
long list of requirements was compiled based on feedback we received from a 
number of end users. However, there were simply too many suggestions for us to 
implement in the time we have allocated to this release. This document 
describes the requirements that we feel are important to the end-user 
experience and that should be considered for the next release of the managed 
build system. That said, the requirements that are not on the short list are 
all valid, and if some other partner wishes to contribute the work, then they 
can also be considered for the release.

summary: build project fails after build clean
description:
Right-click project in C/C++ Projects View
- select "Build Make Target..."
- build target "clean"
Right-click project again
- select "Build Project"

The build should start but instead nothing happens.

summary: GTK fires additional events than Windows when selecting a Combo item
description:
When running org.eclipse.swt.examples in package controlexample, I selected 4
kind of event listeners for Combo widget: Selection, defaultSelection, FocusIn,
FocusOut. Then I click the combo and select a different item. The event console
shows 4 events in the following order:

FocusIn, FocusOut, Selection, FocusIn

Repeat the same steps on WondowsXP, 2 events are fired: FocusIn, Selection.

summary: Cumulative time for main() is much less than expected on iSeries
description:
On the iSeries, the cumulative time for the main() method is too small. For our 
InOut test case, the cumulative time for main() is 0.062582 sec but the actual 
elapsed time is 8.788 sec.

This is an iSeries JVMPI specific bug.

summary: Badindentation and TAB key behavior after an opening parenthesis
description:
I am reporting what I consider a new, flawed behavior of the TAB key in 3.0M5,
as compared to the 2.1.x versions.

My test scenario:

I enter a line in the Java editor which ends with a ( and hit ENTER.
In both 2.1.x and 3.0M5 the caret is moved to the following line (as expected).
However, 3.0M5 automatically inserts 2 extra tabs in that new line. 2.1.x does
not try to outsmart me and places the caret at the indentation level, i.e.
start of the new line in context of the current block. At this point I should
mention that I want to indent the following line with just ONE tab. Example:

{
    someMethodName(
        arg1, arg2, arg3); // ok!
}

What 3.0M5 forces is:

{
    someMethodName(
            arg1, arg2, arg3); // WRONG!
}
 
So to get back to preferred state in 3.0M5, I have to hit backspace 4 times
after hitting ENTER (as I use space-for-tab substitution).

There is yet another related situation in which 3.0M5 "helps" to reduce my
typing speed and temper. Suppose that I place the caret at the block
indentation level (below "s" in the example), or even an the very beginning
of the line following the one with (. When I hit TAB now, and it results in
a huge caret jump to the location where "arg1" begins in the flawed version.

I thought that it may be some new crazy preference in 3.0, but I did not find
any way to disable it. Fiddling with both "smart cursor positioning"
preferences under "Java/Editor/Typing" does not help.

summary: Strange formatting (bold) in Javadoc pop-ups
description:
Random parts of the Javadoc help shown on mouse hover are drawn in bold face.
This happens consistently for many, though not all, javadoc descriptions.
I am using Linux with GTK 2.2.4. See the attached screenshot for an example.

summary: [JUnit] The "Runs", "Errors" and "Failures" fields accept keyboard focus
description:
Click on the "Runs" value displayed in the JUnit view. A blinking caret will
appear. Because these fields never contain more than a single, at most two
numbers, it does not seem that you need to support keyboard focus for
copy/paste's sake.

I tested on Linux GTK 2.2.4, but I guess that the same problem will be
reproducible under Windows, too.

summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/General - Private key text problem
description:
Open the preference page.

Select the entire contents of the "Private key" text field.

Press "Delete" key -> the text field should be empty now.

Now click on the "Add Private Key..." button and select a key.

Observe the key will be added to the text field but will be prefixed by a ","

summary: [templates] QuickFix: Surround with do,for,etc is suggested when class/method selected
description:
If you select a method or class, and then open QuickFix, it suggests Surround with do,for,etc which 
doesn't seem correct.

summary: [SSH2] Passphrase validation warning in wizard
description:
The following behavior would be appreciated:

Empty passphrase/Empty confirm:

Typing in passphrase -> no error message.
Typing in confirm -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)

Empty passphrase/Non-empty confirm

Typing in passphrase text -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)

@@@@

There could be a warning that not having a passphrase (i.e. both text fields are
empty) is insecure.

summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/Key Management - Comment
description:
Changing the comment in the comment text should immediately update the comment
in the preview above.

summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/General - Button size
description:
The "Browse..." and "Add Private Key..." buttons should be in their "natural"
size  and not be sized according to a Layout.

summary: NullpointerException in TypeBinding.getInterfaces().
description:
get an NullPointerException in TypeBinding.getInterface() line 189.

this method should handle NullPointerException and return NO_INTERFACES.

summary: Delete an entire line
description:
A nice feature I would like to see added is the ability to delete an entire 
line of text by pressing shift and delete.

summary: Source/uncomment does not work
description:
M6, german keyboard layout, configuration: default.
The command source/uncomment has the key sequence Ctrl+\ assigned, which does 
not work with a german keyboard.
However, i also was unable to assign a more appropriate key sequence. Toggling 
using Ctrl+Shift+/ does not work, either.

Ref.:
 http://carbon.cudenver.edu/~tphillip/GermanKeyboardLayout.html 
 http://www.microsoft.com/globaldev/keyboards/kbdgr.htm

summary: JUnit view slows down the execution of unit tests. [JUnit]
description:
It seems that for a huge number of tests (I'm using a lot of test suites
generated from external test data) Eclipse's JUnit view slows down the execution
of the whole suite. I believe that because of showing an execution status for
these test in the test hierarchy, as well as status in the status line. I
believe that view can be implemented in a better way, to do not slow down the
execution of unit tests.

summary: New code formatter prefs: can't look at predefined profiles [code formatter]
description:
I200312162000

I am forced to create a new copy of predefined profiles to see the settings.

summary: outline and ant runner views should include imported targets
description:
In handling an imported file (using the <import> task), the outline and ant
runner views should behave similarly as when entity includeds are used. 

The difficulty in implementing this, I am guessing, is that imports are probably
resolved at runtime rather than at parse time. A build file author might,
perhaps, use a property dereference to in the <import file=""/> declaration. To
accomediate this an action in the views could prompt the user with a dialog
allowing him to associate the import with a specific file in the file system.
This configuration detail could be saved in a comment in the build file itself
or else in some other configuration store.

Of course, we could handle direct file references now and code for property
dereferences in the import's file attribute later.

summary: [External Tools] Add the ability to associate an external tool with an extension
description:
It would be nice to allow one to run an external tool whenever a file with a
certain extension, or pattern, is modified.  This is useful when it's not really
worth writing an editor for some particular type of file, but it must still be
compiled or processed in some manner.  I would imagine the UI to be similar to
that of the "File Associations" preferences page, except that multiple external
tools could be specified, with order being significant.

The particular use case that I have is developing applications for the Hiptop
platform ( http://www.danger.com/ ).  The Hiptop folks have defined a file of type
.rsrc (resource), which is a fairly simple text file.  I would like the ability
to launch the Danger Resource Compiler external tool that I have defined
whenever I save the file in the default text editor.  Currently I must do it
manually, which is a little clunky and error-prone.  I could (and perhaps I
will) make a plugin that is specifically meant to edit that type of file, but in
the meantime, it would be nice to have the aforementioned tool-launching ability.

It may be that this functionality already exists somewhere; but I cannot find it
if it does. :)

summary: AspectJ weaver API is not threadsafe
description:
I am using the weaver API (mostly BcelWorld and BcelWeaer) in a multithreaded
environment and ran into problems. I tracked them down to some static variables
in the BCEL library implementation that can cause exceptions in the weaver
(signatures are not parsed correctly) when executed via mulitiple threads. Maybe
the weaver implementation can use the BCEL library in a threadsafe way to allow
multiple threads working with the weaver API.

summary: Source control folders should not be visible in package view
description:
When using folder based source control e.g. CVS and Subversion, the CVS 
folders appear in the package view of the application. I'll try and do a 
simple ACSII drawing of this

Assuming your source is in src you get 


+ src
  + CVS                - empty
  + foo.CVS            - empty
  + foo.myPackage      - has content
  + foo.myPackage.CVS  - empty

All the CVS entries should not be present, they should be ignored as they're 
not valid packages. Same applies to .SVN folders if your using subversion. You 
probably should be able to configure eclipse to tell it what files to ignore.

summary: FTP Sync wants me tu upload non-existant file
description:
I have trouble syncing my projects with remote FTP server.
Sometimes the FTP Sync gets mixed up somehow and offers me stupid things to do
like uploading a non-existant file.

see attackement for esample

summary: Remote empty for outgoing deletion on branch
description:
I opened a compare editor on an outgoing deletion and both the local and 
remote were empty. The error in the log said 'Exception creating editor: File 
does not exist" but there was no stack trace.

summary: Spelling mistake in the FORMATTER_INSERT_SPACE_BETWEEN_EMPTY_ARGUMENTS string constant
[CellEditors] Need StyledTextCellEditor
description:
GEF needs to support editing of word-wrapped strings using CellEditors.  We 
tried using TextCellEditor with MULTI | WRAP style bits.  It is problematic due 
to its limitations on win32.

Our workaround is to use StyledText. Therefore, we need a StyledTextCellEditor.

We can provide the test case and implementation if needed.

I20031216

Edit a profile using the new code formatter pref page, go to "White Space" tab:

summary: API to get access to a IColorManager implementation
description:
For the WSADIE tooling, we have an expression editor which uses a java-like 
syntax. We would like to reuse the color define by the java editor (for 
strings, keywords, other).

I found the public interface IJavaColorConstants and IColorManager. But I could 
not find an API to get access to an implementation of IColorManager. The only 
thing I could find was JavaPlugin.getDefault().getJavaTextTools
().getColorManager(). But JavaPlugin is an internal class.

Is there some API I did not see to accomplish this? If not, could one be added?

summary: dump only changed classes
description:
As suggested by William Louth on aspectj-users, could the compiler support a
flag to only dump unchanged classes?  That would permit a simple copy rule for
updating jars and provide the SCM world with concrete de-minimus proof and
protection against aspects gone wild.  It might soothe some of the pain if we
don't fully support -outjar.

For those interested in contributing a patch on point, Jim suggested how to
implement this: modify the method
org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.dumpUnchanged to do nothing.

See attachment.

Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200401070010 GTK build

Steps to reproduce:

New workspace.

Clicking on the "Open a Perspective" button will show the regular icon.

Once I've opened the perspective the checkmark icon will be shown after clicking
on the "Open a Perspective" button again.

summary: change tooltips on-the-fly
description:
It would be nice to change a tooltip and have it appear on the fly. A 
specially useful case would be to set the tootip to null and have it disappear 
right away.

summary: [new search] flicker when stepping through changes
description:
1) enable new search
2) do a text search for "e"
3) step through the matches
->notice that the editor tab flickers (i.e., the editor is temporarily 
activated). When the editor is already open it should not be activated when 
selecting a match. The flicker doesn't occur in the old search

summary: [Commands] Search action gone after a while
description:
I20031211

After working a while with Eclips the actions in the global search menu are 
all disabled. Got the impression that this happens on perspective switching 
but don't have a reproducable case.

summary: eclipse won't start under Solaris using eclipse 2.1.2.1.
description:
After installing on Solaris 8 eclipse does not run.

I believe the problem is because the java command in jre/bin is just a script
containing the line:
.java_wrapper

.java_wrapper looks parses $0 and uses it for progname:
progname=`/usr/bin/basename $0`

On our system progname was set to .java_wrapper and eclipse failed to run
because:
prog="$APPHOME/bin/${proc}/${ttype}/${progname}"

# Run.
if [[ -x "$prog" ]]
then
     # Calling: exec $DEBUG_PROG "$prog" "$@"
     exec $DEBUG_PROG "$prog" "$@"
else
    echo >&2 "$progname was not found in ${prog}"
    exit 1
fi


Changing java to be a hard link to .java_wrapper solved this problem.

summary: New code formatter prefs: No feedback when loading invalid profiel [code formatter]
description:
I200312162000

When loading an XML file which contains no or invalid syntax nothing happens (at
least that's my impression). The user should get feedback.

summary: NPE showing Type Hierarchies history after layout change
description:
M6

- I retrieve the org.eclipse.swt project from cvs, though this should happen 
with any java project
- select the project in the Package Explorer and press F4 to open a hierarchy 
view on it
- drop down the hierarchy view's Previous Type Hierarchies tool item, it will 
show 1+ item(s), good
- drop down the hierarchy view's dropdown (ie.- the down-pointing triangle in 
the toolbar) and select Layout -> Horizontal View Orientation
- now try to drop down the Previous Type Hierarchies tool item and the attached 
exception will occur

summary: error logged showing annotation for non-shared resource
description:
M6

- in the Navigator expand a java project's bin directory
- drill down if needed until you reach a contained .class file
- select it, right-click and invoke popup item Team -> Show Annotation
- an error dialog is shown saying that this can't be done

Two problems:
1. There's a real exception occurring here; a stack trace is written to .log 
and the error dialog is an actual Error Dialog.  This should be handled better.
2. The error message that's shown says "Cannot display...an remote revision", 
where "an" should be "a"

summary: Accessibility-Duplicate Mnemonics on C/C++Editor page
description:
An accessibility requirement is that when a mnenomic is activated, the target 
control gets a visual focus. If a label has an underlined letter x, hitting 
Alt+x will bring that label's control to focus. Where there are duplicated 
mnemonics visible, then the second one never gets focus. Here are the 
duplicates mnemonics in the C/C++ Editor Preferences page:
Overall:
'Annotations' and 'Apply' (a)
General Tab
'Insert space for tabs' and 'Content Assist' tab (s)
'highlight matching brackets' and 'show print margin' (m)
'highlight current line' and 'Colors' tab (c)
Colors Tab
'Bold' (b) doesn't bring focus
Content Assist Tab
'Search current file' and 'Content Assist' tab (s)
'Search current project' and 'Insert single proposals' (p)

summary: JUnit and the green color [JUnit]
description:
Well I am checking out the Eclipse M6 stable and got a bit disapointed about the
color of the most important(!) green bar of the JUnit TestRunner. The color
looks awful. I am missing the bright and sunny green bar, where is it?. 

Best would be to add a color picker for every color possible in the preference
page of the JUnit plugin. Whouldn't be that hard to implement I guess - I've
read the contribution book, therefore I know what I am speaking about *g ;-).

Well to summerize it,

* Current green bar looks awfull dark, but I need it to shine sunny and bright
to encourage me! (and my folks too ;)
* Best would be to add a bunch of color properties to the property page of JUnit


Thanks for considering,

Martin (Kersten)

PS: Who the hack likes that dark one?;) Someone made that change and had to clap
his shoulder in selfconfidence. (I've never meat one who likes that kind of green)

My System: Win2K, Eclipse M6

summary: [History View] Can't select words by doubleclick in CVS Resource History Comment Viewer
description:
I sometimes want to copy a bug number from the lower-right 'Comment Viewer' of
the CVS Resource History view. Unfortunately, doubleclicking the word doesn't
select it.

summary: Drawing directly to GC "flickers"
description:
On Linux-GTK, if you draw images directly to the GC (using GC.drawImage()) the 
image flickers on each re-draw, even if it's exactly the same as before.

This is testable on GC created from tables or canvas.

If you can't reproduce it, I'll post a snippet

summary: GridBagLayout conversion should use "elastic" properties
description:
Currently VE does convert null layout into gridBagLayouts by using
insets and padding to get exactly the same appereance. Quite often
this is not what I'm trying to get, I'd prefer to have a way to
use "elastic" properties of the constraint such as placement and weight
instead, so that when the form resizes the control keep their relative
position (even if this means not getting exactly the same positioning
as in the null layout).

summary: problems during CVS team -> unedit
description:
Hi,

When I try to use the unedit feature during CVS "teamplay" (after I have
demolished my code ;-)), I get the following error pop-up:

"Problems encountered while moving recources"

When I push the OK button, my source isn't available anymore in my "Package
Explorer view". So I have to update the source from the CVS repository.

Do you know what's wrong with my Eclipse (version 3.0.0M6).

Any help is greatly appreciated.

Tnx,
Martijn

summary: C-Build not updating in the first compilation.
description:
The C-Build panel opens but shows nothing during the first compilation using
Eclipse. Subsequent compilations work fine.

The C-Build panel is in 'FastView' mode.
