summary: Breakpoint hit not reported on remote debug session
description:
I try to debug a java application (Jboss in my case) with a remote debug
connection on Eclipse 3.0M6 (connection type "Socket Attach", remote JVM as well
as local JVM is sun 1.4.1_02)

I set a breakpoint with "Suspend Thread" attribute on a certain place within my
application. I know that the breakpoint is hit, because the remote application
stops, but the breakpoint hit is not shown in Eclipse, all threads of the remote
application are still shown as running.

When I change the breakpoint to "Suspend VM" everything works as expected.

summary: Shift-space content assist hotkey interferes with typing
description:
3.0 M6 and I20031218

Recent versions of Eclipse open a content-assist window when typing shift-space.
Previous versions of Eclipse (and most other windows applications) treat
shift-space like a normal space. This change can make it difficult to type
punctuation followed by a space.

summary: DCR: New SelectionTool with support for panning
description:
Create a new SelectionTool subclass.  I want it to behave exactly like the 
existing selection tool, with the following additions:

- When selection tool is in its initial state, if it receives the SPACE 
keydown, it will switch to a PAN state
- While in the PAN (or PAN_IN_PROGRESS) state, a hand cursor will appear
- If I mouse down in the pan state, I will transition to a PAN_IN_PROGRESS 
state which allows scrolling the viewport by pressing and dragging the mouse.
- When leaving the state PAN_IN_PROGRESS, return to either the PAN state or 
the STATE_INITIAL based on whether the SPACE bar is still depressed.

Use the obvious name choices for constants, not exactly what I've used.
Pratik to review changes before releasing.

summary: update class path should prompt to save the plugin.xml
description:
If you edit build.xml and then do update class path you are not prompted to 
save the build.xml file. This can make things very confusing (and anything 
which improves the comprehension of plugin classpath juggling is a good thing)

Ideally this classpath update should happen automatically

summary: Double-click and quick fix annotations
description:
Build: I20040106

I was annoyed by the fact that warning annotations hid my breakpoints, and by
the fact that double-clicking in the vertical rule to add/remove a breakpoint
also caused the quick-fix shell to pop up.  

So, I removed the warning annotation from the vertical ruler from the java
editor preference page.

However, even after removing the annotation from the ruler, double-clicking on a
line that contains a warning still causes the quick fix shell to open.  It seems
that the action associated with that annotation should not happen when the
annotation is turned off.

summary: [source lookup] Call stack editor annotation ambiguous
description:
Build: 3.0 M6

If I have two threads suspended with the same method somewhere in their call
stack, I cannot distinguish between the two because both are highlighted in the
same way in the editor. I would expect only the call stack of the selected
thread to be displayed in the editor (not the stacks of all threads).

summary: [TableEdtior] Several wierd behaviors in TableEditor
Add an option to control alignment for constructor declaration parameters vs method declaration parameters
description:
These two are merged for now and we should have a different option to be
consistent with other options added for method declaration.

summary: Create Patch wizard should remember path in file system
description:
Each time I create a patch, I have to click on "Save In File System" and then
hit the 'Browse...' button in order to enter a path. This is tedious as I
usually put my patches into the same location each time.

The wizard should remember the user's last path in the file system if one has
ever been entered. Optionally, also the radio button's position could be
remembered, but this is less of a problem as only one click is needed to set it up.

summary: [DCR] Quick assist : unneeded bracing
[Viewers] Compare editor should show hovers indicating change types
description:
The compare editor should show a text hover for items in the overview ruler and
for the icon indicating the change type (see attached screenshot).

The hovers should tell the user what kind of change the colors and icons stand
for: Incoming Change, Outgoing Change, Conflicting Change.

summary: JavaDoc of ITypeBinding#isLocal() talks about local interfaces
description:
The JavaDoc of ITypeBinding#isLocal() talks about local types and local
interfaces. If I understood the JLS-2.0 correctly, interfaces cannot be local
(there are only local *classes*).

summary: CVS Annotate switches to CVS Perspective
description:
The CVS Annotation feature switches to the CVS Perspective irregardless of what
you are doing.  We would prefer that it remain on the current perspective
(generally the JDT) or at least that this was a configurable option. 

Thank you for your time.

description:
Profiling the LoggingUtilSampl class causes a JVMPI crash on HP-UX.  I was 
using the following JVM:

java version "1.3.1.10"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1.10-030630-10:50)
Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.3.1 1.3.1.10-_30_jun_2003_11_52 PA2.0,

summary: Nothing happens when launching
description:
I20030113

I first thought there's a severe bug in Debug: after importing the latest build
and clicking on the Run (and later Debug) buttons in the toolbar nothing
happened, no UI feedback and the Debug view was empty.

I then remembered that I recently chose to always wait until a build is finished
(Debug preference). Going to the Process view I saw tons of Launch jobs waiting.

There needs to be better feedback. I suggest to show those launches in the Debug
view.

summary: setRawClasspath(...) should fire a F_CLASSPATH_CHANGED delta
description:
Build 20041013

As described in  bug 38513 , calling IJavaProject.setRawClasspath(...) currently 
fires no delta when the resolved classpath is the same. It should always fire a 
F_CLASSPATH_CHANGED delta if the raw classpath has changed. This new flag would 
be attached to an IJavaProject delta.

summary: [EditorMgmt] Typo in IPageLayout.ID_EDITOR_AREA = "org.eclipse.ui.editorss"
description:
Someone asked me if they could add a few to a perspective relative to the 
editor area instead of another view. I believe the answer should be yes, they 
just have to refer to the area by name in their plugin.xml. However, looking 
at the source code, the editor area name is defined by the constant 
IPageLayout.ID_EDITOR_AREA which has the value "org.eclipse.ui.editorss". This 
looks like a typo so it probably shouldn't be documented this way and it 
should be changed. Changing it would probably break binary compatibility but I 
think you can just add a check to test for both the right and wrong values in 
IPageLayout.addView() and any similar functions to support plug-ins using the 
old value.

summary: [PropertiesView] allow property pages to handle multi select
description:
The current PropertyPage system is hard wired to only allow a single selection.
It would be nice if it was similar to the popupmenu system - this allows 
multiple selections and works out common things between the selection.
I know this is not a trivial thing to provide - but I thought I put in the 
suggestion. 
Example of use - select multiple files and set readonly on them all.
Very useful in RCP apps (select multple product items and change discount%)

summary: Layouts should support laying out only a subset of a composite's children
description:
Currently all standard SWT layout managers always lay out all children of the
composite they are managing. This includes children which are not visible. While
this may be desired in some cases, it makes it difficult to manage dynamic
layouts where the layout should change when a control is made visible or invisible.

The SWT layout managers should allow the programmer to specify a subset of the
managed controls for which a layout will be computed. I initially thought of
having a "hideInvisibleControls" flag on all layout managers but that would not
be sufficient. When hiding a control you could redo the layout and get the
expected results but when showing a control, you first need to recompute the
layout to make room for the control and then make the control visible after the
layout has changed. If you were restricted to computing a layout for visible
controls, you would first have to make the control visible, thus showing it with
a wrong position and size, and then recompute the layout.

So instead of such a flag I am proposing a "public Control[] controls" field for
all layout managers where you can explicitly set the controls which will be
considered for computing the layout. If this field is set to null (which should
be the default), the composite will be queried for all children (the current
behaviour). Simply replacing all calls to "composite.getChildren()" by "controls
== null ? composite.getChildren() : controls" in all layout managers should do
the trick.

I have done these modifications to my own copies of the SWT layout managers
(where I simply copied the original code; this cannot be done through
inheritance because the calls to composite.getChildren() are not encapsulated in
a protected method of the Layout class). So far I have tested the modified
versions of FillLayout and FormLayout and they worked as expected.

summary: The code formatter should be enhanced to handle XDoclet tags better.
description:
The code formatter keeps changing my java doc from 
/**
 * @ejb.bean
 *   name = "CustomProperty"
 *   display-name = "Custom Property EJB"
 *   jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyHome"
 *   local-jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyLocalHome"
 *   type = "CMP"
 *   cmp-version = "2.x"
 *   schema = "CustomProperty"
 *   primkey-field = "identityKey"
 *   description = "A user/application defined name and value pair."
 *   view-type = "local"
 *   transaction-type = "Container"
 * 
 * @ejb.value-object
 *   name = "CustomProperty"
 *   match = "*"
 * 
 * @ejb.persistence
 *   table-name = "CUSTOMPROPERTY"
 * 
 */

to

/**
 * @ejb.bean name = "CustomProperty" display-name = "Custom Property EJB"
 * jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyHome" local-jndi-name =
 * "ejb/CustomPropertyLocalHome" type = "CMP" cmp-version = "2.x" schema =
 * "CustomProperty" primkey-field = "identityKey" description = "A
 * user/application defined name and value pair." view-type = "local"
 * transaction-type = "Container"
 * 
 * @ejb.value-object name = "CustomProperty" match = "*"
 * 
 * @ejb.persistence table-name = "CUSTOMPROPERTY"
 * 
 */

The only solution I have found is to turn off comment formatting which is a
great loss.  It would be better if there was a way to maintain the formatting in
these cases.

summary: editor context menu|source|surround with try catch
description:
Hi!

Nearly every method may throw a RuntimeException.
They will not be noted by the editor like other exceptions.
Nearly everywhere a programmer may want to catch them.
But the editor does not offer to surround them with try catch 
like with other exceptions.

Would be a new features.

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen

summary: New code formatter: ?: uses "default indentation"
description:
Note: This only applies only to typing. Formatter is as expected when invoking
the formatter on the block.

I start typing this expression:

  foo = bar != null ?_

(_ = cursor)

Now if I hit Enter, and continue typing blindly, I get:

  foo = bar != null ?
                     bar : foo;

instead of the expected:

  foo = bar != null ?
    bar : foo;

In the new formatter prefs, "Line Wrapping "tab", I have set the indentation
policy of "Conditionals" to "indent by one".

should be logged to the platform log, as it indicates the programmer has

summary: Reworking of Error Log Properties Dialog
Error in the XSD facet item providers
description:
The problem is in the item providers for the XSD facets.  Each XSD facet item 
provider has a getPropertyDescriptors(Object) method that creates the property 
descriptor for the "Value" property.  The logic in the provider incorrectly 
set the EStructuralFeature reference to be the one found in the super class 
and not the feature value for the subclass.  The error was specifically found 
in the XSDMaxLengthFacetItemProvider and XSDMinLengthFacetItemProvider 
classes.  For example, XSDMaxLengthFacetItemProvider calls 
xsdPackage.getXSDMaxFacet_Value() instead of 
xsdPackage.getXSDMaxLengthFacet_Value().

summary: Deleted files skipped when using Team> Tag as Version
description:
I tagged my workspace before releasing some changes. I got an error indicating 
that a deleted resource was not tagged. This is usual CVS behavior but I 
though we worked around that so the deleted resource would be tagged.

summary: Vertical scrollbar is not created as expected
[Commands] Error in command schema context definition
description:
The explanation of the "context" definition within the org.eclipse.ui.commands extension point 
schema includes both a "parent" and "parentId" attribute. Since the descriptions are identical, it 
looks like one of them is outdated?

# parent - The unique id of the parent context. If this context has a parent, it will borrow all key 
bindings from its parent, in addition to the key bindings defined in its own context.
# parentId - The unique id of the parent context. If this context has a parent, it will borrow all key 
bindings from its parent, in addition to the key bindings defined in its own context.

summary: Paste omits a character
[SSH2] Keyboard-interactive authentication support has not been supported.
description:
My original eclipse-cvsssh2 plug-in has supported the keyboard-interactive 
authentication, but that functionality has been dropped at

 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.team.cvs.ssh2/src/org/eclip 
se/team/ccvs/ssh2/JSchSession.java.diff?r1=1.5&r2=1.6

Can I hear the reason about it? And, is there no plan to support it again?
The keyboard-interactive authentication will be very useful for 
enterprise users, who require SecurID and S/Key, etc., authentication to
get accesses to their sshd.

I know how to support it, but some modifications will be required in
org.eclipse.team.cvs.core and org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui and I'm not a committer
for them.  So, I must ask for help if I will.

summary: Enable NL support on Hyades Generic Logging Adapter
description: Enable NL support on Hyades Generic Logging Adapter.

summary: BiDi bug: SWT controls flip the alignment if SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style is set.
description:
If SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style is set, some SWT contols also change the alignment 
direction. If the alignment is right, then set SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style, we see 
the alignment becomes left, and vice versa.
This never happen on J2SE Swing. Swing does not change the alignment, even if 
the component orientation is RTL or LTR.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Download the following files on  http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index.php  
and install them:
    eclipse-SDK-3.0M6-win32.zip
    eclipse-examples-3.0M6-win32.zip 
2. In the example, set RTL_SUPPORT_ENABLE = true in 
org.eclipse.swt.examples.controlexample.Tab.java in org.eclipse.swt.example 
plugin.
3. Rebuild org.eclipse.swt.example plugin.
4. Launch "SWT Examples\SWT controls" view 
5. Click "Button" tab on the SWT controls view
6. Change "Size" to "100x100"
7. Change "Alignment" to Left.
8. Change "Orientation" to SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT and SWT.LEFT_TO_RIGHT.
9. You can see the visual alignment is also flipped.
The alignment should not be changed, whatever the orientation setting is.

In addition, I see the same problem in the following cases:
"SWT Example\SWT controls" view:   Button, Label, 
"SWT Examples\SWT Custom controls" view: CLabel 

Test OS: Windows2000 SP3
Test Java platform: Sun Java2 SDK 1.4.1_06

summary: [Workbench] Empty window overlaying Editor

I20040120

Quite frequently I see an empty window on top of my editor.
See attached screenshot. In many cases it is difficult to get rid of it...
This is very annoying.

summary: Compile errors fixed by 'refresh' do not reset problem list or package explorer error states
description:
When you have a project that also references external jars, there appears to 
be a problem with error tagging.

Consider the following example:

I have a project that has some code that references external jars.

In the first instance, there were missing methods in classes in the external 
jars, so the compile failed. The open editor displayed the errors, as did the 
Package Explorer and the Problems view.

I replaced the external jar with one that fixed the errors, and did a 
Project 'refresh' from the package explorer.

The rebuild occurred and, in the open editor, all indications of the error 
state disappeared.

However, the Problems view still displays all of the original compilation 
problems (now resolved), and the Package Explorer still has a red 'x' next to 
the class and package that had the problems.

Doing a "rebuild all" correctly resets the state of the Package Explorer and 
Problems view.

It would seem that the build done by the 'refresh' does not clear the error 
states in the views before performing the compilation.

summary: [workspace] Fails building plugin JARs with multiple source folders
description:
We have several plugin projects where we use source folders to organize our 
code.  It is not uncommon to have a plugin with five source folders each of 
which is built into a seperate runtime JAR.  This setup compiles fine and runs 
just fine but the PDE build is failing.  It fails because our source folders 
depend upon each other and PDE requires that a dependent JAR be built first.  
The problem is that since they depend on each other, it doesn't matter which 
order we put the JARs in the build.properties file, it will always fail.

An example is a plugin with three runtime libraries mapped to three source 
folders A, B, and C where A depends on B and C and C depends on A.

summary: Requesting change to AbstractGraphicalEditPart#reorderChild(...)
Decoration process is very slow

When I disconnect, refresh, and then reshare my project, the decoration
process takes a very long time.  I have ~3000 files in one directory and it
seems to process these at a rate slow enough that I can see each file name crawl
by.  

It has been decorating this directory for the past 13 minutes.  This is on a p4
2.4 with 1gig ram.  I am running nothing else cpu intensive.

related to  bug 48691

summary: [Decorators] Decorator mechanism does not allow for optimizations
description:
At present our decorators show up piecemeal because we do them in a background 
thread and thus the order they appear is 'random'.

The way we decorator mechanism works does not allow us to optimize in some 
areas.  Specificly:

1. The icon and text are asked for separately. This requires us to go to our 
sync info twice, which is on disk and expensive to get.

2. The decorators are asked individually.  In the case of CVS, all the sync 
info for sibling resources is in the same file, so its faster for us to 
determine all their decorators at once.

3. In order to avoid doing work in the UI thread, we create a background thread 
to generate the decorators.  When then need to tell the UI via an event that we 
now have decorators, and then they ask us for them.  It would be better if we 
could just give the UI the decorators we know about all at once.

Note: to be a good citizen we should be computing the decorators in a thread 
different than the UI context.

The combination of #2 and #3 could result in the decorators appearing in parent 
child ordering, with all siblings appearing at once.

If you open an inline text and then drag the contents Eclipse will crash with a

STEPS
1) Open Eclipse
2) Select something in the resource navigator
3) Select Rename
4) The inline editor will pop up - drag it's contents out of the editor
5) When you drop Eclipse will Core dump

summary: uppercase ZIP and JAR classpath entries ignored
description:
From  bug 45897 :

-----
The JDT's ..batch.FileSystem() constructor only accepts lowercase .zip and .jar
and silently ignores other entries, which affects any such entry on the
classpath.  (Java and Javac both handle uppercase-suffixed files fine.)  Test
case checked in, uses libraries
org.aspectj/modules/tests/bugs/extdirs/lib/uppercase.
-----
This is a bug in the jdt batch compiler.  This bug should be raised against 
org.eclipse.jdt.core.  When they fix it we'll pick up their fix.
-----

summary: Generic Log Adapter does not handle wrapping of log files
description:
The GLA needs to handle log files which wrap.  Thats is log files which shift 
their content up(left)as they append to the end of the file.

I have a solution to handle the following four scenarios for log processing:

1.  File has had content appended to the end.
2.  File has been replaced but otherwise content is appended to the end
3.  File has been replaced with data shifted up/left (circular log)
4.  File has been replaced with all new data.

summary: Plugin project directory no longer on classpath
description:
In eclipse 3.0 build 200401210900, the project root directory is not on the
plugin's classpath when I run a runtime-workspace.
I don't know if this is an intentional side effect of the osgi stuff, but it
causes me some problems - e.g. I have to copy my log4j.properties file to the
"bin" directory for it to be found.

summary: Editor context menus don't apply to mouse location
description:
Context menus in Eclipse editors perform actions on the current cursor/selection,
which is unrelated to the location the mouse was when it was right-clicked. This
is inconsistent with every GUI I have ever used, as well as the behavior 
in other views of Eclipse. It is quite jarring.

summary: Build Path & Runtime Path inconsistent WRT Library/Container
description:
In the build path (project properties->Java Build Path) groups of jar files are referred to as Libraries 
(i.e. Add Library button). In the runtime classpath (Run->Run...). The launch configuration editor 
refers to (what appears to be) the same thing as 'Container' (Advanced... button, Add Container: 
radio button).

summary: MessageBox locks out application
description:
The following scenario causes SWT to lock under SWT for windows. A parent shell
X is created and opened. Then, a text entry dialog Y (a child of the X) is
opened titled "X". In this scenario, given the nature of the dialog, it is of
style APPLICATION_MODAL. At some point while Y is open, the application must
present an important error message. So, a MessageBox Z, also a child of X (or Y,
same effect) is created and opened titled "Z". MessageBox Z will of course stay
on top within the application which is intended. However, the taskbar at the
bottom (under win2k) will list windows "X" and "Z". If you select "X" at the
bottom, it will put windows X and Y on top and beep at any mouse or key click.
Clicking "Z" at the bottom does not redraw Z back on top and the screen remains
with X and Z displayed. Because the user must click okay in the message box (and
is prevented from doing so, this effectively locks out the application forcing a
manual termination to exit the program. Based on my testing this seems to be
because the SWT thread is locked in a wait until the MessageBox (Z) is exited,
so any redraw or other SWT requests are postponed indefinitely.

summary: Compiler warns on missing Javadoc tags for private methods.
description:
The Java compiler warns on missing Javadoc tags for private methods. The Style
preference page has a checkbox to enable this feature for public methods. So
either the wording is wrong or there is a bug. Perhaps, the access level could
be specified for this *great* feature, from private all the way to public with
public  the default.
Thanks.
Version 3.0.m5.

summary: Evaluation that hits breakpoint confuses debugging
description:
Jdk1.4.1_b11

Source will be attached
Set breakpoints on lines 21 and 39
Debug to a breakpoint at line 21
From the editor, display, "this.hitBreakpoint()"

you hit the breakpoint at line 39, but the thread still claims to be 
evaluating, no indication of the breakpoint
Hit Run to Return
You are back at line 21, but the thread still claims to be stepping, and the 
stepping actions are not enabled.
Click resume and things are back to normal.

summary: CVS History: allow to wrap comment in lower right pane
description:
I20040124

I use the CVS History as fast view with low width. It would be nice if I could
choose to wrap the comment in the lower right pane.

summary: In M6 cannot get Plugin for a given class
description:
We have used some code for a couple of years now.  This code will take a class 
and get its ClassLoader.  It checks if the class is a PluginClassLoader and, 
if so, it gets the Plugin for this PluginClassLoader.  Now, when we move to 
M6, the ClassLoader for the class is an EclipseClassLoader.  I don't see a way 
to get back to the plugin that loaded this class.  Am I missing something or 
is this not possible anymore when using osgi?

summary: workspace location is not always fully qualified
description:
Quoting John:
The recently released changes in runtime are causing many resources plugin 
tests to fail.  There were two lines in the old code 
(InternalPlatform.setupMetaArea) that did this:

//try infer the device if there isn't one (windows)
if (location.getDevice()==null)
	location = new Path(location.toFile().getAbsolutePath());

It looks like this code was lost in the refactoring to support platforms 
without a data area.  If you don't do this, and you specify a "-data" area 
without a device, then there are many places where location comparisons fail to 
match because sometimes there is a device and sometimes there isn't. This 
sequence needs to be added back, in some central place when the location is 
being initialized, to be sure that it always has a device.

summary: A menu and/or keybinding to toggle UPPERCASE or lowercase toggling of a highlighted item.
description:
I would like to request that a keybinding and/or menu action be made so that
when an user highlights a word, phrase, etc. they have the option to change the
highlighted word to uppercase or, if in uppercase, to lowercase.  Perhaps the
action should first uppercase the entire highlighted phrase, and on a second
iteration of the toggling keystoke/menu choice, the entire highlighted phrase is
placed into lowercase.  From my investigations, of both the
Preferences->Workspace->Keys and the menus visible at the current time, there is
no keybinding for the Ctrl+T key combo.  Might I suggest this be the keybinding
for the above suggested action.

summary: CTabFolder tooltips are not read out
description:
M6

gnopernicus is not reading out CTabFolder tooltips properly because they're 
faked.  It simply says "Hide/Restore window".  Tried:
- adding accessible listeners to the tip shell and its contained label
- removing ON_TOP from tip shell creation
- giving focus to contained label when shown

summary: Wrong completion kind when declaring an argument type
description:
In declaring a function/method:

void foo( (CTRL+SP)

you get :
Kind = Variable_Type / Field_Type

Expected :
Kind = Argument_Type

Although in the three cases (Variable type, Field type and Argument type) 
types are looked up, there are other differences in the proposed list 
regarding the templates that would appear in the specified scope, for example.

summary: NPE in DefaultClassLoader.findClass()
description:
Eclipse 3.0 M6 - Windows

I've been using M6 for a while with no problems but this morning I tried to 
debug a runtime-workbench and the debug display view was not instantiated. 
Will attach the .log file.

summary: Plugin desctivated after patching
description:
Build 20030121

After patching jdtcore.jar (i.e. replacing it with a newer version), I 
restarted my workbench on the same workspace, but the jdt.core plugin was 
desactivated (ass well as all its dependents).

I had to delete .config file to be able to restart the workbench and use the 
Java functinalities again.

summary: enable/disable builder bug - cannot cancel
description:
* Open the "Builders" properties on a project.
* Select the "java" builder and press disable
* press "Cancel"
* open the builder tab - the builder shows as dislabed, although cancel was 
pressed. It seems that the builder still runs too (until I actually press OK), 
which is doubly strange.

summary: Improve DOM/AST support for doc comments
description:
The current API for doc comments has a flat text string.
This is not helpful for clients that want to analyze or change the structure 
of doc comments.

summary: PDE classpath container not working with importing binary projects (SWT fragments)
description:
3.0 M6

I downloaded 3.0 M6 today (to do some quick coding for draw2d and gef) and 
created a fresh install including workspace.

Steps to repeat:

1. new workspace "C:\eclipse-develop-3.0\plugins" (autobuild is still on)
2. import external features "org.eclipse.jdt" and "org.eclipse.platform"
3. import external plug-ins and fragments contained in these features as binary 
projects (66 of 80)
4. checkout "org.eclipse.draw2d" and "org.eclipse.gef" from CVS HEAD (they are 
using pde container)

Although "org.eclipse.swt" is in dependency list of "org.eclipse.draw2d" the 
plug-in doesn't compile and shows errors that imports "org.eclipse.swt..." can 
not be found.

Updating classpath for draw2d plug-in with context menu "PDE Tools -> Update 
Classpath..." doesn't fix the problem. You need hack the binary project 
(fragment) "org.eclipse.swt.win32" to export its jar and add this to the 
classpath manually to resolve the compile errors. After rersolving this new 
compile errors complain about missing "org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform" 
and "org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPluginDescriptor" classes.

summary: Hook for resource scheduling rule factory
description:
I20040121

I have released new API that allows clients to ask for the scheduling rule for
various operations (copy, move, delete, validateEdit, setContents, etc).  Many
of these rule requirements actually vary based on the repository provider (for
example CVS needs to lock the parent folder for most operations).  Core needs to
expose something in the TeamHook to allow repository providers to provide a rule
factory.

summary: Need AST.resolveWellKnownType("java.lang.ClassCastException")
description: Title says it all.

summary: [Jobs] Background progress window is a full-fledged window
description:
Build 20040127
Linux-GTK

The new background progress pop-up is a full-fledged window in the new build, including a border 
and title bar. It looked better in the 20040121 build.

It should honor my command line argument.

description:
Exploit the EMF relational database functionality so we can add scalability to 
our tool so we can import 15Mb to 100Mb log files.  Modify all our models to 
exploit this functionality.

summary: Create patch omits parts of the source file
description:
When creating the patch for  bug 50655 , parts of my change were omitted from the
patch. The same problem occurred with various patches in  bug 44443 . In all
cases, the contents of a newly inserted switch(...) statement were omitted from
the patch.

Attached is the patch that was generated for  bug 50655 . The "new" directory
contains the changed code, the "old" directory contains the versions in CVS, and
the *.txt file is the patch that was generated. Notice that the patch is missing
the contents of the switch statement on the first page.

summary: need a cheaper way of accessing the system state
description:
There is need for clients to make simple queries to the system state that would
not require a working copy as returned by PlatformAdmin#getState.

The proposal is to have a #getState(boolean mutable) operation that allow
clients to get cheap read only access to the system state.

summary: Need access to internal class StandardCElementLabelProvider
description:
I need to have access to CDT UI classes that are in internal packages.

import org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.StandardCElementLabelProvider;
- I am using the getText method to be able to get the same label for ICElements 
as seen in the CView.  (equiv. to JDT's 
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaElementLabelProvider)

We are on CDT 1.2 right now, but will be going to 2.0 soon.

org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.cview.CView;

Thanks

No plug-in: "org.eclipse.ajdt.ui" included at runtime.

I even installed everything manually again to ensure everything
was in its place.  Still no AJDT features can be accessed.

summary: Can't load ServiceTracker class
description:

I would like to use the core PluginConverter service in the PDE plugin-to-
bundle conversion wizard.

I have

summary: DCR: API to determine files that will be 'cleaned' when changing a classpath
description:
20040129

We have several bug reports that jdt deletes files when changing the class path.
The build path wizard should warn about this, but to do this correctly, we need
support from core.
The request is to get an API that tells me if and which files would be scrupped
after changing the build path.

Releated to that is to get information which files and folders get obsolete
after a class path change (e.g. old class files). Here we have the same problem
that we are very unprecice as analysing the classpath settings (output location
/ source folder combinations, source folder specific output locations) is difficult.

see related  bug 50717 ,  bug 20042 ,  bug 34843

summary: Verification error tracing constructor that takes arguments
checkbox tree behavior in refactoring not consistent
description:
In at least the rename-refactor wizard, after the changes have been identified,
the "changes to be performed" tree's checkboxes exhibit the following behavior:

Clear a task, and expand its sub-tasks.
   check one of the sub-tasks.  This causes the super-task to be a grey
'partial-type' checkbox (expected)

   immediately clear that sub-task.  This leaves no sub-tasks selected, but the
super-task is still grey, indicating it is partially selected.

This may relate to a checkbox-tree SWT widget, rather than this dialog in
particular.

summary: File transfer
description:
Provide mechanism to transfer files (binary intially) from the remote machine 
to the local machine. This can be leveraged to pull data collection results 
back from the SUT at different times then the actual test is run.

summary: Opening a very large sequence diagram hangs the UI
description:
The vast majority of the time is spent loading the model, not drawing the 
diagram. There is a progress monitor dialog, but it is frozen and the user 
cannot cancel, even though the cancel button is enabled. All the work is still 
being done in the UI thread.

The solution involves forking a new thread to perform all the work except UI 
work. As far as displaying progress, displaying a dialog may be too intrusive. 
I will consider alternatives.

summary: Importing existing binary projects leads to errors
description:
An old problem is back. When updating existing binary projects with plugins from
1119 integration build, I got these errors in the .log:

!MESSAGE Problems detected while importing plug-ins
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109
!MESSAGE Could not delete: /org.eclipse.help.ui.win32.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109
!MESSAGE Could not delete: /org.eclipse.update.ui.win32.

That was a problem in the past. It has been fixed a while ago and it looks like
something has been broken.

summary: [ExternalTools] Cancelling project/working set scope dialog dismisses two dialogs
description:
build 20021017

-Create a new/edit and existing external tool
-Open the refresh scope dialog
-Select "specific project"
-Select Ok
-Press ESC in the "Browse Projects" dialog or click cancel
->This dismisses both the "Browse projects" dialog and the "Browse Refresh 
Scope" dialog. This may be intended to hide the fact that ok in the refresh scope 
dialog sneaks another prompt on you. However, it is confusing and unexpected. If I 
clicked ok in the refresh scope dialog I probably really want to select a scope. If I 
click cancel in the project selection dialog I should just get back to the scope dialog.
The working set selection dialog has the same problem.

summary: [navigation] Outline popup window has problems usability
description:
The outline popup window (Navigate->Show Outline), should persist size/position 
changes between invocations. As well, the mouse scroll wheel does not scroll 
the outline when moved while on top of the member list.

summary: [painting][preferences] annotation preference not correctly inherited
description:
I20040129

After adding an occurrence annotation with search annotation as super type and
only setting the keys and default values that differ I ended up with incorrect
annotation painting.

The key problems are
- default preference initialization does honor values from fragments
- painters only search for "true" in the super chain and don't stop/test for false

summary: Tab folders in Windows XP do not draw gradient background.
description:
Some Windowing systems have added features to their look which are not being 
manifested when running Eclipse.  These should be investagated and added where 
possible to accomplish a more up-to-date look.

For example I have attached a tabbed note book snapshot

summary: Provide UI for showing call graph affected by flow advice
description:
The effects of cflow advice can be challenging to infer and currently get no 
help from the tool support.  Now the at the IDEs are starting to show static 
call graphs, we can use this information to give the programmer an idea of the 
execution that will be affected by a cflow advice.  The attached mock-up shows 
a first pass at how this could look in AJDT.

summary: Difficulties with hidden files and folders
description:
I have difficulties understanding the policies for hiding files and directories on different platforms.

On Unix and MacOS X the .metadata (and now the .config folders) are hidden.
I have no problem with that.
But I don't understand why most (but not all) files within these hidden directories are itself hidden 
too.
On Unix and Mac OS X it is really a pain for ordinary users to find these hidden files (especially the 
.log file and now the .keyring files) within their hidden folders.
And if a user has decided to look into a hidden folder .metadata, why can't she see the log file 
without further hassles?

The additional odd thing here is that on Windows all this '.' business seems to have no effect at all, 
so ordinary users have access to everything in .metadata and .config without any hurdles.

What am I missing here?

summary: Wrong Number of Arguments produced by starter program

When starting Eclipse under Redhat 9 with Sun J2SDK 1.4.2_03 the starte program
./eclipse seems to produce a call to the java-environment wirh too many
arguments (perhaps not taking into account the difference between windows and
unix - latter gives the name of the procedure called, too). The messages in the
java-webstart-window exception window is:

TooManyArgumentsException[ Zu viele Argumente angegeben: {-cp, /tmp/javawH8XtI1,

summary: Eclipse won't startup
description:
Ecplise was running when I had a power failure and now it won't startup again. 
the message I get is to check the .log file for possible reasons why...I have 
attached the .log file. Thank-G-d I had my work backed up...and I then even re-
installed eclipse by downloading the most recent version, but I still get the 
same error even though I had no workspace dir to begin with after the re-
install.

What's up?

summary: CommonBaseEventLogRecord does not respect nested CBE values when retrieving the CBE.
description:
CommonBaseEventLogRecord does not respect nested CBE values when retrieving the 
CBE.  Instead, if proeprties are set in the super class (e.g. LogRecord), the 
mapped CBE properties are overwritten.  The CommonBaseEventLogRecord should 
have two modes at runtime (e.g. CBE and LogRecord modes).

summary: [find/replace] Regular expression replace does not handle groups
description:
If I find a group like "(\w+)" and try to use the group in a replacement string
like "found: \1" the group data is not inserted, and the group number is echoed
instead.

summary: Searching in sequence diagram does not always scroll to the correct area
description:
WSWB 3.0
Build 20040202_1722

In the object or class interactions sequence diagrams, if you search for an 
object or class for the first time, it works; the view is scrolled to that 
object/class. But, if you search a second time (for a different object), it 
scrolls to a seemingly random location that does not contain the object/class. 
Or, it scrolls to the top left corner.

summary: Overview does not agree with sequence diagram view
description:
WSWB 3.0
Hyades build 20040202_1722

When opening a medium-sized sequence diagram (~25 columns, square), the 
overview does not always agree with what's displayed in the view. If you scroll 
to the center of the diagram, the red square is in the center of the overview, 
but the diagram in the overview has moved to the left. The overview diagram 
should remain fixed, while the red square moves around.

I will provide a link to a profiling file containing a suitable Object 
interactions diagram in the following comment.

summary: Apache/IHS access/error parser rules do not capture CGI debug output.
description:
Apache/IHS access/error parser rules do not capture CGI debug output.  For 
example:

[Wed May 28 16:29:41 2003] [notice] Instance name is Apache 388
Apache server shutdown initiated...
[Wed May 28 16:29:41 2003] [info] setup_inherited_listeners: Skipping the call 
to WSASocket for the AFPA port.

Only two records are generated from the above error log file.

summary: Progress dialog should provide description of ongoing task
description:
Build 20040128

When getting the progress dialog to report a conflict with some background 
activity, it is not mentionning which task is colliding with others. This is 
very misleading as you can only see description of other jobs.

		{
				logError(e);
		}		
	}

summary: org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.getTopIndex() returns wrong value
[formatter][api] ContentFormatter2 should pass indents based on partition
description:
Typical implementations of ContextBasedFormattingStrategy keep a list of
partitions to format individually, however each call into the FormattingStrategy
sends the same indent information (the region's initial indent) rather than
indentation information for each partition, which is not particularly helpful
when each partition may be indented differently.

summary: More cvs options needed
description:
I don't know how well they could be abstracted, but it's certainly would be 
nice to have a way to have more options. Mainly for me I miss the date 
specification for tagging/updating etc.

Even making the console take typed commands would help a little. Right now I 
have to do these things externally

summary: [New Look] 'Show multiple editor tabs' should be on by default
description:
200401290841

I strongly believe that the new 'single-tab editor' feature is something that 
is only for power-users who know all of the keyboard accelerators. As such, it 
should not be the default setting. New users (and old users familiar with the 
previous multi-tab default) will think "Where did my other editor go?". (Old 
users will also think "What happened to single-click editor navigation?")

In fact, I will go so far as to say that the single tab feature is only useful 
to "power-users who know all of the keyboard accelerators and who have very 
long class name (or filename) prefixes that are all the same for large groups 
of classes". As I - and arguably, most developers - do not fit into that 
category, I don't think it should be the default.

To reiterate, here is a list of "reasons why the single-tab editor feature 
should not be the default". This list was originally in an email that was 
arguing for multi-tab editor capability, but now that it has been added, it 
needs to be the default, and the same old arguments still apply:

a) New users, and old lazy users like me who use the mouse for navigation, 
don't know the keyboard accelerators. And they never will. The 1-tab will 
therefore seriously annoy a large group of users.

b) New users won't even realize that they can switch to another editor - they 
will wonder where their other editor went.

c) Can't see "at a glance" which editors are open.

d) Can't see "at a glance" which editors have changes.

e) The list of accelerators (keyboard shortcuts) is buried in a submenu - 
which is the appropriate place for them, but which makes them more difficult 
to find when a user is scanning the menus looking for shortcuts, because the 
typical method is to scan for accelerator text to the right of menu items.

f) Editor navigation using the mouse used to be only one "visual cue" mouse 
click, whereas with 1-tab, you need to do mouse motion, click, then an extra 
mouse motion and an extra mouse click, making this very common interaction 
take twice as long as before.

g) Editor navigation using the keyboard is difficult also, because I have to 
use 2 hands to type the accelerator (ctrl+F6). (I have small hands, and I just 
cannot do ctrl+F6 very easily with only one hand).

summary: Unclear text in Code Formatter|Style panel of Preferences
description:
A couple of options on the Code Formatter|Style panel of the Preferences is
really unclear in my opinion. I am talking about
  Indentation is represented by a tab
  Number of spaces representing a tab

The first option would be clearer if it said something like
  Use hard tabs for indentation, not spaces
or something to that effect, like
  Insert tabs for indentation, not spaces
  Insert hard tabs for indentation, not spaces

The second one is really bad though. It has nothing to do with tabs, but rather
the number of spaces to use when indenting, when tabs are turned off (e.g. if
the first option is not checked). So, first of all, it should be greyed out if
the first option is selected, since it will have no effect in that case. And the
description should be changed to something clearer, like:
  Number of spaces to insert per indentation level.
  Number of spaces representing an indentation level.
etc. That, together with the fact that it will be greyed out if tabs are turned
on, will make it clearer how both of these options work.

Every person I know who has used Eclipse has been confused by how these two
settings work, in relationship with the the setting on the Appearance pane of
the Editor area which also has a setting for displayed tab width, and the other
setting on the Editor|Behaviour pane which has a setting for 'Insert Spaces for
Tabs'.

summary: Wrong error message "LogParser should extend LogParser interface"
description:
In the org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.internal.wizards.LogParserItem class you get
the error message "LogParser should extend LogParser interface" if your Logger
does not extend the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.Parser class. The error
message is missleading.

It would be much nicer according to my opinion if an implementation of an
interface would be expected (like org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.IParser)
than   an implementation of a class.

description:

summary: [CoolBar] [JFace] ApplicationWindow.createCoolBar tests coolBarManager 2x
description:
In ApplicationWindow, the createCoolBar method tests coolBarManager 2x, and
doesn't test toolBarManager:

if ((getShell() == null) && (coolBarManager == null) && (coolBarManager == null)) {

(Line 255)

This is the case in 3.0 M6, as well as N20040207. Both win32.

The effect of this is that if you call addToolBar(), then addCoolBar(), you get
both toolbar and coolbar, though the documentation says you get one or the
other. If you call addCoolBar(), then addToolBar(), only the coolbar gets created.

Obviously, the code should read:

if ((getShell() == null) && (toolBarManager == null) && (coolBarManager == null)) {

summary: [syntax highlighting] class literal is getting highlighted
description: The Class.class literal is getting highlighted, when it shouldn't...

summary: Display latest synchronize info at top of synchronize view
description:
Currently the latest synchronize info is displayed in the status bar on the 
bottom right.  Typically, I will have synchronize view in a fast view with 
outgoing only selected.  Because the latest synchronize info is on opposite 
sides of the screen, I sometimes miss that there are also incoming changes.  

I would like to have the latest synchronize info displayed at the top of the 
synchronize view so I don't have to remember to glance across to check.  Don't 
care whether the info is also still displayed in the status bar.

summary: JavaStratumLineBreakpoint conditions don't apply
description:
Using Tomcat 5.0.16 and the JSP example editor, I've got breakpoints that work.
 When I create a condition, however, it always stops anyway, even for "false".

summary: Port SD log interaction viewer to the UML2 SD ui
Ctrl+Space gives two key down events
description:
On Windows XP using I20030923, "Ctrl+Space" gives two key down events.  This 
key binding is used by Eclipse for code assist.  Affects keys preference page, 
and causes a flicker as the code assist is executed twice.  If the key is 
bound to any other command, it can make the command completely unusable.

Problem does not occur on Linux-GTK.

This is required for M4.


DOWN: stateMask=0x0, keyCode=0x40000, character=0x0 '\0'
DOWN: stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' '
DOWN: stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' '
UP  : stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' '
UP  : stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x40000, character=0x0 '\0'

summary: New Code Formatter pref page: Connection between items not visible [code formatter]
description:
I200312162000

When editing comment formatting prefs on the new Code Formatter pref page there
are the following two preferences:

[ ] Indent Javadoc tags
[ ] Indent description after @param

If I uncheck the first one then the second one gets disabled. This connection
should be reflected in the UI:
[ ] Indent Javadoc tags
    [ ] Indent description after @param


Note: same bug was on old pref page

summary: Variables view does not persist size of details area
description:
The size of the details area in the variables and expressions view is not 
persisted. Each time I start my workspace, the details area is opened with the 
same (default) size, even though I have resized it.

summary: [preferences] Selection Background Color
description:
Java Editor Settings. Editor Apperance/Syntax.

I did not find how to specify selection's background color. By default it's 
blue. 
Problem is more noticable if set Custom Background Color to blue. Then in 
editor selected blocks are becoming blue on blue.

summary: Repo view leaves busy cursor
description:
I'm not sure if it's repo view specific or a general problem in I20040209 but 
I was testing connection failure in the repo view and was left with a busy 
cursor even though the operation was over.

summary: can't find java.awt.* packages using IBMs 1.4.1 VM on linux
description:
1. get swt and swt.gtk from head
2. rename appropriate swt classpath file
3. build

you get lots of errors that various java.awt files cannot be found.

for this vm and this platform (at least), the java.awt.* files are in
'graphics.jar'.

it seems like the contents of this file isn't being considered when looking for
imports?

summary: Ant in Eclipse breaks after upgrading to Java 1.4.2
description:
I just updated my Mac OS 10.3.2 JVM from 1.4.1 to 1.4.2 using Software Update.  Ant tasks, which were 
working fine before the update, now report via the Progress view:

ERROR:  Launch : Specified VM install not found:  type MacOS X VM, name 1.4.1

Eclipse otherwise still seems to be running fine, and in the Java preferences it's aware of the new VM, 
but I can't figure out where the Ant VM is supposed to be specified.

Sometimes the attempted Ant launch just hangs.

summary: Ant Editor preference to disable loading of external dtd or schema
description:
From  bug 44125 :
I think that the issues can be related to XML parser used by the editor and DTD
or scheme definition linked from an XML file. My PC is behind a firewall, so
parser always fails to load external DTD or schema (i.e from bea.com or sun.com
or w3c.org) but it take a while to complete.

Please disable loading of the external DTD's and Schemas or make this a
configurable preference.

summary: Build order of fragments in generated build.xml incorrect
Patch(es) to fix redraw bug after ControlEditors close.
Find Occurrences in File: Can't jump to location in class file
description:
I20040209-1020:
- select a java field in the java editor
- Search > Occurrences in File
- (Old) Search view appears with correct results
- Doubleclicking a result or choosing 'Open File' from the context menu doesn't
work.

summary: TODO marker coloring: Update to new jdt.core behaviour
description:
20040210

jdt.core now allows the '_' in tag names (so that tag names are now similar to
java identifiers). See  bug 49259 .

The colorer in the Java editor needs to be updated too.

summary: Dependent updates are not discoverable
description:
Updates that "require" another update are not displayed in the "Available 
Updates" dialog.  Only the first update is shown to the user, even though the 
second update is also pertinent to his/her product.  

As a result, users must continue to press the "New Updates" action until it 
displays the "no updates available" message.

Requirement: user should be made aware that they need to return to this action 
for more updates.  Alternatively, they should be able to select "any/all" update
(s) which would then be installed in the proper order.

summary: Global Cursor Position History for the editor
Stop on disabled exception breakpoint
description:
Eclispe (id: 200310101454) or the JRE stops for a disabled 
exception breakpoint:

Thread [main] (Suspended (exception FileNotFoundException))
	FileInputStream.open(String) line: not available [native method]
	FileInputStream.<init>(File) line: 106
	ZoneInfoFile$1.run() line: 910
	AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction) line: not 
                       ailable [native method]
	ZoneInfoFile.readZoneInfoFile(String) line: 904
	ZoneInfoFile.createZoneInfo(String) line: 520
	ZoneInfoFile.getZoneInfo(String) line: 499
	ZoneInfo.getTimeZone(String) line: 524
	TimeZone.getTimeZone(String, boolean) line: 448
	TimeZone.getDefault() line: 522
	SimpleDateFormat.initialize(Locale) line: 500
	SimpleDateFormat.<init>(String, Locale) line: 443
	Date.toString() line: 981
	BUtil.appendSystemData(StringBuffer, int) line: 789
	NezeBootClassLoader.mainPrologMessage() line: 789
	NezeBootClassLoader.main0(String[], boolean, boolean, boolean) line: 817
	NezeBootClassLoader.main(String[]) line: 798
	Main.main(String[]) line: 27

The missing file seams to be:
val$fname=
"F:\\WWW-APACHE\\2N\\2R1141\\JDK\\WINDOWS_I586.SUN_J2SE_1_4_200.NEZE.DE\\INST\\JRE\\lib\\zi\\GMT+01:00"

If I step over then I get the stacktrace:

Thread [main] (Suspended)
	ZoneInfoFile.readZoneInfoFile(String) line: 921 [local variables unavailable]
	ZoneInfoFile.createZoneInfo(String) line: 520
	ZoneInfoFile.getZoneInfo(String) line: 499
	ZoneInfo.getTimeZone(String) line: 524
	TimeZone.getTimeZone(String, boolean) line: 448
	TimeZone.getDefault() line: 522
	SimpleDateFormat.initialize(Locale) line: 500
	SimpleDateFormat.<init>(String, Locale) line: 443
	Date.toString() line: 981
	BUtil.appendSystemData(StringBuffer, int) line: 789

	NezeBootClassLoader.main0(String[], boolean, boolean, boolean) line: 817
	NezeBootClassLoader.main(String[]) line: 798
	Main.main(String[]) line: 27

So I think the first stop is no stop on "uncaught exception",
which is enabled in the JAva->Debug preferences.

This bug is annoying becuase it happens 2 times during startup
for JDK WINDOWS_I586.SUN_J2SE_1_4_200.NEZE.DE on Windows 98.
Btw: This happens not for Windows NT (perhaps because there
is no file missing). This is possibly an bug of the JVM ... .

Kind Regards

mle

summary: Add filter button to Expressions view to show expressions by debug target
description:
Similar to the breakpoints view add a button that would filter the expressions 
by debug target.

summary: error parser order cannot be set
description:
i noticed that you can't set the order of the error parsers. the up/down buttons
work, but it doesn't take. doesn't matter whether it's global or project settings.

summary: should unregister URL handlers when they are removed
description:
PlatformURLPluginHandlerFactory listens to registry events to add URL handlers
dynamically as they appear, but the opposite is not being done when they go away.

summary: Sharing a project - Module exists reported when it doesn't
description:
I'm using WebSphere 5.1.0 and I am trying to Share a project with CVS.
It is a brand new project and when I try to share it I get the error that the
specified module already exists when it doesn't. It is like it is not even
trying to do the cvs import.
I am running a cvs server on a Solaris 8 machine. I can connect and work with
the cvs server using other cvs clients and the import happens fine. 
Let me know if there are more details that you require.
Sorry if this is a duplicate. 

Mike Slywka

summary: progress dialog would stay forever
description:
i200402101200

Got two Progress Summary modal dialogs at the same time one, waiting for a
background operation, did not show any jobs to be cancelled. The other, in
foreground, was waiting for "Refresh Workspace" (I have it enabled) although
"Building workspace" appeared in the job list. Please see screenshot and VM dump
(to attach) for details.

When I realized it was not coming back (no CPU activity) by itself, I tried
cancelling the selected job. That removed it from the list of jobs, but the
progress dialog remained open. Only cancelling the blocked job made the two
dialogs go away.

summary: document outline focus is different from JDT's
description:
In AJDT the document outline focus switches to the editor if any element is 
selected.  This makes it impossible to up/down arrow through the elements like 
you can in JDT's outline.

summary: console synchronization with multiple streams
description:
The following code should alternately print "system.out" and "system.err". 
Instead the console output looks like:

standard out standard out standard out standard out standard out standard out 
standard out standard err standard err standard err standard err standard err 
standard err standard out standard out standard out standard out standard out

summary: [Tasks] Problem with task list when deleting an element and description field is being edited
description:
- Create a bunch of tasks
- Click on the description field of one of the tasks. You are now editing a 
task description.
- Click the delete button. The task list has now one element less, but the 
description test of the deleted task remains in the field, and the task above 
is invisible. As soon as the description field loses focus the list is back to 
normal and the invisible task is visible again.

This does not happen if the whole task line is selected.

summary: [formatter] pref page - restore defaults should select "Default" profile
description: Clicking on "Restore Defaults" should select the "Default [built-in]" profile.

summary: [Fonts] Java Pref Pages leak 17 fonts
description:
How I did it:

With sleak and graphics-trace on:

Open Resource perspective; open sleak view; close all perspectives but resource
perspective; close all views but sleak view.

Close Eclipse.

Open Eclipse again.

Open Window/Preferences. Close Preferences. Reopen and close again. => loads
Dialog fonts and all fonts on the first preference page.

Take a snapshot in sleak view.

We start w/ 52 colors, 2 cursors, 5 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images

For each pref page: open preferences select page in tree, close preference
dialog, reopen preference, close preference, note new resources.

Java: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 6 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+1 font]

Appearance: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 7 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+1 font => "Note"
should be in the Banner font which has been already loaded through the Workbench
pref page]

Members Sort Order: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 8 fonts, 1 GC, 96 images [+1 font; +9
images (the member/visibility icons) -> no leak]

Classpath Variables: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 8 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+5 images
 -> no leak]

New Variable Entry Dialog (reached through Classpath Variables/New...): 52
colors, 2 cursors, 9 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+1 font]

Code Formatter: 61 colors, 2 cursors, 12 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+9 colors
(colors used for the embedded editor-> no leak), +3 fonts (one is probably the
Java Editor font, the other two are leaks)]

Show Profile Dialog (reached through Code Formatter/Show...) 61 colors, 2
cursors, 16 fonts, 1 GC, 102 images [+4 fonts, +1 image (the warning icon -> no
leak]

Code Generation: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 17 fonts, 1 GC, 103 images [+1 color
(will be used by Insert Variable dropdown), +1 font (appearantly the one used by
the Insert Variable Dropdown -- shouldn't this be shared/disposed?), +1 image
(local type icon -> no leak]

Detail formatters: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 18 fonts, 1 GC, 103 images [+1 font
(the Java Text Editor font should have already been loaded by the Code Formatter
preference page)]

Step Filtering: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 18 fonts, 1 GC, 105 images [+2 images ->
no leak]

Add Step Filter dialog (reached through Step Filtering): 62 colors, 2 cursors,
19 fonts, 1 GC, 105 images [+1 font]

Add Packages dialog (reached through Step Filtering): 62 colors, 2 cursors, 23
fonts, 1 GC, 108 images [+3 images -> no leaks; +4 fonts (1 is from the progress
dialog)]

Work in Progress: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 24 fonts, 1 GC, 108 images [+1 font]

Compiler: no leaks
Debug: no leaks
Installed JREs: no leaks
Javadoc: no leaks
Editor: no leaks
Spelling: no leaks
JUnit: no leaks
New Project: no leaks
Organize Imports: no leaks
Refactoring: no leaks
Task Tags: no leaks
Type Filters: no leaks

@@@@

All in all 17 fonts on the following:

Java, Appearance, Members Sort Order, New Variable Entry Dialog (reached through
Classpath Variables/New...), Code Formatter, Show Profile Dialog (reached
through Code Formatter/Show...), Detail formatters, Add Step Filter dialog
(reached through Step Filtering), Add Packages dialog (reached through Step
Filtering), Work in Progress

summary: [Fonts] Workbench Pref pages leak 7 fonts
description:
How I did it:

With sleak and graphics-trace on:

Open Resource perspective; open sleak view; close all perspectives but resource
perspective; close all views but sleak view.

Open Eclipse again.

We start w/ 52 colors, 2 cursors, 0 fonts, 1 GC, 86 images

For each pref page: open preferences select page in tree, close preference
dialog, reopen preference, close preference, note new resources.

Workbench: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 5 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+5 fonts (2 should be
loaded: Dialog Font + Banner Font), +1 image (banner) -> no leak]

Keys: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 9 fonts, 1 GC, 91 images [+4 fonts , +4 images -> no
leak]

Appearance: no leaks
Colors: no leaks
Label Decorations: no leaks
File associations: no leaks
Fonts: no leaks
Linked Resources: no leaks
Local History: no leaks

summary: Unused import warning but type used in Javadoc
Outline doens't respect member sort preferences
description:
build 2004-02-10 16:00

1) import junit 3.8.1 into a java project
2) Set eclipse to show members in the package explorer
3) open TestCase.java in the editor
4) Change Prferences / Java / Appearance / Memver Sort Order to show public
members last

5) observe: the setting is observed in the package explorer, but not in the
outline. I don't see why the outline is different.

summary: [misc] Annotation roll-over action for Mark Occurrences removes sticky occurrences
description:
200402101600:
When clicking into the annotation roll-over icon for marked occurrence, the
other occurrences lose their marking even when occurrences should be sticky.

Steps:
- Enable Annotation roll-overs
- Enable Mark occurrences in file (also enable sticky)

- In this code fragment:
	new ArrayList().size();
	new ArrayList().size();
- set caret into "size"
- set caret to end of line (occurrences of "size" stay marked)
- hover over vertical ruler icon and click onto the arrow (tooltip: "size")
=> expected: occurrences stay marked and (selection is "size" or unchanged)
=> was: occurrence on current line is still highlighted, all other occurrence
marks disappear, selection unchanged

summary: [navigation] Quick Outline: Expand inherited members if initial type has no children
I18N: Externalize strings in Managedbuilder.ui/plugin.xml
description:
The name "C/C++ Build" at the top of the build properties page (not the title) 
is not externalized. Also, the target names in the xml ("Cygwin Executable") 
should be externalized.

summary: [typing] The word "squigglies" does not exist
description:
I200402102000

We can either use "squiggles" or "squiggly lines"

summary: [RCP][Views] Need the ability to resize views programmatically
description: We need the ability to resize any view in a perspective programmatically.

summary: [Progress] "Pending" TreeItem causes unexpected shifting (usability)
description:
When population of children treeitems is done using a background job, 
a "Pending" TreeItem is places as child 0 of the container treeitem.  When the 
job completes, this treeitem is disposed.  So, when the user places the mouse 
over an item and tries to select it, the item often moves up one position 
because of the above disposal.

To avoid the sifting, the "Pending" item could be the last child instead of 
the first, since that is where the pending children show up.  Or, the parent 
treeitem could be decorated in its string to show something like:
"cdt-home (pending)"

summary: TrimLayout margins inconsistent with other layouts
description:
Trimlayout has a margin width and height of 0 initially.
This is inconsistant with other layout classes currently existing.

While this is a non-typical layout and likely not going to be used outside the 
workbench, but it might.  And I think it is better to be consistant in these 
cases than different.  It will likely just cause frustration for anyone new to 
this layout.

summary: Feature request: Allow more control over Debug view
description:
It would be nice to exert more control over the Debug view.  For example, the 
debugger I am writing is a multi-core debugger.  Multiple breakpoints can be 
hit simultaneously.  The default behavior of the Debug view is to select a new 
Stack Frame when a breakpoint is hit, open up the source code, and position it 
at this line.  This is very confusing in the multi-core environment.  I may be 
stepping through code when another breakpoint is hit, and suddenly I am staring 
at a completely different file.

The control I would like to exert over the debug view would include:

1) Control whether or not selection occurs.
2) Control whether or not tree expansion/contraction occurs.

summary: UI blocked by quickdiff during CVS update
description:
I performed an Update of about 200 incoming files in the sync view. About half 
way through this background operation, the workbench was locked by another 
operation. It is strange that the user would be blocked by an operation they 
did not explicitley perform. Here is the traceback of the blockage I got when 
I canceled the job blocking the UI. In general, it is a bad idea to obtain 
resource scheduling rules in the UI thread. I'm assigning this to the text 
component since it appears to e related to text editors. If I am mistaken, 
please forward appropriately.

summary: LogViewer omits entries with depth > 1
description:
i20040212

The following log will have the subentry titled "titleC" omitted. It seems to be
a presentation problem, since the PDE's LogReader is able to parse and build a
correct data model (LogEntries).

!SESSION Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.423 ---------------------------------------------
!ENTRY titleA 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.438
!MESSAGE message
!SUBENTRY 1 titleB 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.438
!MESSAGE message
!SUBENTRY 2 titleC 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.470
!MESSAGE message
!SUBENTRY 1 titleD 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.470
!MESSAGE message

summary: two session headers for the same log
description:
i20040212

If something bad happens during startup, that may cause entries to be written to
the log. Since there are situations were the Eclipse Starter may throw an
exception to the launcher (org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main), that exception will
be logged as well, causing a new SESSION header to be written to the log. That
may cause a lot of confusion.

summary: [NewLook] floating toolbar is behind view after detach (tear off)
description:

in the toolbar being below the view for example if you move the right hand 
side of the view to the right hand edge of the screen.

description:

Go to the Run Configuration dialog. Do CTRL-V or try to paste the previously

warning when this occurs.

e.g. if (false) System.out.println(...);
