summary: NPE in SettingsBlock of Standard Make project properties
description:
Scenario:
1. Open Standard Make project's properties, C/C++ Make Project page, Make 
Builder tab.
2. Uncheck Use default build command checkbox.
3. Press Apply or Ok.
4. Go to step 1.
5. There is an error message: 
   Could not accept changes: The currently displayed page contains invalid 
values.
caused by NPE in SettingsBlock.java.

summary: [FloatingWindows] Floating Progress Window
description:
Several issues:

1. The floating window should disappear if another view or editor gets focus
2. The flowating window should disappear if the Progress Monitor view is opened

IMHO the floating progress window is a big UI break. Some people prefer 
the "old style" progress report by text in the status line. The flowating view 
is unessary and adds unwanted UI clutter. If a user wants to see enhanced or 
detailed progress indication he can double click on the progress bar icon and 
the Progress view is opened. That is ok.

You might consider changing this from a floating window into a tool tip like 
yellow bubble that informs the user about new progress but this should only 
stay visible for a few secondes (like the yellow bubbles used by Windows tray 
notifications).

summary: Generated code is wrong when testing UI object existence
[ActivityMgmt] Show all option should move to a radio button
description:
The Show all option should be a radio button at the bottom of the relevant 
dialogs.

Selecting it will replace the contents of the tree with the new entries. We 
should attempt to keep selection and expansion state as much as possible.

This button will not be shown if
1) There are no activities
2) The application has the "do not show all" option set.

summary: CatchClauseSignature has broken operation
Ant complains about missing jars in classpath
description:
In build M5, there seems to be a problem with running Ant for any target when
the containing project points to jar files which are are currently missing AND
the project is not associated with CVS.

Normally I use CVS, check out projects containing source code only, use an Ant
target to retrieve external resources (jars, zips, tlds, etc.) and then add the
needed jars to the Java Project's libraries under the "Java Build Path" section
of the project's properties.  Once I have the project set up I can build the
project, clean the project (run an Ant "clean" target which deletes all
generated and retrieved resources), and then build the project again or whatever
I want.  However, trying this same senerio with a local (non-CVS) project Ant
gives the following type of error (depending on the needed resource):

ERROR: Launch:  The archive: /someproject/some.jar which is referenced by the
classpath, does not exist.

This sort of error is given even if I edit the build.xml file to include only a
test target containing an <echo>This is a test</echo>.  If the project wasn't
the result of a CVS checkout, the Ant invocation doesn't seem to run if the
Eclipse project can't find all of its resources.  Since my resources are
retrieved by an Ant target which can't be run, I have to delete the missing
resources from the project's library list, run Ant to retrieve them again, then
reassociate them with the project.  Is this fixed with a later build?

Derek Greer

summary: "Include constructor or setter methods parameter" doesn't correctly react changes
description:
"Include constructor or setter methods parameter" doesn't correctly react 
to changes of "Local variable declaration hides another field or variable" level.

summary: Add variable expansion for Main Class in launch configurations
description:
Java Application and Java Applet launch config delegates should implement
variable expansion on their Main Class and Project fields. This would allow
generic launch configuration "templates" that support the re-use of common
arguments in launch configs.

There may be the need for contributed variables from Java and Applet plugins
that support these variables.

summary: Possible serious performance issue
description:
I make a habit of constantly running my Xray profiler on my runtime 
workbenches. Today, I ran into a case where I loaded eclipse. No editors
open, just a navigator with a few hundred HTML files. I selected one
and deleted it. Then, progress monitor pops up without any progress.
CPU is at 100% for almost 2 minutes. As you can see from the included
Xray report, 32 million objects were created, 1 gigabyte was burned on
the heap and about 32MB was read from disk (summary somehow missing in
the report). I can see when this happens to a large workspace that the
user simply kills the eclipse instance (as I was close to doing).

I sent the bug report to Platform-Core as they would probably have the 
best insight into what happened. The thread to look for is ModalContext.

No, I cannot replicate.

summary: Cryptic Error Message from Platform Loader
description:
I try to launch my runtime workbench. Apparently, there is something wrong 
with my plugin. However, all I get as a message is "Problems encountered 
starting up plug-in: "org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The BundleActivator 
org.eclipse.core.xray.Plugin is invalid". What does that mean? What is a 
BundleActivator? Why is it invalid? What can make it invalid?

I also get a java.lang.InstantiationException: 
org/eclipse/core/xray/Plugin.<init>()V, so something went wrong there? What?

2 other messages in the .log file are identical and similarly cryptic:
"Unhandled Exception", "An exception stack trace could not be found.".

Seems like someone is swallowing and translating an exception. I would
like to know what the original exception is, so I can debug my plugin.

summary: [RCP] definition of IProduct and IBundleGroup properties needed
description:
This is a reminder/placeholder for work that has been ongoing/pending but I 
can't find a matching report.

Runtime has added IProduct to model the default primary feature and 
IBundleGroup to model features.  The UI gets various bits of information from 
the original entities and needs to adapt to the new structures.  

After consulting with Nick, both IProduct and IBundleGroup were left open ended 
and UI ignorant.  Rather they provide a general getProperty() method.  The 
valid key value pairs are to be defined by the consumers/users of the objects.  
So the UI should define the form of the information it needs for the product 
branding (e.g., windowImage, ...) and the about dialog.

I don't know where this should be specified but the update team for example 
will need to know how to map the about.ini information onto IProducts and 
similarly, how to populate IBundleGroups.

summary: [ViewMgmt] View context menu doesn't work over toolbar
description:
I200402170800

Right-clicking on a view's toolbar doesn't do anything anymore. Previously, it
opened the view's context menu.

summary: [Graphics] Non-transparent icons
description:
Build 3.0M7

There are quite a number of instances where view icons have a white background 
instead of a transparent one (e.g. problems, cvs repo, search, console, 
navigator, pkg explorer, ...). 

Is the plan to make them transparent ? Which would likely fit best in new look, 
or rather have all transparent ones become white backgrounded (e.g. progress, 
javadoc, error log, declaration, ...) ?

summary: Workbench.compatibility and 3 friends pulled into RCP launch config
description:
In the run-time workbench launch configuration, on the Plug-ins tab, I select 
Choose plug-ins and fragments to launch from the list, put a check mark next 
to my RCP plug-in only (org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3), and click on Add 
required plug-ins. These three plug-ins get added unnecessarily:

org.eclipse.ui.workbench.compatibility
org.eclipse.core.resources
org.eclipse.core.resources.win32

The plug-in is not marked as working with older platforms (pre 3.0) and it has 
no dependencies on the deprecated api that is in the compatibility fragment.

summary: Opening a large project causes flashing and mouse problems.
description:
I opened a large Java project (~4000 source files) from the Resource Perspective
by right-click/Open Project. It takes a while, fine, but the cursor and all of
the Perspective icons in the left bar flash like *mad* b/w the hourglass cursor
and normal pointer. 

The Progress view reveals that eclipse it calculating state for every file. CPU
usage is 100% by the Windows Task Manager. 

This causes an odd problem on Windows XP: While E is opening the project, when I
mouse over to the task bar to click on a different app (Mozilla 1.6, which
happens to have multiple windows open, so you get a popup of window titles in
the task bar), the pop flashes to and it is very hard to get it to stay open to
switch to one of the opened windows.

I wonder if the changing of state of the cursor causes some side effects with
the OS?

Version 3.0.m7.

summary: [Workbench] Inconsistency in tool bar icons (visual language inconsistency)
description:
I20040218

We are using different icons for similar things:
- Red cross 'x':
     Navigator: delete item
     Part tabs: close tab
     Problems: delete
     Tasks: delete
- Minus '-' / multiple stacked minus
     Console: remove all
     Search view: remove one, remove all
- Eraser:
     Console: clear console
     
Especially the '-' is problematic. It is hard to recognize as a '-' if there is no '+' nearby. In additon what 
is the semantic difference between a delete 'x' and a remove '-' ?

summary: [KeyBindings] KeySupport.java should support localized key sequences
description:
Translator had a question about the need of certain strings to be externalized.

Key values are in English in the Keys Preferences page.

Steps to recreate:
1. Select Window -> Preferences 
2. Select Workbench -> Keys 
3. Select any item in the Commands box 
4. Press the pull down button next to the Key secuence field 

Question from translator:
We observed that the keys are displayed in English, however there is a file 
named: 
eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.ui.workbench\workbench_jar\org\eclipse\ui\internal\c
ommands\keysupport.properties 
that seems to contain the translation for the keys.
Should these keys be translated or should they be displayed in English?

summary: [EditorMgmt] Single Tab editor drop down position and size is wrong
description:
Copied from  bug 37997 

------ Additional Comments From  vraravam@thoughtworks.com   2004-02-19 02:21 

I am running:
Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200402181101
on a Win XP machine. Once the number of editors becomes sufficiently large, the
editorlist dropdown shows up. But when I click on it, the lightweight popup
which shows the list of currently open editors seems to extend beyond the
screen. I will attach a screen shot.


The list should be scrollable and visible on the screen at all times, in the 
event of multi-monitor it should be on the same monitor as it's associated 
window

summary: Remove all infopop plugins
description:
In the interest of having less plugins, and being more like the Eclipse 
platform, we should remove all our infopop plugins. The infopop .xml files 
should be inside the user documentation plugins (*.doc.user), as they are user 
docs. To see examples of this, see the following plugins from the JDT and PDE:

org.eclipse.jdt.doc.user
org.eclipse.pde.doc.user

Note: We don't have a Doc component in Bugzilla like the platform and JDT.. 
should we create one?

summary: UI Blocked when opening Java Perspective during CVS check out
description:
build I20040218

- start eclipse with a new workspace 
- switch to CVS Repository Exploring perspective
- check out a number of projects ( i checkout Platform UI module)
- now attempt to switch to the Java Perspective

NOTE that at this point the "UI is blocked" dialog is opened.  
Probably due to the fact that starting the Java Perspective requires the 
workbench lock?

The point here is that this will be a common pattern and it would be nice if 
we could investigate makeing this scenario work more smoothly.

summary: [Coolbar] Open a workspace twice causes toolbar icons to disappear
description:
On the latest I-Build I20040219 if I open a new workspace all the toolbar 
icons show up and work.  If I close and restart eclipse on the same workspace 
then all the toolbar icons disappear.  I can never get the icons to show up 
again unless I start with another new workspace.

summary: Add ability to save list of changed files [refactoring]
description:
The current "Preview" option that is available when refactoring displays a 
graphical list of changed files.  It would be useful to be able to save this 
list to a text file for use in heterogeneous development groups.

summary: numberic prefix to repeat keystroke
description: For example, to input 60 slashes(/) by typing "C-6-0 /" in emacs.

summary: OSGI os alias returned instead of name.
description:
org.osgi.framework.BundleContext.getProperty( 
org.osgi.framework.Constants.FRAMEWORK_OS_NAME )
should return canonical OS name rather than alias.
So on Windows XP it should return "WindowsXP" rather than "Windows XP".

Am using M7 btw.

description:
I20040219

On every restart my toolbar area takes up too much space (see screenshot).

summary: console: no action when drop down is pressed
description:
The drop down to switch consoles should perform some action when the console 
button itself (not the down arrow is pressed). I suggest that it switches to 
the previous console, so that I can easily toggle between two consoles.

summary: Allow Bitwise-Or for listener type on widgets
[DetachedView] Undocked/floating windows looses position
description:
When I undock my package explorer in one perspective onto screen/monitor 1 and 
places it at a specific position. I then switch to debug perspective and then 
back again, the unlocked/floating window is placed in the exact same position 
as I left it in. 
 
If I place the floating window in screen/monitor 2 however, the window appears 
to the far left on screen 1 (possible in position 0,0). This means everytime I 
switch to and from the debug perspective, I have to move my package explorer 
undocked window back onto the second screen. 
 
Expected result: The floating/undocked window keeps its position when 
switching perspectives even if it was positioned on screen 2 as it does on 
screen 1. 
 
I Have only tested this on Linux Redhat 9.0/KDE3.2 using SWT GTK. Except not 
using this feature, I don't see a simple workaround to keep the window 
positions.

summary: CDT Build number not showing in builds.
description:
Currently the only way to check which CDT build that workbench has is to look 
in the map file.

There is no info available in the "About Eclipse" dialog (and sub dialogs).

summary: [EditorMgmt] Editor drop down cut off at edge of monitor
description:
When the right hand edge of Eclipse is near the edge of the monitor the editor 
drop down menu gets cut off.  Maximizing Eclipse does not change this.  I am 
running on a machine with a dual monitor setup.  Note the menu is not spanning 
monitors as in defect #51240 but actually cut off.

I have "Show multilpe Editor tabs" turned on.  I can also get this to happen 
with that preference turned off the but I have to size Eclipse down from the 
left such that the single editor tab does not fit on screen - then the editor 
drop down clips on the right even though there is plenty of room on the left.

summary: Errors from the ant task do not provide links
description:
When invoking ant tasks, and getting an error, the console provides a hyperlink 
from the first line (the one that contains the message "BUILD FAILED" message), 
but the following two lines, which are more relevant to the error, are not 
provided with the hyperlinking capability to click right to the line that 
caused the error.

    [javac] ^
    [javac] 2 errors
BUILD FAILED: C:\BASE\Common\build.xml:188: Following error occured while 
executing this line
C:\BASE\Common\JDC\build.xml:134: Following error occured while executing this 
line
C:\BASE\Common\JDC\shared.xml:113: Compile failed; see the compiler error 
output for details.

summary: message flashing in launch dialog
description:
The launch config type messages/descriptions flash as I move from one config 
to the next, even though the message does not change. I realize this is likely 
due to the dialog updaing/refreshing as a new config is selected, but we 
should try to avoid changing the message to "blank" and then back to the same 
thing.

summary: No statistics collected when heap option is OPTIONS_NO_INSTANCE_INFORMATION
description:
I am running a profile configuration where heap information is not selected,
exec flow and method coverage are selected

This map to the following RAC options configuration:

TRACE_MODE = noObjectCorrelation
ALLOCATION_INFORMATION = none
STACK_INFORMATION = boundary
TICKET = true
BOUNDARY_DEPTH = 4
METHOD_COUNTS = true
UNREFERENCED_SYMBOLS = true

When I run the app, I get exec flow information at the class object level but
the statistics at the package , class, etc are all 0

summary: what are the (I)Platform.openStream*() API for
description:
The title says it all.  There are two openStream() methods on (I)Platform but 
it is unclear what they are there for.  Why can't a caller use find() or 
getEntry() (whichever is the appropriate API) and the openStream on the 
resultant URL?

summary: [generate delegate] option to use getter [code generation]
description:
Two use cases:

-if getter exists use it
-if getter does not exist yet create it

@@@@

Would help with "lazy initialization" of the delegate.

@@@@

What would be problematic?

Code like:

class A {
    private String fValue;
   
    public String getValue() {
        return "X"; //does not use fValue
    }
}

Now invoke generate delegate methods on "fValue".

@@@@

Another possibility would be offering create delegate methods including
get-methods, i.e. the tree would also show getXXX methods.

summary: Tasks View gets corrupted clicking on column header
description:
I had a Java project with 5-10 classes in it, and about 8-10 //TODO: comments 
sprinkled throughout.  When I clicked the Resource column of the Tasks view to 
sort by that attribute, all data in the view disappeared.  The Tasks panel 
itself, including the control widgets/icons in its title bar are still there.  
It just appears as if none of the files in my projects contains any //TODO: 
comments, which as I stated, is not the case.

Most disturbingly, exiting and restarting Eclipse does not resolve the 
problem.  In fact, I get a message upon startup, apparently as Eclipse is 
trying to reload the workspace settings which were saved upon the previous 
exit.

Once started up, Eclipse gives me the same error every time I click on any 
column header of the Tasks view. The error is:

ERROR: Searching for markers in Tasks view: An internal error occurred 
during: "Searching for markers in Tasks view".

summary: Ecore model doesn't match XML schema
description:
On Linux 2.4.22, Sun JVM 1.4.2_02, Eclipse 3.0M7, EMF 2.0.0_20040127_1738SL:

I created an XML schema: 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified"
targetNamespace=" http://coalition/xml/schema " version="1.0"
xmlns=" http://coalition/xml/schema " xmlns:cool=" http://coalition/xml/schema "
xmlns:xs=" http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema ">
  <xs:simpleType name="IdT">
    <xs:restriction base="xs:string">
      <xs:whiteSpace value="preserve"/>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:simpleType name="NameT">
    <xs:restriction base="xs:string">
      <xs:whiteSpace value="preserve"/>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="SomethingT">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Name" type="cool:NameT"/>
    </xs:sequence>
    <xs:attribute name="locationId" type="IdT" use="required"/>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:element name="SomethingList">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="Something" type="cool:SomethingT"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

When I create an Ecore model from that schema, the names for the elements are
being munged in an unpleasant fashion.  SomethingList becomes SomethingListType,
and its sub-element "Something" becomes "something".  When I generate code from
these munged names, and try to serialize the objects to XML, the resulting XML
doesn't match the schema.

summary: [assist] task tag completion in comments
JUnit Plugin test wizard fails to find tests that extend a subclass of TestCase
description:
Eclipse I20040212 on OS X (10.3.2)

I created an abstract subclass of TestCase to help my testing and subclassed that with concrete tests.

Unfortunately, the JUnit plugin-test configuration fails to find the concrete tests. If I specify that all 
tests in a project should be run, only direct subclasses of TestCase are run.

Channing

summary: Browser.setText fires an navigation event
description:
if you call Browser.setText() an URL navigation event is fired with an 
about:blank url.

Is there any chance this can be changed? It is too anoying. We have a case 
where we want to intercept about:blank URLs, but can differentaiate between an 
about:blank navigation event generated due to a setText call, or one generated 
due to a real link that refers to about:blank.


Mazen.

summary: [Trim] Console view does not show up when running an Ant task
description:
M7

When the Conosle view is hidden (by double clicking a file tab in the Java
editor, for example) it does not show when running an Ant task.
Note that the Console view shows up if it's closed but the lower docked pane is
visible.

have to provide a fix for 2.1.3 I started my 2.1 maintenance workspace up using

using PDE's Run-time Workbench launch configuration (I clear the workspace) I get:

summary: Target request failed: Thread ID 3 not known dialog box occurs when first breakpoint hit
description:
After starting a CDT launch that performs an "attach to process" and resuming 
it, the first time a breakpoint is hit, I receive anywhere from 3 to 8 dialogs 
all stating "Error: An error has occurred.  See error log for more details."  
Finally, the first dialog issued (the one at the bottom of the stack of 
dialogs) states, "Target request failed: Thread ID 3 not known.  Reason: Target 
request failed: Thread ID 3 not known."

I can see similar messages from the gdb trace in the Eclipse Console (included 
at the bottom of this message).

This seems to be related to the fact that there is a thread that is present 
when the attach first occurs that goes away before the breakpoint is hit.  Note 
that on subsequent launches in the same Eclipse session, this does NOT occur.

summary: [interop] NoClassDefFoundError when using SWT_AWT after applying workaround for manifest file
description:
Christophe Avare wrote:

 > Are you saying that your plugin, when deployed inside the workbench used to
> develop it cannot find the SWT_AWT class ? 

Yes indeed, thats what I'm saying. Developing the plugin and running it by
starting the runtime-workspace (spawns a separate IDE window) works ok.
But when restarting the initial IDE, invoking the plugin will cause the
same NoClassDefFoundError.

Turning on the OSGI support did not work.

I'm able to reproduce the bug by starting in a clean environment, choose a
new project plugin with a view. In the action1 button, instead of showing
a message, I construct a Frame via the SWT_AWT class, set the size, add a
JPanel containing a JButton and make it visible.

If you now choose "run as..." a runtime workbench is started and
everything works fine. Now export the project as a deployable plugin.
Then, extract the zip file to the eclipse folder so that the plugin is in
the appropriate place. Stop and restart Eclipse, adjust perspective so
that the view is selectable and choose show view "Sample view". In the
sample view click on the first item in the menu "action1", an exception is
thrown and the log file says:

!SESSION Jan 09, 2004 14:25:18.483
---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.2_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

"org.eclipse.core.runtime".

summary: [KeyBindings] Keybinding Service consumes keystrokes for unregistered commands
description:
My editor has no "Content Assist" action handler.
My editor's canvas does not receive CTRL+SPACE KeyPressed event.

From mailing list:

 > I'm pretty sure Nick said that if the action bound to a keybinding is
> disabled (or bound to NULL), then the keybinding service would stop
> consuming that key.  But this is not the behavior we are seeing.  For 

We check whether the command has a handler (i.e., action) associated with it. 
If it doesn't, then we don't eat the key.  We eat all keys that: (1) have a 
key binding currently in context; and (2) have a handler currently active.


 > example, we also need to receive CTRL+SPACE, which has universal meaning
> of "toggle selection" of item with focus. But the keybinding for Content
> Assist is getting in the way. Why do native Trees and Tables receive
> CTRL+SPACE, but our Canvas does not? 

Likely because a handler is registered for your part.  I'm just guessing, as
I'm not sure of the details of your set-up.

Nope, we are not registering a handler
-Randy

summary: Fix wording of build path dialog [build path]
description:
the dialog that appears when you add a sourcepath to a newly created java workspace says 
Click OK to blahblahblah. and the options are Yes and No.. which are the more mac version of the 
windows ok/cancel i suppose. can we change the wording to "Do you want to blahblah?" so the dialog 
buttons make sense?

summary: [EditorMgmt] dropdown: too hard to drive
description:
The new editor drop down is too hard to drive.  editor selection now requires:

- moving the mouse to the (rather small) down arrow/triangle, 
- clicking 
- choosing an editor by name of the file 
- clicking again

This significantly breaks the workflow.  driving to the little drop down area 
requires me to stop what I am thinking about and concentrate on aiming.  As a 
first step I suggest
a) make clicking anywhere in the entire "gray" area around the editor tab cause 
the drop down to appear.  This simplifies aiming
b) having some modifier key that just brings up the list at the current mouse 
position (e.g., Alt and button down or some such)
c) accelerators for choosing editors (I looked around but did not see anything 
in the menus etc)

The related issue is choosing by name.  This problems here are
a) requires you to know/think about the name of the thing you are looking for
b) the combo is quite cluttered because the entire path of the file is 
displayed with little visual separation
c) users are unable to leverage their spatial abilities (i.e., I usually just 
know where the editor I want is but really don't know what the name of the file 
is)

I don't know what to do about this.  Perhaps all that empty space in the fast 
view docking area can be used to put editor icons with really fast hover help 
showing the real name.  left unsorted or permitting user arrangement users 
could develop a spatial model?

summary: Allow to bookmark search matches
description:
Build 3.0M7

It may be useful to allow search matches to be converted to bookmarks. Instead 
of opening the editor and then adding a bookmark.

summary: Missing catalog message for error log view
description:
I20040128 (5pm)

Open the error log view, and select an error with no stack.  The stack text area
in the dialog has the string:

LogView.preview.noStack

Looks like a missing catalog message.

summary: [Workbench] level of detail option for view title bar
description:
One of the common new look gripes is that if you have a view pane with several
views, and the tabs for those views don't fit, then the inactive views "fall off
the end" and are no longer visible.  This is made worse by the extra space used
by the curvy active tab.  Many applications solve problems like this by making
the information displayed in tabs configurable (text only, icon only, or both).
The initial configuration shows text to help out the novice user, but the
advanced user can turn off the text and just use the icons.  This would allow
you to have quite a lot of views within a pane and not have them "fall off the end".

summary: Resolver API should expose new names
description:
The resolver API still uses old names like getUniqueId. It should be aligned
with the Bundle API and say in this case getSymbolicName.
There may be other cases like that, I haven't check them all.

summary: Changing the style of a Label from SWT.SHADOW_IN to SWT.SHADOW_NONE does not make a difference in the appearance of the Label
description:
When I was going through the Eclipse 3.0 M7 examples (eclipse-examples-
3.0M7.zip) which I downloaded from 
 http://fullmoon.torolab.ibm.com/downloads/drops/S-3.0M7-200402122000/eclipse -
examples-3.0M7.zip, I realized that changing the style of a Label from 
SWT.SHADOW_IN to SWT.SHADOW_NONE did not make a difference in the appearance 
of the Label.

Here are the steps to follow in order to regenerate this scenario:
1. Install Eclipse 3.0M7 on Solaris 9 or HP_UX 11.11.
2. Download Eclipse 3.0 M7 Examples (eclipse-examples-3.0M7.zip) from 
 http://fullmoon.torolab.ibm.com/downloads/drops/S-3.0M7-200402122000/eclipse -
examples-3.0M7.zip and install them.
3. Launch Eclipse
4. Select “Window -> Show View -> Other…”. This will launch the “Show View” 
Dialog.
5. From the “Show View” Dialog, select “SWT Examples -> SWT Controls”. This 
will display “SWT Controls” View.
6. From SWT Controls View, select “Label” tab.
7. In the “Styles” group, make sure SWT.SEPARATOR, SWT.VERTICAL and 
SWT.SHADOW_IN options are checked and the rest are unchecked.
8. In the “Other” group, make sure both “Enabled” and “Visible” options are 
checked.
9. In the “Size” group, make sure “100 X 100” is selected.
10. From the “Styles” group, select SWT.SHADOW_NONE option. This will uncheck 
the SWT.SHADOW_IN option.
Expected Behavior: The appearance of the Labels should change
Actual Behavior: The appearance of the Labels remains unchanged

Important: When I ran the same tests on Eclipse 2.1.2, the outcome was the 
same as it was on Eclipse 3.0M7.

summary: PDE Projects created by plugin wizard are not loaded in runtime workbench

Eclipse: I20040224
OS X 10.3.2

After creating a new project using a plugin template, it is not loaded by the runtime-workbench, the 
console says 

Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/workspace/test

No other logs are produced.

summary: OK button in "Source Folder Selection" window is sometimes grayed out when it is not supposed to be
description:
What I wanted: 
I wanted to add a new source folder called "foo" to the build path. The source folder  
did not already exist. 
  
What I did: 
I went into the project properties --> Java Build Path --> "Add Folder...". Since the  
source folder did not already exist, I selected "Create New Folder..." and created it.  
After creating the folder, it appeared in the "Source Folder Selection" window as  
selected but the OK button was still grayed out. I had to deselect and select the folder  
in order to "ungray" the OK button.  
  
What I expected: 
The OK button should not have been grayed out.

summary: The CView to update with each reconcile
description:
For example, the CView via the CElementContentProvider
is doing 
  ITranslation.getChildren()

But it seems we are still working on the IFile instead
of the WorkingCopy / BufferFactory were the update to date
content of the file is(if it is open inside the CEditor).

Reassign to Hoda.

summary: [new search] show an indication when there are no matches
description:
There is almost no visual difference between a search just has started and a 
search that has ended without any matches.

Suggest to show an item in the search results view when there are no matches.
The item should have an info icon plus the message " no references found" etc.

summary: BasicLauncherTab not checking for null
description:
In BasicLauncherTab:initializeApplicationSection(ILaunchConfiguration), there 
is the following line:

index = fApplicationCombo.indexOf(LauncherUtils.getDefaultApplicationName());

Problem is that the argument can be null if there is no "install.ini" file in 
the target platform directory.  This in turns causes the combo box to throw 
illegal argument exception and the run configuration dialog cannot be 
displayed.

summary: Problem with name collision in XML-schema generated models(?)
description:
I have a fairly large XML schema (142 Classes, 133 DataTypes, 30 Enums, 549
Features, 1 Package)
that I used to generate an EMF model (EMF 2.0.0_20031219 though I have the same
problem with
2.0.0_20040127).  I'm using this schema to send and receive SOAP messages, and
for most of my
messages this works fine.  Unfortunately, for one type of message I'm seeing a
strange exception
thrown when I try to parse a particular XML document.  The failing XML is small,
and correct by the schema:

<sch:LocationList xmlns:sch=" http://coalition/xml/schema ">
  <sch:Location locationId="271095">
    <sch:Name>Brisbane Australia</sch:Name>
    <sch:Code codeType="GEOLOC">
      <sch:Parameter parmName="GEOLOC">CKKJ</sch:Parameter>
    </sch:Code>
  </sch:Location>
</sch:LocationList>

Whereas this XML works fine:

<sch:LocationList xmlns:sch=" http://coalition/xml/schema ">
  <sch:Location locationId="271095">
    <sch:Name>Brisbane Australia</sch:Name>
  </sch:Location>
</sch:LocationList>

The problem appears to revolve around the name collision avoidance mechanism
that EMF is using to deal with similarly named elements of different types.  If
the BaseEquipT type is removed from the schema, and everything rebuilt, the
problem goes away.  Unfortunately, I don't have the luxury of renaming the
conflicting schema elements.

The exception that gets thrown is:

java.lang.ArrayStoreException
  at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.assign(BasicEList.java:190)
  at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.addUnique(BasicEList.java:606)
  at
org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.addUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java:299)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHelperImpl.setValue(XMLHelperImpl.java:748)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.setFeatureValue(XMLHandler.java:1448)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.setFeatureValue(XMLHandler.java:1438)
  at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createObjectFromFeatureType(XMLHandler.java:1176)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createObject(XMLHandler.java:1086)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.handleFeature(XMLHandler.java:952)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.processElement(XMLHandler.java:403)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.startElement(XMLHandler.java:386)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.SAXWrapper.startElement(SAXWrapper.java:78)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1637)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.content(Parser2.java:1926)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1654)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.content(Parser2.java:1926)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1654)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:634)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:333)
  at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:448)
  at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLLoadImpl.load(XMLLoadImpl.java:89)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLResourceImpl.doLoad(XMLResourceImpl.java:141)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:879)
  at t2.test.Test2.main(Test2.java:42)

I've attached the relevant subset of the schema (the full schema is proprietary
and huge), the program that exposes the problem, as well as the genmodel and
ecore files.

answers with, "Overlapping text edits"

ideas are welcome

summary: Display keybinding for default close action in debug popup
description:
The keybinding associated with the 'default debug popup close action' should 
be displayed in the debug popup. We could show the keybinding in brackets at 
the end of the action label - "(CR)", or experiment with modifying the label 
to say something like "Press 'key-binding' to XXX", where XXX is the original 
action's label.

summary: JSPs should be considered as ASCII files
description:
Default behavior is that JSPs are currently considered as binary files. It would be nice 
if the default settings in Preferences --> Team --> File Content state that JSPs are 
ASCII files.

summary: CDT debug suspend and resume
description:
start a debugging session without an automatic resume (in suspend mode)
to give the opportunity  to see registers and memories before
running the application.

summary: Reverting file messes up breakpoint
description:
Build 20040226

1. Place a breakpoint on a line.
2. Edit the file in some way (I added a blank line below the breakpoint.
3. File->Revert.
4. The breakpoint marker in the editor ruler disappears. (first problem) The 
breakpoint is still visible in the Breakpoints View, however.
5. Double-click on the line where the breakpoint used to show.
6. A new breakpoint appears in the Breakpoints View, but it's label is shorter 
than the "zombie" breakpoint's. It doesn't include the method name. (second 
problem)

summary: Refresh produces duplicate on case rename
description:
Eclipse 3.0M7, Windows XP

If a package is renamed, but only changing the case, in Windows explorer, then 
when refresh is pressed package explorer will have both versions of the 
package. Probably a Windows only problem.

1) Create a package called testCase.
2) Create a class called Test, but have the package line as "testcase".
3) Go to Windows explorer and change the package to "testCase".
4) Click refresh on the project.
5) There will now be two packages "testCase" and "testcase".

summary: Emacs key bindings do not work with C editor
description:
When using the C editor with CDT 2.0M7, the key bindings for text editing are
not used. It appears that the C editor uses the "In General" key bindings
instead of the text editing key bindings, as enabling the Emacs key bindings set
has no effect. For instance, typing CTRL+A should normally take you to the start
of the line, instead it selects the entire document (windows style).

Admittedly this is minor but is an annoyance if you're used to using the emacs
key bindings with Java :)

summary: Make the InternalAntRunner more lazy
description:
For all contributed tasks and types we currently force load the class whether 
it is used or not.
On Ant 1.6 this is no longer required.

summary: [DND] Workbench "locks up" after call to openEditor

summary: Determine mixed order of libraries and source folders in class path for debugging
description:
I want to debug my server application.
I am starting to debug my junit test. Everything seems fine.
The test is marshalling arguments and calling the server.
The server says: unmarshal exception.

Probable reason: i have configured the source of whole project in eclipse.
Eclipse recompiles everything and uses its own compiled classes.
That may differ slightly from the classes/libraries on the server.
So I get the unmarshal exception. 

O.k. I could remove the source entry and
use the correct library instead, but then I can not analyse and 
refactor all sources anymore and I do not want to create a new project 
for debugging and for developing. (Besides that I already have to make
a new eclipse project for each version control branch, and we have many 
branches. This could be solved by a separate feature request.)

So I would like to be able to add the source to the project but
tell eclipse to take the library and neverless show the source 
at debugging.

If you think this features request is reasonable,
perhaps you can give it a reasonable name, too.

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen

summary: Can't print on linux
description:
This probably isn't the right component, but...

I'm on a redhat 8 system with eclipse 2.1.2.  The button to print is grayed out,
as is the file menu option to print.  Other apps print with no trouble.

summary: Editor code assist preference box does not allow you to change background for currently selected proposal background
description:
If you look at the preference page for Java->Editor and view the "Code Assist" 
tab you will notice that you can change the colors for code assist. There 
isn't a selection for changing the background color for the currently 
selected "completion proposal background". 

My issue is that the background color for the selection looks very similar to 
the normal background color for code assist. This makes it very difficult to 
determine what code assist option you are selecting.

summary: [Coolbar] "Widget is Disposed" Error when using GTK UI
description:
Using CDT 2.0 on RHEL 3.0 with GTK on IA32 with Eclipse 3.0 M6.
Get errors with the UI when performing normal operations with the Mouse. Pairs 
of error messages appear in the error log when clicking with the mouse:
"Unhandled event loop exception"
"Widget is disposed"

This error occurs frequently and requires Eclipse to be shut down and 
restarted, since it makes the UI unusable - once these errors start, much of 
the UI becomes unavailable for mouse clicking (each click only generates the 
two error messages, in sequence).

summary: [CellEditors] ComboBoxCellEditor dismissed on first click in Properties View
description:
When you click in the properties view on an entry that uses a ComboBoxCellEditor 
it will activate the cell editor correctly, but when you try to click on the 
dropdown, the cell editor is dismissed.  You then need to click again to 
activate the cell editor again, and then you need to click the dropdown again, 
which fortunately works the second time.  Any property that uses a 
ComboBoxCellEditor needs to be clicked four times to access the dropdown the 
first time.  Every time a new input is passed to the properties view, the 
behavior is reset and four clicks are necessary yet again.

One place to reproduce this is in the PDE's .exsd editor.  EMF relies heavily on 
the properties view, so this problem is a serious usability regression that 
needs to be addressed before 3.0 is final.

summary: Filter debug actions with contexts
description:
In order to reduce clutter in the debug perspective and associated views, we 
should filter debugger-specific actions based on the active context.

See related  bug 49934 .

summary: Datapool Editor: Add Variable dialog should not allow types that begin with a number.
description:
1. Open up a datapool.
2. Right click on the table to bring up the context menu.
3. Select the "Add Variable" context menu item.
4. Enter a type starting with a number.  The type is allowed.

summary: Bug with DebugModelContextBindings
Problems not removed after fixing
description:
Using Eclipse 3.0M7+EMF 0225_1234SL
If I create a new XSD file, and add the following:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema xmlns=" http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema " 
xmlns:test=" http://www.example.com/test " 
targetNamespace=" http://www.example.com/test ">
</schema>

there are no reported problems as expected.
If you add <element name="foo" type="string"/> to the schema, all is still 
well.
Change the type to "bar". A problem is correctly reported.  
If you then comment out the element statement with <!-- and --> surrounding it 
either on separate lines or enclosed within, the error remains.  The location 
of error does not match the layout of the file.
If you close the file and re-open it, the errors are gone.

summary: Additional fixes for porting SWT to 64-bit
description:
Creating separate bug as requested in  bug 37775 .

I have made additional changes to SWT-N20040228 to address some problems
occuring when using SWT on the amd64 platform. With the patches attached I am
now able to get the first window of Eclipse-N20040228 up and running.

There are all kinds of fixes, including changes in the glue .c files - although
I understand these are automatically generated? There are changes made to
parameters, return values, size constants and pointer arithmetics using the same
standard as the other changes ( int -> long /*int*/ ).

btw, I was thinking that being able to get conversion warnings from both C and
Java compilers when an implicit conversion from int to long is taking place
would be of great help, wouldn't it? Wouldn't that pinpoint possible problem areas?

Anyways, I plan to continue with getting Eclipse going on 64-bit. If I come up
with new patches, should I attach them here as well or open a new bug?

summary: [DCR] [DOM Comments] Provide extended ranges including leading/trailing comments for AST nodes
description:
Currently jdt-core does not offer any way to get extended ranges of compilation 
unit AST nodes hierarchy.
As now, we build and store comments table in compilation unit, it's possible to 
compute and give users acces to these extended ranges...

summary: No refs found for WorkbenchWindow.createTrimWidgets
description:
build I20040225

- self-hosting workspace with SWT and UI and Text in source, rest as imported 
binaries
- open type on WorkbenchWindow
- Ctrl+O to createTrimWidgets
- Ctrl+Shift+G
- no refs found
- Ctrl+T to super implementation in ApplicationWindow
- Ctrl+Shift+G
- it finds the ref in org.eclipse.jface.window.ApplicationWindow.configureShell
(Shell)

This is a protected method, so the first search should have found the same ref.

summary: [EditorMgmt] Close All is flashy
description:
build I20040225

- using multi tabs
- open a bunch of editors
- activate the first one
- File > Close All
- you see the tabs animate as they close

This is a regression from 2.1.

summary: GLA's org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.Component.stop() API is not fully implemented.
description:
GLA's org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.Component.stop() API is not fully 
implemented.

One result of this defect is that the StaticParserSensor.stop() is not being 
called which intern calls the StaticParserSensor.clean() API and intern calls 
the postParse() API on the static parser to release system resources (e.g. 
close file handle).

summary: Debugger should indicate which thread triggered breakpoint
description:
In a multi-threaded application the debugger currently correctly opens 
the stack frame for the thread which caused the exception correctly, but
there is no other indication that that thread is the cause of the fault.
There should be some sort of graphic indicator in the label decorator as
well as a text annotation (other than just Suspended) which indicates
that this thread is the reason you got to where you are at.

summary: Setting Ant home adds jars in reverse order
description:
With the changes from  bug 45450 , when the user sets Ant home, the jars are 
added in reverse order.

summary: EclipseStarter should not alway refreshPackages
description:
EclipseStarter.loadBasicBundles() attempts to install the base bundles and then 
always does a refreshPackages() on the base bundles even when no actual 
installs have occurred.  This is causing most all bundles installed on the 
platform to be refreshed each startup even when nothing has changed.  This is 
pretty expensive.  Should try change it so it only does a refreshPackages if 
something has changed.

summary: Format command moves //$NON-NLS comments to next line.
description:
When using the Source -> Format command, it moves the //$NON-NLS comments to 
the next line invalidating them. To reproduce this bug, go to Windows -> 
Preferences -> Java -> Code Formatter -> Edit -> Arguments -> and set line 
wrapping to "Wrap always except first element if necessary". Then format some 
source like the following:

SomeObject someObject = new SomeObject("Parameter1", //$NON-NLS-1$
                                       "Parameter2",  //$NON-NLS-1$ 
                                       null);
This will end up like:

SomeObject someObject = new SomeObject("Parameter1", 
                                       //$NON-NLS-1$
                                       "Parameter2",  
                                       //$NON-NLS-1$ 
                                       null);

Which defeats the whole purpose of using the non-internationalizable comments.

summary: [Font/Colour] Coolbar background bug
description:
Eclipse 200403010010

The workbench is setting a background color in the CoolBar but not in its
children (ToolBar controls).

On Windows (with the manifest), Coolbar by default has a gradient background and
Toolbar background is transparent. My guess is that workbench don't want the
gradient background (or maybe just want a different color) on the CoolBar, so it
sets a backgrond on the CoolBar, since the Toolbar is transparent it shows its
parent's (CoolBar) background thru.

On GTK, probably other platforms as well, the ToolBar is not tranparent. So the
Coolbar gets it background changed to a specific color and the ToolBar remains
with the default one. Testing with different GTK themes one can see weird
combinations of colors in the CoolBar and its children (hint: the only visual
CoolBar part is the CoolItem's gripper).

I don't know what is the right answer for this problem. But, some possible
(untested) solutions are:
1) Stop changing the CoolBar's background
2) Also setting the ToolBars' background to match the CoolBar's background

Anyhow, I didn't look at UI code to prove what I'm saying is correct so I might
be complete out for lunch.

summary: Run Profile context menu not available
description:
In Eclipse 3.0, a Run cascade menu is available in the context menu.  What 
appears in the cascade menu is the Launch shortcuts that are relevant for the 
selected file in the navigator. 
We should add our own Profile shortcuts for all available configurations.

This is the extension point :

   <extension
         point="org.eclipse.debug.ui.launchShortcuts">
      <shortcut
            label="%launcher.junit.name"
            icon="icons/obj16/julaunchpgn.gif"
            modes="run, debug"
            class="org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.JUnitWorkbenchShortcut"
            id="org.eclipse.pde.ui.junitWorkbenchShortcut">
         <perspective
               id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaPerspective">
         </perspective>
         <perspective
               id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaHierarchyPerspective">
         </perspective>
         <perspective
               id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaBrowsingPerspective">
         </perspective>
         <perspective
               id="org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugPerspective">
         </perspective>
         <perspective
               id="org.eclipse.pde.PDEPerspective">
         </perspective>
      </shortcut>
  </extansion>

summary: Allow bypassing "workspace in use" check for RCP applications
description:
I would like to be able to specify a commandline option (say, "-concurrentOk")
or some other mechanism that would allow running multiple instances using the
same workspace simultaneously.  Without this ability, RCP applications will
often need to be wrappered with some cumbersome launch mechanism that either

o creates a new workspace for each instance (probably losing any chance of
  persisting state), or

o implements some mechanism for rendezvousing with an already-running instance
  of the app.

If such an option were supported, I believe it would be acceptable to follow
a "last writer wins" policy when it comes time to save the application state.

summary: No need for "plugin.xml" strings in platform.xml
description:
When generating list of plug-ins in platform.xml, PDE currently writes paths 
pointing to plugin.xml, for example, "plugins/org.apache.ant/plugin.xml".
It should instead write plugin location like:
"plugins/org.apache.ant/" - for plugins running from a directory,
"plugins/org.apache.ant_1.0.0.jar" - for plugins running directly from a jar.

summary: [java launching] java_type_name variable doesn't resolve selected binary type
description:
I created a jar file with a java class with a main method, added this jar to the
build path of a project, selected the class from the package explorer.
I tried to use a java launch configuration with '${java_type_name}' as type
name. I failed with an error : "The selected resource doesn't resolve to a Java
element".

summary: Can't commit changes from synch view
description:
Build 20040302

The team menu options (update, commit, etc.) no longer appear in the Team Synchronize view.

summary: A missing optional plugin causes low-level Assert exception
description:
I saw this on the I20040226 build. 
If an optional plugin (that is, marked as optional=true in 'requires' element, 
is in fact not present, a low-level Assert exception occurs during descriptor.
getPluginPrerequisites(). 

I stumbled across this testing something completely un-related, but since in the 
base stack you probably don't have optional plugins which are not present, 
thought you might appreciate the report. [BTW, its actually in Hyades plugins 
that has an optional plugin which really is not (normally) intended to be 
present). 

I'm not sure what the right solution is .. either ignore it (and return what is 
there) or return a special descriptor that is marked as "missing optional 
plugin". 

I'll attach test case and instructions, but here's the instructions (not sure 
you'll even need the test code is so easy to reproduce). 

Description:
	TestPlugin has the test code (see testPluginPrereqs())
	TestPlugin 'requires' RequiringPlugin
	RequiringPlugin *optionally* 'requires OptionalPlugin

Instructions for reproducing

1. Select TesterPlugin
2. Run as ... Junit Plugin Test

All is ok (test passes). 

Now, remove (delete or close) OptionalPlugin

re-run steps 1 and 2, and you'll see Assert.isNotNull exception throw deep in 
internal.plugins code.

summary: Infinite loop in animation of making a fastview
description:
build I20040303

- create a detached view
- popup a menu on the tab of the detached view and choose Fast View, 
- infinite loop of errors occurs in Animating Rectangle job (is this a job?)

summary: generating getters and setters puts 1 line of whitespace at bottom instead of top
description:
when i generate my getters and setters, the first line of generated code is
directly under the existing code, and the last line of generated code has a line
of whitespace under it. this is the opposite of what i would expect. i'd expect
1 line of whitespace before the generated code and none below.

my 'insert point' is 'last method'.

summary: [java debug] Automatic disconnect after N timeout exceptions

when I hit play in debug mode - and then hitting the details button a message
told me to check my log which kept on growing with these same messages until I
killed my remote app.  Eclipse was unresponsive until the remote app terminated.

summary: Search result tree may be a bit to precise
description:
I200403030818

I did a search>write access>workspace on the local variable 'type' in the method
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.ManageBreakpointActionDelegate#manageBreakpoint(),
the result was (in the New Search view) :

org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions [...]
+ ManageBreakpointActionDelegate
  + manageBreakpoint(IEditorInput) : void (1 match)
    + IType type
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.ManageBreakpointActionDelegate#manageBreakpoint(IEditorInput)
(1 match)

I don't really care that the second match is in a local variable declaration,
that doesn't give me any interresting information and break up the list of
matches for the method.

summary: Attached source file is opened instead of .class
description:
build I20040303
1) create a fresh workspace
2) show line number in java editor (Preferences>Java>Editor>Show line numbers
3) import all plugin as Binary projects with linked content
4) open CompletionEngine.class
5) add a breakpoint in CompletionEngine constructor
6) launch a Run-time Workbench in debug mode
7) create a class X
8) do ctrl+space inside this class
A breakpoint is hit
A CompletionEngine file is open but it's not the .class but the .java of the 
attached source.
The is not breakpoint in the left part of the editor and no line numbers.

summary: Workspace plugins ignored when relative path of workspace given
description:
I am doing self-hosting where my dev-ide is I20040226, and my target-ide is
I20040226 (seperate directories). When I launch my development workspace with
the -data <ws location> option, the plugins which I have in my workspace are
being ignored if I specify the relative location of <ws location>. It works fine
when I specify the absolute path for <ws location>. 

When the development workspace is launched with the relative path, and I launch
the target from it, I get the following message in my console :
Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/VE_3.0_M7/org.eclipse.myplugin
Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/VE_3.0_M7/org.eclipse.myplugin.A
.. etc.
and sure enough the plugins dont show up in the launched target. This works fine
when I specify the absolute path to the <ws location>.

summary: jardesc does not allow workspace-relative paths [jar creation]
description:
All path specifications in a jardesc require absolute paths.  This causes 
problems such as this scenario:

when we use cvs team integration, and we have different branches of the code 
line, we cannot use the same sandbox workspace folder name.  So for the trunk 
it might be called 'myworkspace_trunk' but on the new version branch it might 
be called 'myworkspace_v2-1_branch'.  Therefore a revision managed jardesc 
would have to be edited on each branch code line to use the folder name of the 
branch as part of the absolute path.

A Workspace-relative path could remove the need to specify the absolute path 
to the output jar, and internally resolve the absolute path of the workspace 
such that if I say staging/myproject.jar, the logic would be relative to the  
specific workspace directory.

It might be a nice addition to support Eclipse variables as well in the path, 
like ${WAS_HOME}/lib/myproject.jar

summary: StateBuilder should stop using Bundle-Name as bundle symbolic name
description:
i20040204

StateBuilder will default to use Bundle-Name header value as the bundle
description symbolic name. This field is free text, and can even be a
translation key.

summary: Get rid of callback server thread
description:
Get rid of the callback server thread and merge its function into the
REMMasterServerThread. This way we can get rid of one thread per registry for
callbacks.

The individual callback threads still exist.

summary: [EditorMgmt] Pressing 'Esc' while editor drop-down list is open kills the list
description:
I pressed 'Esc' key while editor area drop-down list was opened. I managed to 
kill (close & dispose) the list shell and I could not open it again. I had to 
restart Eclipse to restore it.

Expected behaviour: the list shell should be hidden but not closed and 
disposed completely.

summary: See who commited a file in the Compare Editor in Eclipse 3.0
description:
In Eclipse 2.1 I can see who commited a remote file in the Compare Editor (the 
one that opens when you double-click on a file name in the Synchronize View). 
It would be nice to have this in Eclipse 3 as well, otherwise I have to look at 
the revisions on the CVS server to see it.

summary: The Ctrl + Space
Add "Organize Package" or "Refactor/Copy..."
description:
Sometimes I need to duplicate code from one package a new version. So what I
really want is to be able to select all or some of the classes in a package,
right-click on the selection and choose "Refactor/Copy...", instead of
"Refactor/Move...". "Refactor/Copy..." would be the same as "Refactor/Move..."
but without deleting the source files.

Today, I create the new package dir and copy the .java files from one dir to the
other in the Resource perspective. I must then change each "package" statement,
granted I can do this with a Search and Replace, but at this point it would be
nice to right click on the selected files or package node and say "Organize
Package" such that Eclipse would then fix the package statements.

Thanks, Keep up the superbe work (I'm -1 non-platform UIs).
Version 3.0.m7.

summary: [New Look] Ensure we are using the latest look and feel on all platforms
description:
This bug serves to group problems relating to Eclipse not taking advantage of the latest look and feel 
on some platforms.

Generally, this is SWT's responsibility, but in some cases we in platform-ui are using valid but 
antiquated styles which can be improved upon at our end.

summary: implement State#compare
description: Implement State#compare.

summary: Cell Editors do not use dialog font [JUnit]
description:
Add Filter

The cell editor uses system default not the one used in the table.

summary: No smart semicolon when the selection is empty
description:
When the selection isn't empty then entering a semicolon should always replace 
the selection and not have the smart behaviour (i.e. jumping to the end).

summary: Team Refresh dialog; Preview Changes button does not set its size correctly
description: Use different dialog font.

summary: Compare window should use EAST_WEST cursor for sash
description:
The area between two panes is draggable with the mouse.  There is no 
indication to the user that this is possible.  It would make sense to use the 
platform EAST_WEST arrow cursor here.

(BTW, how do I do this with the keyboard??)

summary: [Dialogs] wrong search window size
description:
Two bugs shortly one after the other:

1. Bug

Seems like the (file) search window dynamically sizes 
(which is generally good, but only at unknown situations, 
don't have a screen-shot of that)
depending on the size of the marked text in the editor.
When it does so, all elements seems to scale/resize correctly!

If you have marked a long text passage the window even sizes 
bigger than the screen. Of course, that is not the best idea,
e.g. I can not reasonably select a history entry with the mouse,
because either the history button is out of the screen at the right or
the shown entries are out the screen at the left.

Seems as if someone has forgotten the restrict the automatically determined 
window size to a maximum. This does not mean that it should be 
impossible to make windows bigger than the screen MANUALLY.

2. Bug

The window elements are sized as if the window is very big,
but the outer window itself is not sized very big and
can not be resized manually, though the elements "are cut off" and
can not be seen and used (see screen shot).

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen

summary: Would be helpful if launch configurations were loaded with projects
description:
Consider defining the launch configurations on the project that contains the 
main / test class -- such that they are added to the launch configurations 
available when the project is loaded, and they are removed when the project is 
deleted.  This would also permit easier sharing.

summary: Remove JUnit FastView
description:
I find the fastview shortcut bar to be the biggest waste of space in the 
workbench.  At last, this bar disappears when it is not in use, but the 
default Java perspective brings it back by placing JUnit as a fast view.

AFAIK, this is the only case of default perspectives defining fast views.  
Would you consider removing it or stacking it somewhere. Better yet, open it 
as a fast view, but don't open the view until I launch a JUnit test. i.e., 
remove it from the perspective.

thanks.

summary: Error dialog pops up after cancelling a synchronization
description:
Using 0304, I got the following errors in the .log after cancelling a
synchronization operation.
This happened the first time I started a workspace that ran using M7 before
using 0304 build.
I will attach the .log file.

summary: Cannot remove comparisons
description:
I20040304

Now, whenever I use Team compare the result ends up in the synchronize view and
I can access them using the "Registered synchronize Partners" button. How can I
get rid of previous ones?

summary: Show Compare result in synchronize view not good (for me)
description:
I20040304

Since last I-build when I do a team compare I end up in the Synchronize view.

This new approach breaks my existing working style: instead of getting a compare
editor in the Java perspective where I develop code I am now forced to switched
to the CVS perspective where I have the Synchronize view.

What was the PR/feature request that caused this change and what is the benefit?

Note: even if this PR is closed as wontfix at least the name of the view should
change since compare and synchronize are two different things or (better) there
should be a separate (Team Compare) view.

summary: missing help
description:
I have a help plugin with the plugin.xml and toc files shown below.  If I 
bring up help, the book defined in toc.xml shows up
as well as tocs in other plugins that are linked to the "mainToc" anchor.  
However, the tocs in this plugin that are linked
to anchors defined in mainToc.xml do not show up.  They work OK in 2.1.2 and 
2.1.3.

plugin.xml toc extension:

   <extension point="org.eclipse.help.toc">
      <toc file="toc.xml" primary="true"/>
      <toc file="mainToc.xml"/>
      <toc file="tocguide.xml"/>
      <toc file="tocreference.xml"/>
   </extension>
   
   
toc.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?>
<toc label="Remote System Explorer Developer Guide" topic="toc.html">
   <topic label="Extending the RSE Perspective" href="rseToc.html">
   	  <link toc="mainToc.xml" />
   </topic>
   <anchor id="mainToc"/> 
</toc> 

mainToc.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?>
<toc>
   <topic label="Programmer's Guide">
      <anchor id="guide"/>
   </topic>
   <topic label="Reference">
      <anchor id="reference"/>
   </topic>
</toc>

tocreference.xml (doesn't show up)
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?>
<toc link_to="mainToc.xml#reference" label="Reference">
	<topic label="Extension Points Reference" href="reference/extension-
points/index.html">

href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/popupMenus.html" />

href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/propertyPages.html" />

href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/subsystemfactory.html" />
		<topic label="com.ibm.etools.systems.core.systemtype" 
href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/systemtype.html" />
	</topic>
...

summary: deleting elements in the outline asks for confirmation twice
description:
i20040304

Deleting Java outline elements is behaving in a weird way in this build.

I have a Java source open. I select some methods in the Outline view, and press
<Del>. A dialog opens saying "Are you sure you want to delete these <#elems>
elements?". I say "Yes", but the dialog opens for the second time. And while the
dialog is showing up, the elements are removed from the outline. Of course,
confirm the second deletion fails because the elemnts are not there anymore.

summary: When comparing with CVS, show the commit comment
description:
Now, when I want to sync with the CVS, I see the list of files,
and for each file I can double click on it and see the differences between my 
version and the version on CVS.

I would like to see the commit comment of the CVS version I compare with, 
especially when there are only incoming changes, or when there are conflicts.
(It is less informative to show the comment when there are only outgoing 
changes).

Genady

summary: [Repo View] Option for auto-refresh of tags
description:
I20040304

On our build machine we have the need load concrete versions of some projects.
Every time we do this we first have to refresh the tags since the new one isn't
in the list yet. A preference where I can select to automatically refresh that
list would be great.

summary: Source>Sort Members breaks code order dependencies
Hungry code assist (is eating characters)
description:
I200303040800 & HEAD

Using [backspace] when typing to select a code assist proposal deletes
characters after validation.

in the following ant file:

<project default="test">
	<tar
</project>

put the carret after '<tar', hit 'g' [backspace] 'g' [enter], the result is 

<project default="test">
	<target name=""></target>/project>

should be

<project default="test">
	<target name=""></target>
</project>

summary: 'Install Location' wizard page not working
description:
I200403040800
Linux-GTK

1. help>software updates>find and install
2. 'Search for new features to install'>next
3. add update site...> name:CDT
URL: http://update.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/updates/builds/2.0M7  > OK
select CDT>next
4. 'select all'>next
5. select 'I accept ...'>next
6. add site...>select a folder (~/tmp)>type the name of the folder you would
like to get created as an install site (eclipseSite) in the bottom text field >OK
nothing new appears in the 'install location' page

It's a real problem because CDT2.0 is now only available through install/update,
and people using a shared install of Eclipse have to create a new install location.

summary: New Test Case Wizard to be improved
Site editor: Added features should be published by default
description:
When adding features it is not intuitive that a context menu has to be run on 
each of the new features to make them visible for users. Who would add a 
feature without the intent to publish it??? Default behavior should be to 
publish new features. A wizard may make sense to ask if a new category should 
be created before publishing the features?

summary: Site editor: Added features should be published by default
description:
When adding features it is not intuitive that a context menu has to be run on 
each of the new features to make them visible for users. Who would add a 
feature without the intent to publish it??? Default behavior should be to 
publish new features. A wizard may make sense to ask if a new category should 
be created before publishing the features?

description:

summary: [EditorMgmt] List of opened files should close on second click in filename
description:
When using the new tabs I find myself clicking on the filename tab to show
openned files and see that a file I thought was open it isn't... My recorrent
behaviour is clicking on the filename expecting the list disapears, but it is
redrawn.
I think it should have a show/hide behaviour so that the list of openned files
closes on the second click in filename.

summary: Debugger Tab of launch configuration contains duplicate dialog titles
description:
1. Select Run->Run... from the main menu.
2. Select a preconfigured C/C++ local confiuration.
3. Click the Debugger tab. 
4. Click both Browse buttons.
They both bring up GDB command file dialog. One title should be changed to "GDB 
debugger".

summary: Eclipse throws NullPointerException on JDK 1.4.0
description:
When executed on a 1.4.0 Hotspot JRE, 3.0M7 throws a cryptic 
NullPointerException (somewhere in KeyBindings). The platform
never launches. Took a while to realize it was the wrong version
of JRE we're using.

This special case (JRE version) should be caught by the platform, or even 
earlier, by the eclipse.exe launcher?

summary: New Look: Editor seems always to have focus
description:
I20040304

The editor always has the bluw border and the blue tab even when it is inactive.
This results in having two blue framed things making it impossible to detect the
focus part.

summary: [breakpoints view] have an option to request feedback when deleting breakpoint with a condition/hit count
description:
it's very anoying if you - in the hurry of things - remove a breakpoint by 
accident with the del-key that has a complex condition.

it would be nice to have a feed back on the deletion of those breakpoints, à la 

this breakpoint has a condition/hit count. do you really want to remove it?
[remember my answer]

i dont think its necessery to have this feedback also wghen invoked via context-
menu

summary: Display Problem for Log Interactions View with a large number of records in correlation
description:
Linux - GTK
When correlating logs with a large number of records, the arrows, and dotted 
lines don't appear.
